Reviews.Title: “Sheer delight!”
Reviews.Author: Twotrainsrunning
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel and contrary to another reviewer, we loved Room 7. We purposefully selected a room on the canal, anticipating on a holiday weekend there would be some street noise. Not much noise and the joy of having a beer or glass of wine in your room canal-side was just what one dreams about when visiting Holland. All the rooms were beautiful, each one different, expensively appointed and lovely furnishings (ours had a few real antiques). A cozy room with a larger than usual bathroom (which would have benefited from a few towel racks), and plenty of surface space to arrange travel items. As other reviews have noted, the hotel is well-situated for walking access to nearly anywhere you would want to visit in the city. Added bonus: we were induced to walk so much that we both lost weight despite eating several pasta meals at the wonderful Italian restaurant, Ponte Acari, on the nearby corner. Pierre was very helpful, suggesting the best travel routes to museums and dining spots, arranging for taxis, dinner reservations. Narrow stairway added to the charm. Surprise breakfast on our final day provided us with enough food for the next 24 hours. We stayed five nights and would welcome a return. Final note: While the big museums are obvious attractions for hordes of tourists, also consider the Dutch Resistance Museum, a small gem that does a great job of portraying the difficulty of life under Nazi occupation. It's also a lovely amble from the hotel across the Amstel River right near the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Donald B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in canal view 6 -- great view. The hotel has a great location near shops/trams,

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ruthiffer
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Seven Bridges. It is in a great location-near many bars and restaurants and shopping. We could walk almost anywhere. The owners are wonderful, friendly and very helpful. There is a fridge in the room and Internet access as well! We would definitely recommend this accommodation to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “quirky and eccentric with a good location”
Reviews.Author: trippin_maggie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the middle of the week in March 2012. Most of the buildings in Amsterdam are leaning and this hotel was also slightly titled. The matress was comfortable, the reception was welcoming, the staircase is a very narrow spiral staircase with red carpeting and we walked up 2 or 3 flights to room 7. Rooom 7 faced the canal, for future visits I think I would choose to save money and face the gardenside because we didn't spend much time in the room. I felt the location was great but I thought the price was high (155 Euros/$190US a night). The room was clean and functioned but cosmetically it was a combination of old & new tile in the bath, an antiquated velour/velvet bedspread, and plain furniture. I have only stayed in one other hotel in Amsterdam so it's hard to say whether this is normal or subpar. On our last visit (New Year's 2007) we stayed at Hotel Rembrandt and I felt it was a better value. I wouldn't dismiss this hotel because it was quirky an eccentric, but was surprised it was so heavily reviewed on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: PSEBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the garden side, room 8. It was nice and quiet at night. The room was a good size with a nice table so you can bring home food if you don't feel like eating out. If you do eat out, we would recommend the Italian Restaurant one block north of the hotel. We also like the village bagel shop for breakfast in the morning. They provide 2 laptops to guests to borrrow so if you don't bring your own, you can still get connected. The staff was super helpful at making suggestions and answering all our many questions. This is our second stay here and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at charming canal house”
Reviews.Author: Karslima
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel in early March for four nights. We stayed in a room in the first/ground floor which was very spacious. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom/toilet was on the narrow side but everything worked well with the supplies and ample hot water. Like all traditional homes by the canal, this hotel has a very steep staircase and I could only imagine how very difficult it would be to go up with a heavy suitcase or for an elderly person. The ground floor room was quiet enough and the hotel itself is located in a pretty canal street and has more of residential feel (Reguliersgracht). It is also very conveniently located from Amsterdam Centraal station and a quick 15 minute tram ride to the museums (e.g. Van Gogh, Rijksmuseum,etc.). In addition, the hotel is withing walking distance to several good restaurants serving a wide range of cuisines (e.g. Italian, Indonesian, etc.) especially along Utrechtstracht. Seven Bridges offers free wi-fi for guests if they need it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: leoleoleoleo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to everything in Amsterdam. I walked to the museums, to the train station, the center of town - everywhere. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom, steep stiars. Great ambiance. Coffee shops/ bakeries open late in the morning and there was not one close to the hotel, so I would reccommend taking the owners up on their offer to deliver you breakfast in your room. Very clean and bright room facing the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Quiet - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: aswilkin
Reviews.Content: While in Brussels, Belgium, we decided upon Seven Bridges and the morning of our travels to Amsterdam. They had one room left in the "annex" building on the ground floor. It was very roomy, comfortable and QUIET. We were right around the corner from Rembrandt's Square and a Super Market as well as being right on a canal. For the quiet, solitude, cleanliness of the room and hospitality, we had no complaints w/our accommodations and would definitely recommend. This room also had a closet kitchenette, very cute! Great decor, but again, mostly...the QUIET! A nice escape after walking all day touring about.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: anne s
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Seven Bridges Hotel in Amsterdam, in Canal Suite C. The room is in the house next door to the hotel, we received a very warm welcome The suite has a sitting room to the front overlooking the canal, with bedroom and bathroom to the rear of the house. The furniture decor and fittings were lovely, some beautiful antiques. Great to have the bedroom to the rear, lovely and quiet. The location of the hotel is perfect, just one block from tram stop, with lots of good restaurants nearby. Easy to find a good base for discovering Amsterdam We would definitely stay again, lovely lovely lovely

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at someone's home”
Reviews.Author: carzim59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a few quirks when reserving...no online booking, call or fax only with your info, strict cancellation policies, etc. The info they post about their hotel is very straightforward in the sense that if you don't like how they run their hotel, you don't need to stay there. So, go into your Seven Bridges stay completely informed. And, choose your room wisely. The stairs are insane. I watched the video another reviewer has posted and they are no joke. Carrying any more than a weekend bag up those stairs could be a nightmare. My friend and I stayed in Room 4 because it offered the cheapest rates and we didn't have to use the stairs. The room is as pictured on the hotel website. It is about a standard size for most European hotels. It looks out onto a small garden. The mattress is really comfortable and the temperature of the room was comfortable considering the cold February temperatures outside. The bathroom was small and the water pressure a little low, but it was clean. You could occasionally hear other guests in the morning shuffling about. Free wifi is available with directions in the room as to how to access the internet. It is, however, a bit on the slow side, but free internet nonetheless, which I really appreciate when traveling. TV has mostly Dutch channels, but a couple of English stations are available. The staff was friendly, held our bags at both the beginning and end of our stay, offered us outlet adaptors when our Italian plugs didn't fit, suggested dining spots, and called a taxi for us. All in all...we really liked it. It feels more like staying at a friends' house than a hotel. It has a charming feel. Room 4 in February for 4 nights cost us â‚¬100 per night. The location is fantastic. Just a few blocks away were plenty of eating spots for every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully charming”
Reviews.Author: SMBtravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Suite C Feb 18th weekend. The view over the canal was wonderful. The room was charming and while the buidling and furniture were from another period, the room amenties were modern. The bed was tempurpedic,a/c unit in the room, coffee supplies, bathroom amenties, new TV, even a mid size refrigerator if we decided to go to the store for food supplies. The suite C contained a bedroom plus sitting room. Certainly more room than a standard hotel room. One word of caution: steep stairway to the room so do not bring a heavy suitcase. No issues for us with our weekend bag.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful comfortable eccentric hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corcaioch1955
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful eccentric hotel, an experience in its own right. The bedrooms are extremely comfortable, almost opulent. Our was furnished with art-deco fittings, including a table from the famous Cafe Slavia in Prague where Franz Kafka used to eat. The hotel is close to anything you might want to visit in Amsterdam and surrounded by restaurants and cafe. Our window looked out on a tranquil canal. There's one of Amsterdam's famous 'coffee shops' nearby. I can't recommend Hotel Seven Bridges enough. By the way, the breakfast is expensive but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Mickgas
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for a quick weekend get a way. Stayed in room 4. Found the hotel exactly as I expected from its site. Loved it and will be back

Reviews.Title: “Another Stay”
Reviews.Author: jimjeff
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam on January 1st and stayed four nights. Once again the Seven Bridges was as wonderful as ever. While you won't find big hotel amenities here what you will find is that you are staying in an Amsterdam canal house. It's kind of like having your own studio apartment, living in an incredible building. All of the rooms that we have stayed in are spacious. Since we experienced two days of torrential rain it was great to have a room where you could actually sit and relax, taking the occasional break from the storm. If this appeals to you it's a great place to stay. One word of advice is that if you're not walkers and most of what you plan to do is on the other end of the canals you may want to find a hotel closer to that area and while you may find something equally charming, my experience is that it will be at a much higher price. Over the years of staying here we have become acquainted with the owners and have found them, and their staff, to be incredibly helpful yet wonderfully unobtrusive. If you want advice and recommendations you will probably need to ask.

Reviews.Title: “A honey moon delight”
Reviews.Author: icbernard
Reviews.Content: Not all rooms are alike. We had number 5. It was feeling like home, except that this room is much much nicer than home, furnished with nice antiques. A mixture of different periods, but nicely done. There is a small terrace accessed through the bathroom, overlooking a small garden. This is the kind of room you don't want to leave. Don't except a hotel attitude, or full service. It is more like living in someone's place. Jut enjoy it. Did I mention the two Empire mirrors facing each other? There are thousands of you when you are on the bed :-)

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: APMoscow
Reviews.Content: it's a beautiful building and everything, but for some reason our impressions spolied a bit when we moved in and it's hard to understand why.. Maybe we had expected something outstanding for #2 rated hotel in Amsterdam. Maybe one needs a 24 hour reception, maybe minibar full of drinks and breakfasts on the ground floor. It dooes feel good though whn you take a canal boat excursion and the boat stops right next to your hotel and they say that it's one of the most beautiful spots for the whole excursiion.. Maybe we were wrong choosing the top floor (yes we had known about the steep stairway), but indeed it's only annoying whne carrying luggage i.e. on the first and (more important) last days of one's trip. Anyway, the presonnel was very friendly and helpful and i guess we would need to stay at another hotel to fully understand the difference.. And lastly despite what i said, indeed I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great local flavor”
Reviews.Author: stephensonlo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven Bridges was the ONLY bed and breakfast type place we booked in Europe - we usually stay in more "full service" properties. That said, this place was fantastic. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable (had one of those "temperpedic" type foam mattresses), we loved the residential feel of the location near Rembrant Square and that it was more out of the way than places closer to Dam Square. We were in room 4 so we didn't have any problems with stairs like some other people complained about, but it is on the same level as reception so if you want to sleep late there is a little bit of hallway noise from people coming and going. The reception/staff was pretty much non-existant, but we didn't care about that at all. When we arrived we got checked in without delay, and then the gentleman promptly told us where we could get breakfast for 1E and we should do this instead of having him do our breakfast for 12E. (OK, I get it - you don't want to go out and shop for my breakfast. No problem.) Upon check out, they called us a cab for the airport the evening before we departed and got a 35E rate on the trip to the airport. A good deal considering our trip in was a little over 50E. Make sure you read all their Info on their website and you won't be dissappointed. I find that most of the things that people are complaining about on this forum are things they address on their website including the narrow stairs, not having people on staff 24/7, and cancelation and booking policies, etc. The coffeeshops and restaurants in the immediate area were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Spanimita
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! My brother booked this place based on tripadvisor. We stayed for two nights. It was great! Great location, clean, quaint, and great customer service!!! I will definitely book this place again when I return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie B
Reviews.Content: We loved Amsterdam. We were there 5 nights and staying at the Hotel Seven Bridges made our visit fantastic! The hotel is located in a quiet picturesque canal neighborhood just a few blocks from Rembrandtpleinâ€¦where you can quickly jump into the hub of the cityâ€™s activity. The train/bus stop is also just a block or so away. Itâ€™s worth getting a metro card so you can jump on the tram when you get tired of walking. Pierre, Gunter, and Erik were wonderful hosts. They were very helpful in providing information about the city and help with specific questions/directions. When we arrived at the hotel, Eric greeted us and provided an overview of the city along with a map. We stayed in Garden Rm 4 and our accommodations included a large room that was just as it looks on the website. It was bright, clean, nicely decorated, and had large window looking out into a garden. The room included a TV, Radio, and free internet. The bed had a tempur-pedic style mattress that was very comfortable. The bathroom comes with a lot of hot water! We didnâ€™t opt for the daily breakfast, but were generously provided a complimentary breakfast on our last day. I can say that it was fabulousâ€¦delicious and plentifulâ€¦included pastries, yogurt, cheese, meat, juice, and coffee. I advise getting it! There are many great restaurants in the neighborhood and within walking distance from the hotel, specially the Tapas restaurant just a few doors down from the hotel. There are also 2 canalside homes that have been turned into museums and within a block from the hotel. If you have the time, stop in to see the Museum Van Loom. Itâ€™s impressive. We enjoyed our stay in Hotel Seven Bridges and meeting Pierre, Gunter, and Erik.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhony
Reviews.Content: Excellent romantic hotel be sure to get canal side room.

Reviews.Title: “Thirty years on..........”
Reviews.Author: sheila w
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home to Edinburgh from a nostalgic trip down memory lane to the Seven Bridges hotel in Amsterdam where I stayed with my boyfriend (now husband and father of our 6 kids!) thirty years ago. The hotel was as charming and delightful and as quintessentially Dutch (rather on the Bohemian side!) as it was thirty years ago. Our hosts, Pierre and Gunter couldn't have been more welcoming from the beautiful bouquet of roses on our arrival in our room to lending us brollies, use of Gunter's own mobile 'phone to call home to Scotland, advice on where to eat out locally and numerous directions to loads of tourist attractions - also use of two laptops in the evening (ideal for my 3 teenage kids). Our rooms were immaculate and had a real air of the 'Grand European tour' with amazing antique furniture and fittings. Pierre and Gunter were real gentlemen - courteous and considerate - two colourful characters who gave us the opportunity to experience living in an authentic canalside house dating back hundreds of years. I cannot recommend this unique hotel highly enough where you can be assured of a fabulous and memorable stay in beautiful, artistic and comfortable surroundings - I'm already planning my next visit in my head which will hopefully not be as long as another 30 years away! In this modern age where the ubiquitous, non-descript and homogeneous seems to be the norm it is so refreshing to step into a world full of character and stay with folk who really care.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Amsterdam experience complete with steps....”
Reviews.Author: littlelittlegreenbag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week at Seven bridges in July when attending a conference. We found it be a great base to explore the city and surrounds as well get to the RAI Conference center when we needed. We stayed in the attic room facing the rear, right up the top of the stairs. The room was clean, very 'amsterdam' in terms of the attic location, angled roof and interior decoration. The bathroom was of an adequate size, fantastic water pressure and there was enough space for the two of us to relax at the end of the day. The steps were steep but only added to the feel of the place - there are rooms without steps or only a flight or two. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. Very close to all the old city sites but far enough away from the action to appreciate the serenity. We would stay here again if visiting amsterdam and really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely B&B, but beware of the steps....”
Reviews.Author: eastporter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights, in a canalside room at the front, on the second (their first) floor; the room was lovely, but it did get noisy sometimes late at night, with partiers going by on boats. The staff was very helpful, and the location is great. One caveat - the rooms are up a very steep and windy stairway, and there's no elevator because it's a historic building. Don't bring heavy luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lee r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a 25th Anniversary trip to Europe, and ended with a stay in Amsterdam at this very-welcoming Hotel. The location was fantastic, the Hotel owner and tiny staff could not have been nicer, and the accommodations--we asked for and received a canal view room on the third floor-- was quintessential Amsterdam. The only draw back---and it was not a draw back for us at all--is that the stairs to the third floor are very steep. People who do not like to climb steep stairs should go elsewhere. Although the hotel serves a breakfast, it recommends a 1 Euro special two blocks away that was more than fine, and what a bargain. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWahine
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on a recommendation from a friend who wanted to stay there but there were no vacancies. The location was really perfect for us. Quiet, scenic, clean, tasteful, close to places to shop and eat. The hosts couldn't have been better. I loved the generous, delicious breakfasts and enjoyed it that the china changed daily. We walked many places in this city and were always happy to return home to Seven Bridges. When we return to Amsterdam, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty rooms, friendly owner”
Reviews.Author: JellyBaby24
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 5 nights, based on other TripAdvisor reviews, and had a lovely time. The location is very central: you can walk everywhere, or if youâ€™re tired or itâ€™s raining, you can get the tram â€“ the stop is just a few minutes away. The owner was friendly and polite. Our room (Room 10) was on the top floor, and although we had cases to carry up, this wasnâ€™t a problem. The room was pretty and cosy, and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Some of the larger and more expensive rooms on the other floors were open as we walked downstairs â€“ they looked gorgeous. The photos you see on the hotel website are accurate, so as other reviewers have said â€“ have a look there before you choose a room. We decided not pay for breakfast as we thought it was a bit expensive at â‚¬12.50 each. It seems that this is pretty much the norm in Amsterdam though - our friends were in a nearby hotel and it was the same there. We had no problem finding breakfast elsewhere, and we quickly discovered a lovely little cafÃ© 10 minuteâ€™s walk away which served amazing granola and honey with strawberries, as well as pastries and coffee. On the last day, we woke up to an absolute downpour. We had only been staring miserably out the window for 10 minutes, when the owner phoned our room. He didnâ€™t want us to have to go outside in the rain to get breakfast on our last day, so he offered us a free breakfast in our room. We eagerly accepted. When he came up, we understood why it usually costs 12 euro - a basket of pastries, a large caffetiere of fresh coffee, a selection of fruit, bread, jams, ham, cheeses, yogurts â€“ the works! If we had bought that amount of food and coffee in a cafÃ©, we would definitely have paid more. It was the perfect end to a great holiday, so thank you again! I would love to go back to the Seven Bridges, and next time I would probably order breakfast on any rainy day! Liked - the considerate owner, and the dÃ©cor Disliked - nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Amsterdam Location”
Reviews.Author: Olema_CAHappyCamper
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this wonderful hotel. The location is ideal for anyone wanting to explore this exciting city. It's located in a quiet canal neighborhood with views of "seven bridges", and within easy walking distance of public transportatioin, good resturants, and "Rembrandtplein", a great little park, with several outdoor street cafes, colorful people, and music. The hotel itself is clean, well run, and has lots of character. My room overlooked a garden, and provided a relaxing oasis at the end of a busy day. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and private”
Reviews.Author: Arabella035
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we've ever stayed in in Amsterdam. The rooms (we stayed in two rooms over the course of our stay, thanks to a very gracious upgrade we were offered and accepted) were beautifully furnished, and had comfortable beds and charming views. Great location with lots of good, non-touristy neighborhood restaurants and fun shopping street (Utrechtstraat) a block away. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Treworder
Reviews.Content: If you would like a small wonderfully furnished small hotel situated on a quiet canal and quite central for both the Dam and the Rijksmusuem then the Seven Bridges is the place for you. We spent three nights in a canal view room and found it to be all that other trip advisor members had said, Whilst there are no public rooms as such, breakfast can be served either in the room or there are many small cafes and coffee houses close by. There were also in our room two comfortable chairs and a table around which we could sit and enjoy a glass of wine or just watch the activity on the canal The proprietors were helpful and always available to answer any queries.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect. Just Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: AFM20
Reviews.Content: It was my 1st trip to Europe. I was nervous. Organising the trip had been overwhelming. I felt fraught and anxious until my check-in. The rooms they ( Pierre, Gunter & Erik) had set aside for me were extraordinary. The atmosphere calm. The furnishings beautiful. Every day the room was cleaned, fresh ground coffee refilled, dishes done, bed made. The aspect over the canal was a picture postcard in itself. I felt at home, safe and private, and excited each time I returned after a day out. Fabulous value compared with other B & Bs in any other part of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: toxicmd
Reviews.Content: No surprises from previous reviews. Hotel is a converted row house. Location is a quiet canal street close to Rembrant Square, Longish walk to Central station and the Red light district. We stayed in room 7 which has the canal view. About 200 sq. ft. and so slightly small given the over sized furniture. Other rooms are larger with out that view. You can reserve the room you want. For elderly and infirn the 2 flight steep stair may be a problem. Comfortable bed and nice strong shower. Air conditioning that works well. Helpful staff. We dont eat breakfast (which may be why we have been able to stay slim). The cost - about 150 Euro/d is about right. From airport take the train to central station and from there ask for a tram that goes to Rembrandt square- got off and walk 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth it!”
Reviews.Author: sally0025
Reviews.Content: It gives me an overall idea of old Dutch hotel, the service is warm and friendly. Only thing you need to notice is not to bring an oversized luggage, otherwise it will be very hard to pass through the narrow stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Toledo4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two teenage daughters had the pleasure of stayng at Seven Bridges. The location is perfect. Easy walking distance to VanGogh and Rijk museum, beautiful quiet view of canals but close to night life and close to trams. The gentlemen that operated the establishment were very accomodating. They provided a choice of rooms once we arrived to accomodate the four of us. Made sure we had a taxi when we left and always asked if we needed anything. Flowers in the room for my wife and daughters was a nice touch. Very much enjoyed their company and they pride they have in Seven Bridges. If you enjoy a quiet, clean and quaint stay, not a big size hotel, this is definitely the place. Will definitely stay here gain upon our return.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: InternationalHorizon
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor helped my wife and I find the Seven Bridges and we are so glad. We just ended our 4-night stay in the Garden Room 5 and are pleased to say that the room and assistance of the Hotel staff was exceptional. I am one who seeks luxury and good value. The Seven Bridges serves these characteristics wonderfully. Exquisite furnitings and built-ins and tasteful decor matched with the charm of a canal-front townhouse in the ideal location cannot be found for a comparable price in this city. Do your research and you will agree.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: viking100
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 nights at the 7 Bridges Hotel (Canal View Room 7). The hotel is everything others have written and more. It is ideally located just near Rembrandt Square and operated by very helpful and accommodating owners. My room was large and well-decorated with a nice view over the canal. Free wi-fi was available. The stairs certainly are steep but this is a canal house. Why anyone would choose to stay at any of the large chain hotels when properties like this are available is beyond me. This an excellent choice and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Gheswhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in the beginning of May in room ten. We are light sleepers and appreciated how quiet it was. Room ten is on the top floor with windows on three sides so that we could have fresh air all night and a lovely garden view in the day. The location in this lovely walking city is perfect. We appreciated having all those stairs to climb up in an otherwise flat landscape. The room is cozy, and we prefer charm to grand, so it was perfect. The bed was the perfect cure for jet lag. The staff was extremely helpful and lovely. We will always treasure our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Nomen_Nescio74
Reviews.Content: Reading all the positive reviews, there's not much I can add, except that they are all true. All the little details in service show that the guest is of paramount importance at the Seven Bridges. The beautiful rooms, the great breakfasts and the central location make this a great place. Pierre and Gunter make this hotel a very special place in Amsterdam that I always love to return to and I always refer to it as our home in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: goworldmtl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Seven Bridges for 4 nights at the end of May and I only have nice things to say about this place! The room was beautiful, with huge windows, a very confortable foam bed and amazing antiques. I was in room no 4. If you don't want to deal with the steep stairs, take this room, it's on the ground floor. Everything was very clean. The hosts were very friendly, they even lent me a vase when I bought flowers for my room. As soon as I arrived, they gave me a map and gave me suggestions as to where I could have breakfast and where to have dinner. They also provide guests with laptops that you can bring to your room for an hour, free of charge. The hotel is right on the canal, it's really nice and quiet. And it's in walking distance of everything. Really no need to use the public transport if you like walking. Going to the Centraal Station takes 30 minutes (when carrying a very heavy suitcase so probably less is your hands are free!). The only thing I guess is the lack of pressure in the shower. But I guess that's to be expected in an old house and it's also a bit tricky to adjust to proper water temperature. But really, that is not a reason not to go. This is a great place and anyone will be happy there. Make sure the hosts tell you where HEMA is. The kind of store where you can buy food quickly, juice, croissant, sandwich, beer, wine, whatever. It's very practical. And right next to it is another store specializing in TO GO food. Rembrandtplein is full of restaurants and the street right behind the hotel too. I enjoyed the Cafe l'Opera on Rembrandtplein. Quiet, nice music and good food. Great terrasse. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely go there again. I felt like being at home.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful Canalside Room Decorated with Lovely Antiques”
Reviews.Author: AaronFWA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 days. We were in room 7, with a lovely view of the canal. The canal view room just below us seemed quite attractive as well, but perhaps not quite as large. The inn provides a lovely location for sightseeing and dining while in Amsterdam. (Be sure to buy a bus pass for the number of days you are staying in the city.)Would highly recommend the Seven Bridges.We did not choose to purchase the breakfast option so we cannot attest one way or the other re it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a relaxing stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cbukowski
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were meeting each other in Amsterdam after her study abroad in Nepal. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect place to spend three days together. The staff was so friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and airy. My daughter of course was thrilled to have a flush toilet in the room and be able to drink water from the tap after living in a village in rural Nepal. Even though we did not have a canal view, the view of the garden was very pretty. We were surprised how quiet it was and how close to so many great places to see and eat we were. If you can handle the steep stairs going up and down, the Seven Bridges is really a superb place to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna_apo
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Seven Bridges Hotel in the Garden Room 10 as was the only one available, which was amazing!! We truly felt like home. Extremely clean, warm ambiance, helpful receptionist, good location, everything was just PERFECT!! I would definitely come again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdbram”
Reviews.Author: Florencegordon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Amsterdam for the first time and were so happy that we discovered the Seven Bridges Hotel. What a joy to stay in a canal house 300 years old. We were in Room C in the annex next door and felt like it was our own apartment. We had keys to the front door and we were able to come and go as we pleased. It is very near Rembrandtplein where there are clubs, restaurants and lots of activity. The management was helpful, cordial, and very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGirlLB
Reviews.Content: I meant to review this a while back...we were here in Spring 2010. What a charming little hotel in a great location. We could only afford the cheapest room (up three or four flights of narrow stairs), but if you are fit it is actually quite fun...very top of an old canal house. The decor and furniture were very 'old amsterdam', and the staff were always helpful. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “One Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmcgunagle2005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 15th anniversary and we couldn't have found a better place to stay. If you have trouble with steep stairs best to ask for a lower room such as room 4. Because of the holidays we had to switch rooms in the middle of our stay but both rooms were great, the bathrooms were absolutely spotless, the rooms were decorated beautifully and the hotel was very close to just about everything, including several cafes just two blocks away, great for sipping coffee and watching Amsterdam go by. The staff was very friendly and we were asked by everyone we came in contact with in the hotel how we liked our stay. We will defiantly stay here again on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quaint 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kamoshika
Reviews.Content: This is a nice 3-star hotel; stayed in Garden Room 8, which is two flights up from the ground floor. Two double beds, one on each side of the room. Paid Euro 110/night in mid March. Pros: Spacious; quiet; clean; good, wireless Internet (free); good location (five-minute walk to two tram stops; could walk all the way to Amsterdam Centraal in probably 35 minutes); friendly staff Cons: Breakfast costs 12.50 euros extra; slightly overpriced (by about the price of the breakfast or a little more); steep, winding, narrow staircase; no elevator; tiny shower; no small fridge; no hot water pot. Would stay here again if I couldn't find a cheaper alternative that was as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Buzzards
Reviews.Content: We chose the Seven Bridges after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were looking for a smaller hotel with a more intimate feeling and it didn't disappoint. It felt very much like a home away from home complete with your own front door key! The gentlemen that greeted us on arrival was friendly and helpful and immediately gave us a map and showed us some of the key landmarks. We stayed in room 10 up in the roof which was cosy and peaceful. The room was extremely comfortable and we slept well throughout. The location of the hotel is great, a stone's through from supermarkets and shops and Rembrandt Plein but in a quiet residential street. We found some great little restaurants on Utrechstrasse which is 5 mins away. All in all we had a great week in Holland and would recommend Seven Bridges as a base from which to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in the ground floor room of the "annex" building. This room does not have breakfast delivery, but it does have a tiny little kitchen in a closet. It was perfect for my needs. There is a supermarket right around the corner and I was able to stock up and make my own breakfast (coffee is provided by the hotel). Because it was chilly, I wasn't tempted to open my window. I could see how this room might be problematical in the warmer weather for a light sleeper. It's not to say that the surroundings are noisy. They are not. But, being at street level enables you to hear conversations in progress as people walk by. My room was cute and comfortable. I appreciated the free wifi very much. The owners were very patient and helpful, answering all my questions and helping me get oriented. The local was absolutely perfect for me, located midway between two museum locations. I walked most everywhere, but did take the tram back to the train station after my stay. The hotel is a block or two from major tram lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cstoltzfus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 5 and loved it. The location is great and walking distance to everything. Very close to Rembrandt square.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: bryn_evans
Reviews.Content: Really just adding this to endorse what other people have said. Lovely place to stay and perfect location. Friendly reception on arrival then largely left to our own devices. Some tea/coffee making in the room would be a nice touch but maybe that is not done in Amsterdam? We stayed in Room 9 (attic) which was quirky but nice and immaculately clean. The only problem was the racket at 3 or 4 in the morning when I guess the nearby coffee bar closed but not a big deal. Room 5 looks great. One non-hotel but relevant comment. The Italian restaurant on the corner towards Rembrandtplein has previously been recommended but we found the food fairly ordinary and the service a bit offhand, maybe we went on a bad night. Great family Tapas Bar on Halvaamansteeg just off Rembrandtplein (receipt lost so can't recall name!).

Reviews.Title: “Quirky place to stay, quiet but a short tram trip to everything”
Reviews.Author: BOAKiwi
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Amsterdam and stayed in this cool wee hotel, right on a canal. We were in the 'house next door ' so no breakfast was offered, but 4-5 minutes walk to HEMA in Rembrandt Square, where it's dead cheap for breakfast, we paid 4.50e for 2 of us for a breakfast plus a big punnet of fresh fruit. We were in Room C which was lovely, huge big windows in the sitting room, could sit and watch the world go by. Very quiet but minutes walk to square above, and only 4 stops from Central Train Station. Lots of really good restaurants all around and a supermarket around the corner to stock up on snacks and wine....perfect ! Loved staying there, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “after my sixth stay this remains my favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: cherylRedwoodValley
Reviews.Content: On a quiet canal, yet walking distance to Museumplein, to Damplatz, close to trams, the flowermarket, performing arts center, great shopping, the red zone, this hotel is beautifully furnished with lovely antiques, fabrics and art. My six stays have put me in several different rooms, all well-appointed, lovely to look at, and comfortable. For two, Room 5 cannot be equalled; have stayed in room 5 when just myself for the lovely private terrace. The breakfast delivered to your room (warms croissants & scones, fresh bread, cheese and ham, yoghurt and fruit, great tea and coffee) every morning is heaven. . Like staying in a wealthy relation's Dutch mansion. The owners are very charming - their hotel is so well-staffed - it is a classy place to call home in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming canal-side hotel with a unique atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: StockersAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last night on my own (I'm a female traveller and quite safety conscious) and I loved it there. It's elegant, without being at all fancy. The room was lovely, very old school and comfortable, with a big bed, antique furniture and few frills (a nice new TV, an vintage radio and a fridge, not much else in the room, but what else do you need?) but the view - wow. Incredible. The hotel's situated on a gorgeous central Canal, and it's so achingly pretty you can't believe you're really there. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful and I loved my stay there, shame it was just for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful canal hotel as good as it gets !”
Reviews.Author: SFCottage
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a special break and could not have found anywhere better, even if we had paid alot more. The owner let as look at the different rooms as they became empty and they were all so fabulous . Stunning antique and carefully chosen furniture and fabrics. Very cosy too. The owner was very kind and helpful. If you want to save some money you can get a big breakfast nearby for just 1 Euro per person ( the owner will tell you where to go ). Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet little corner of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gatorpozz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in room 9 which is located on the top floor for 3 nights. The room overlooked a canal and was very charming. The room was not particularly large but had an old world charm with wooden beams running throughout the room. The bathroom was large with plenty of space and very clean. Be warned that the winding staircase is almost like climbing a ladder to your room so that may be an issue for some people. The hotel owners are warm and welcoming. They have umbrellas to loan out to guest and are very helpful with suggestions for sightseeing and food. The beds are memory foam and we slept very well on them. The hotel is located away from the red light district and therefore is not surrounded by lots of tourist or noise. It is on a quiet street and yet only a short walk to Rembrandt plaza for food and drinks. The hotel is located between the museum district and the red light district and it takes about 15 minutes to walk to either. The central station is about a 20 minute walk. A tram stops a block from the hotel and that is an option if you don't want to walk and the owners will direct you to which tram to take from the central station. Breakfast is offered for 12 Euros but we declined that service. It smelled good though. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tastful, spacious and clean rooms - hospital owners”
Reviews.Author: Christian10021974
Reviews.Content: Stayed there alone in a business trip. I had room A, which is adjacement to where the reception and most other rooms are found. Room A is virtually underground, so you do not really see the canal. However, you have adequate light. It is a The room was nicely decorated and had a kitchen. No breakfast is available, but everything is within walking distance, including convenience shops. It is essentially a self-catering studio flat. For one day I had to hospice a colleague of mine. The owner brought an extra bed and beddings, and charged nothing for that! The hotel is close to Rembrandt Square (two to three minutes walk) and provides access to everything. Overall an excellent stay. Shame that Amsterdam seems to be changing and not to the better...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, warmly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Magmatt
Reviews.Content: We - family with a 12 and a 7 year old - stayed in room 8, with the boys sharing one of the two double beds. The location is fantastic, close enough to the centre and Rembrandt Square to be convenient for shops, restaurants and bars, an easy walk from the main museums and literally 200 metres or so from the Hermitage. And yet not too close to the "wild" type of fun Amsterdam can offer but is best enjoyed without kids... The hotel was impeccably clean, the room spacious enough and pleasantly decorated, with a view over back gardens (therefore quiet). Everything worked, the manager was friendly and took the initiative of calling us in advance to describe the room to us. The only downside was a bed which sloped a bit to the middle. Plus, as in much of central Amsterdam, the stairs are long and not for the faint-hearted; and there is no common area (breakfast is only served in the rooms). But definitely a very good experience. The hotel's website is also well made and has a detailed description of each room.

Reviews.Title: “Left Home sick”
Reviews.Author: mathans
Reviews.Content: Its one of those places you feel If I lived there or was my home there. Great hotel. Loved the neighbour hood. the views, the restaurants and the canals and the old world charm. Will definitely come back this way soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not wanting to leave.....”
Reviews.Author: Psycuestra
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful spot! I sit writing this review on the day we are leaving, from my vantage point overlooking the canal from the living room window. Great location, great neighborhood restaurants and easy access to many places to see the sights and attractions. (Even walking in below freezing temperatures while it was snowing was spectacular.) Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, elegant charm, intersection of 2 canals, old houses, antiques”
Reviews.Author: svyoung
Reviews.Content: At the intersection of the Herrengracht and Reguliersgracht (2 beautiful canals, both clearly visible), across the street from 250 year old houses, 1.5 blocks from Rembrandtplein, 1 block parallel to Utrechstraat (local, high-class neighborhood street with tramline), pleasant 15 minute walk to big art museums, 15 minutes in opposite direction from red-light and other tourist ghettos, lots of restaurants, cafes, antique shops, art galleries and even a nice neighborhood coffeeshop (Barney's Lounge) next door where you can legally smoke cannabis. Canal-side rooms are somewhat noisy due to street traffic (not cars and trucks but people, walking and talking and sometimes singing, late at night, after having done what one does in Amsterdam - rooms come equipped with ear plugs anyway), but worth enduring the noise for the views and the winter afternoon sunlight. Especially Room 7, with it's mirrors and a bank of windows across the entire front face of the house, though 6 is probably the same. Room 5 is amazing looking, on garden side, huge, filled with classic antiques. The gentlemen at the front desk (which is really a half doorway into a sitting room they occupy during the day), are friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, generous and, naturally, speak perfect English. There is no sitting room or lobby, but very good wi-fi in the rooms. 10 minutes to opera and other music, plus funky 'thieves' market (the place to buy a cheap bike) and Rembrandt's house at Waterlooplein. Really, couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel that's close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Craig1963
Reviews.Content: I found this delightful hotel on Trip Advisor, and after reading the numerous glowing reviews of it and seeing the hotel more closely on its own website, booked Room Six for a week. I was in Amsterdam for a few days attending a trade show before my wife joined me for a quiet weekend away. In view of the glowing reviews and attractive website, I had high expectations upon arrival - all of which were completely exceeded. Booking by email was a breeze, and Mr. Glaner was very patient to answer my many questions about access to the convention centre, nearby restaurants, and such. Upon arriving in Amsterdam, I followed the simple directions I was given and made my way to the hotel by public transit in just a few minutes. My immediate impression upon arriving was 'holy cow!' The hotel is set in the most beautiful street imaginable, right in the heart of Amsterdam's historic canal district. Everywhere you look, the view is right off a post card. Checking is was quick and simple, then I was show the room and given a quick orientation. Room Six is right at the front, overlooking the canal, and the view is absolutely out of this world. The room was absolutely spotless, the furnishings exactly as shown and described, and the only real surprise was how quiet it was when you closed the double-pane window. The hotel advises that rooms overlooking the canal also overlook a street, and can be noisy. I expect it might be difficult to sleep with the windows open in summer, but since I was visiting in November, that was not an issue whatsoever. I slept like a baby and my wife, a notorious light sleeper, had no issues either. We did not partake in the optional room service breakfast each morning, so can't say what that was like. But in every other way, the hotel was simply wonderful. The English leather club chairs in my room were incredibly soft and comfortable, and the bed - one of those chiropractic, memory foam mattresses with matching pillows - proved to be tremendously comfortable. I would go as far as to say it was among the nicer hotel beds I've ever slept in. Housekeeping services each day were great. The hotel does not have a lift, and the stairway is every bit as steep, tight, and winding as described on the hotel website. Not a worry for us, but it's not exactly wheelchair accessible either. The location is awesome, with all sorts of great restaurants, bars, coffee houses, markets and public transit just a short walk. Long story short - I cannot say enough nice things about this wonderful hotel, and will definitely stay there again on my next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jelly79
Reviews.Content: Great location - within walking distance of many of the tourist areas and sights, but situated in a quiet street next to the canals. The room (room c) had separate sleeping and living areas and was very clean. It was an excellent place to relax in the evening. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Canal House!”
Reviews.Author: McMurphy_79
Reviews.Content: Seven bridges is a great canal house, we felt great staying at this hotel. Hotel staff was very kind and helpful. They prepeared a nice breakfast and served in our room every morning. Room and hotel was very clean. Actually you can smell the cleanliness. The location is very central and it was quiet. there was a laptop at the reception and we took it to our room for use of internet for free. we really enjoyed amsterdam and seven bridges.

Reviews.Title: “What a terrific place”
Reviews.Author: Glo12
Reviews.Content: Just want to say that this is the first time we have stayed at a small hotel(canal house) and it was wonderful. We had a wonderful four night visit to Amsterdam and I would highly recommend the seven bridges for its charm, location, and attentive owners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at its best”
Reviews.Author: FarhanGreham
Reviews.Content: Perfection is at its best. Our clients were totally happy , a nice hotel , affordable one with all amenities , that just suits our needs.Especially for business meetings , nice conference room and good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Very personal ambience for those who travel in style”
Reviews.Author: Wooster20
Reviews.Content: We spend a night at the Seven Bridges, which is perfectly located in a nice, central area of Amsterdam, along one of the smaller canals. We had a quiet room on the gardensite. The room was very personally and stylishly furnished with with antiques, which is the house style and clearly reflects the exquisite style of the two owners. They did not want to take us first, as we were staying only one night, also when they heard we have a small kid, but in the end we got the room and were very satisfied with everything. Just one little note of warning. This is not a hotel in the classic sense. Don't expect a hotel bar, a reception, a lobby, a breakfest room, room service or an elevator. This is refurbished private home and it is nice change to the anonymous, all the same type of hotel chain stuff, one is getting these days.

Reviews.Title: “This is a perfectly lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RWW30305
Reviews.Content: When I planned a trip to meet my daughter in Amsterdam this past September, I consulted Tripadvisor.com and found this hotel highly rated. When I went to its website, I was a little concerned to see that there had apparently been some unhappy customers as evidenced by defensive verbiage posted by the hotel. However, I did not find the refund policy out of line for such a small hotel, so I booked a room and bought trip insurance. I am so glad I was not put off. It turned out to be a perfectly beautiful hotel, with just one or two rooms on each floor, up a typical narrow staircase. We had a great room with garden view, fresh flowers, comfortable beds and bath. Our hosts were extremely accomodating. They booked tickets to the Anne Frank House for us, called for taxis, and would lend us their laptop any time, They do offer breakfast, and were very accomodating the first morning with a great spread on beautiful china, but pretty much discouraged us from ordering it thereafter - and why bother? You can walk just around the corner and find fresh coffee and the most exquisite apple tart in Amsterdam! It's beautifully located on a quiet side canal - we walked to almost all the museums and sights. If you are looking for a small, charming, well-located hotel in a well-heeled, quiet area of Amsterdam, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “One in a million”
Reviews.Author: travelbum7
Reviews.Content: When we went inside the hotel it was like coming home, and when we left in the morning it was like we were part of the neighborhood. Centrally located, we were never more than a 15-20 minute walk from any major site. The tram stop was one street over. Rembrandt Square was 2 blocks down and had many restaurants to try. Great city to walk in and get around. We stayed in room 5 and it was beautiful. The antique armoire and table have to be seen to be believed. A garden opened out from the bathroom and had beautiful plants. I just wish it had been warm enough to enjoy our breakfast out there that was delivered to our room. Such decadence! More food than you could eat. It's an extra charge but nice to experience. Fine china like my grandmother's. Clean, comfy, and you truly feel like you're staying in a friend's home. One of the owners helped us reconfirm flight reservations and called a cab for us the night before we left. We left at 7 am after the owner said, "oh, no, I can't let you leave at 6:30. It is too early for your 10:00 flight." He was so nice. And where else can you find a huge bouquet of yellow tulips waiting for you? Those were the nice touches. And the steep spiral staircase was very cool. Canal houses have such wonderful character. We travel a lot and have been to Europe many times and I can say without a doubt that this is one of the best, if not the best places we've EVER stayed. It's truly one in a million!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, unique, warm and inviting Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynnagin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel in Amsterdam was charming. Located on one of the canals, walking distance to almost everything in town, surrounded by good restaurants and close to the flower district, what more could we ask for. Well they surprised us with a large breakfast served in our room on china dishes with a very Holland type breakfast. Huges fresh flowers graces the lobby and the staff was very friendly. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrall, very good and charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Clauvadazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the very friendly owner. A very honest person ! He even told us how to get around the noise from the canal as he thought we might find difficult to sleep. Very thoughtful person ! Few summary like below about this hotel : - The location is great - you are within easy walking distance of the art museums, great restaurants. - Staff : very pleased with them ! they constantly introduced me the place to eat. And thanks to them, i found the little Italian place very closed (or corner) to Seven Bridges - Room : Good in general, served what you need for a B&B. We order also large breakfast everyday in this hotel - Some negative or drawbacks : They could spend little bit more investment on improving the bed liner or duvet in order to push the the maximum of being comfortable. It is a very good hotel in overrall. Will recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful B&B (even without the breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: Gili E
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Seven Bridges for travellers out and about to explore Amsterdam. The location is excellent - quiet, on the canal and yet only a few steps (maybe a 2 minute walk) to RembrandtPlein, where you can find many resturants, a couple of coffee shops and lots of people. Also, take a 2 minute walk in another direction right to a tram for Centraal Station (about 10 minutes away). The "hotel" has 2 buildings: the main one and another next to it. There are no common areas - from what I understand, breakfast in bed is served to the rooms in the main building. Since we stayed at the second one, we didn't get breakfast but were given a map upon our arrival where they marked the nearest bakery and grocery store which were also only a few minutes away. The bathroom was fine, the television offers quite a selection and the room itself was lovely. As others have stated before me, it's more of a b&b than a hotel, but it's great if within its parameters. Keep in mind that we barely had any interaction with anyone from the hotel (and didn't see any of the guests) but truly enjoyed our stay and will gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VIAJAX1625
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three (3) times and we love this hotel. The web site allows you to see the rooms that you will reserve/stay. The manager is very helpful and worries about whether a guest will appreciate the room selected. In fact, he has tried to talk us out of staying at the hotel when our first choice room was not available. There have been complaints about the management of the hotel, but I simply find all of them to be direct and honest. We have stayed in an upstairs room (with exposed beams) and the smaller, ground level rooms with and without breakfast. Regardless of the room, we have alway enjoyed our stay and appreciated the hotel's decor and cleanliness. This hotel is a true Amsterdam experience. This is not your local box hotel with a lobby and lots of staffers running around. If you want a typical hotel, stay at some chain that you could find anywhere. We are experienced travelers and we've stayed in many 5 star resorts, and we love Seven Bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view of the canals”
Reviews.Author: Al1465234
Reviews.Content: This is a small B&B run by really nice people, in an excellent location right in the city center. Some of the rooms overlook the canal, which is really nice. The rooms are different in size and with different amnesties in each room. This can be improved - some rooms don't even have basic tea facilities while others have much more and even a fridge. That's why I found the basic rooms to be overpriced. Nevertheless, I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others, just check on their website about room details before you book - they have detailed photos of each room. Note that stairs are really steep and narrow, and climbing them (especially with a suitcase) might be a problem for some.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with hotel choice.”
Reviews.Author: silvercal10
Reviews.Content: Not knowing anything about the city, we booked this hotel recommended by a friend who had stayed there a number of times. It's a quaint home converted into about 12 hotel rooms. Every room is different. They are all relatively spacious (for Europe) and they all have airconditioning! They bring a nice breakfast to your room everyday between 8 and 9. They staff is very accommodating and helped numerous times with restaurant reservations. One thing to be aware of is that there is no elevator and the stairways are steep and narrow. Not a problem for the young and fit, but if you have problems walking or climbing stairs, I'd look someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duluthian57
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect on our first trip to Amsterdam but we absolutely loved this hotel. The staff was extremely personable and seemed to take a genuine interest in serving us. The room was clean and nice-sized (by European standards), and the view onto the Canal was wonderful. As for the breakfasts delivered to us each morning, well, they set a new standard for both breakfast and service. We felt completely spoiled ... and loved every second of it. The breads were tremendous, especially some kind of currant bun that was out of this world, and we liked that there was a different fruit each day. We were afraid there might not be enough; we need not have worried. We were even able to make lunches from all of the food. Another perk was how quiet the hotel was; we couldn't hear anyone else, although we know that others were staying there. And the location is out of this world. There are some terrific restaurants a mere block and a half away, and yet the street itself is wonderfully quiet at night. We would stay here again in a second. We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a Charming Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Js
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The location is fantastic, and all the action of rembrandtplein is just a few minutes walk away. The museumplein is also not too far away and it's a slightly longer but beautiful walk there. The biggest problem you will have is finding the hotel when you arrive in amsterdam. So unless you are taking a taxi, get direction before you arrive. The room was charming and original. The wifi was good, and if you don't have a computer you can borrow one of their laptops for a bit. Overall a very satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly and ideal for a great stay in a very central location!”
Reviews.Author: mark_fensome
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, characterful and friendly hotel in a great central location and ideal for couples looking for a romantic holiday in this charming city. Each room is different, furnished with lovely antiques but also featuring modern appliances like LCD TV's, a small fridge, a radio and hair dryer. There is no dining room but breakfast can be served at your room. The only thing to be aware of are the narrow and very steep stairs to the upper floors, typical of these old Amsterdam houses, adding to its charm, unless you less able to walk very well of course. But the managers/owners take great pride (as they rightly should) in this hotel and the service they offer and I can't see anyone being disappointed in their choice. For a quieter night, maybe ask for the less scenic but quieter garden view...the canal view can have noisy boats going up and down at night with party groups on board. But as the other reviews say, this is probably one of the best B&B style hotels in town...enjoy, we did!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem and a terrific value”
Reviews.Author: NYtransplantTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this small b&b near the corner of Reguliersgracht & Prinsengracht for 5 days in June. The room was beautifully decorated, spacious, clean, had a private bath, & was away from the canal & consequently very quiet. The staff was always personable & extremely helpful. The included breakfast was sumptuous & very high-quality. For a lower room rate, you can decline the large breakfast, but we certainly never did. As if all that were not enough, every 2 days the staff left a bouquet of fresh tulips in our room! The location, 2 blocks from the Rembrandtplein, was ideal for walking to all the major sites. We thought the room rate was very reasonable for Amsterdam. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel, that was more like a B&B.”
Reviews.Author: ingramj
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Seven Bridges on the advice of a friend (who also stayed there, in a different room). I was able to specify the room I wanted, based on pictures on the hotel's website. The room was exactly as pictured, as was the charm of the place. Because the hotel had no public space, breakfast -- which was included with the room -- was served in my room, and it was a good offering, indeed: freshly squeezed orange juice, yogurt, meats and cheese, and delicious coffee! My stay at the hotel was eight days, and I was sorry to have to leave at the end of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, best place to stay in the town”
Reviews.Author: Edwardstv
Reviews.Content: Seven Bridges Hotel might be good choice for many travelers. Room rates are reasonable compared with other peer hotels. I love furnitures that reflect luxury and evoke cosy feeling. It also has great view to beautiful and lovely streets. Free wifi, breakfast served in room did add great value to my time in here. Highly appreciate all friendly and helpful staff for making my trip enjoyable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel in mid-Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: NYC10025NY
Reviews.Content: An old house in central Amsterdam overlooking a canal and garden with a handful of rooms. Immaculate; furnished with tasteful antiques that add to the ambience. A sumptuous breakfast served in your room. Free wifi and local calls. Very steep steps may be a barrier to some.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've been to”
Reviews.Author: APS7
Reviews.Content: Seven Bridges was a truly unique and lovely hotel experience. We stayed there for 5 nights. It was a trip around my husband's birthday and we met up with a group of friends. We stayed at Seven Bridges and so did one of our friends. First the one negative: As everyone already mentioned, this hotel is in an old Amsterdam canal house and is not going to be a good choice for travelers with mobility problems. The owners know what kind of business they're running and they're pretty up front about things. "Service" is minimal. Courteous and informative, but if you need lots of assistance, maybe not a good choice. It was perfect for us. Don't get me wrong, the rooms are cleaned spotless and the breakfast is delivered to your room (and is huge!). But you will have to carry your own bags and can't call for room service etc... I loved this hotel. We stayed in 2 different rooms (No 9 up on the top floor/attic and No 5, the garden room). We also spent some time in our friend's room (can't recall No. maybe 7?) When we booked, you could only make reservations directly through their website or on the phone. Initially it looked like we would not be able to stay there but then they were kind enough to let us switch rooms because we really wanted to stay there. I recommend booking early - it's a popular place. The owners also do not allow bookings from large groups to avoid noise and partying. As I said, they make it very clear who's running the ship and this may not be to your liking. We did not mind this attitude as it was never impolite or irrational. All rooms had a lovely and unique atmosphere. Each item in each room was interesting. Whether or not it's to your taste, you can't help but admire the furnishings and the love and care the owners put to decorating. Absolutely a delight! The location is excellent, you can sit and watch the canal, or step outside and walk around. Amsterdam is a lovely place and no better place to stay than on the canal in my opinion! The breakfast is huge - you can easily skip lunch. The website has lots of pictures, although in many cases they do not do justice to the rooms. The rates were reasonable for what I consider to be a very lovely and unique hotel stay, which made our trip even more memorable and enjoyable. If I go back to Amsterdam, I will stay there again. No doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: MrWayne_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Seven Bridges for Four Nights. We highly recommend this Hotel ! It is close to Rembrandt Square, easy transportation connections, great restaurants and people watching. The room 5 was clean, well furnished, airy with a private patio. The helpful staff was great. A special thanks to Hotel Seven Bridges for for making our first trip to Amsterdam wonderful !

Reviews.Title: “Best in Town”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-the-Hun
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in Room C and felt like in a dream. It's even more beautiful than the pictures on the hotel website. It was the perfect getaway from what we usually do. We felt like we were really living in this place as it's more like a small apartment than just a hotel room. The view on the canals is just great. On a sunny afternoon you can just sit and watch the boats passing the house. A glass wall seperates the bedroom from the main room, making sure you have a quiet place to sleep. That's already worth a lot in Amsterdam as people who go there more often will surely know. After spending too much time in overpriced, cramped and noisy rooms before I'm very happy we found this hotel. Most places of interest - from the Rijksmuseum to Rembrandthuis to the Red Light District and the little Chinatown around Zeedijk - are within walking distance. And you're staying in an area where not only tourists, but real Amsterdammers live. It''s relaxed, not crowded and gives you an idea of what the good life looks like in this city. No breakfast is served in Room C as it is in a different building, but you'll find all you need in the neighbourhood, even a supermarket open on Sundays. There's a fridge and all you need to make tea or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to be!!”
Reviews.Author: Roelvanneros
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful place to. The hotel is also centrally located near Rembrandt Square. Room 9 was a large quiet room with beautiful antique furniture. Morning, breakfast brought to your room, and served on beautiful antique crockery. The owners of the hotel are very friendly and you can see that they are in love with there hotel. The hotel has a personal touch and is highly recommended for guests who want to feel the real amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “An experience of a lifetime !!”
Reviews.Author: burnsart
Reviews.Content: There are so many wonderful memories about our "Anniversary Vacation" in Amsterdam; the quintessential European Fairy-Tale City of canals and bridges, bicycles, baguettes, flowers, wine and romance. One of the sweetest memories for us was our stay at Hotel Seven Bridges on Reguliersgracht. It seems in retrospect that it was nothing less than "an honor" to be a guest at this hotel. Maybe the concept of "Hospitality" was born here? It has a picturesque location that artists have throughout history chosen to paint; it just doesn't get any better. The hotel has the fragrance of Stargazer Lilies. The scale is 17th (?) Century, yet the bathrooms are 21st. The breakfast (brought to our room!) was unforgettably delicious! A large ceramic pot of steaming hot coffee, warmed croissants, Dutch cheese and various slices of meats!! Too good to be true! The room facing the quiet canal, ( No. 7 ), was almost too beautiful to leave, but right out of the hotel you have all of Amsterdam to endlessly explore and it was made all the more enjoyable knowing you will come back to your romantic " dream house in Europe"!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic gem in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and it really is as good as the reviews suggest. Its within walking distance of all the major sights and museums, flower market and restaurant. Eric and Pierre were fantastic hosts and just could not do enough for us, including loaning us a laptop free of charge so we could access the internet. I normally stay in the Pulitzer Hotel,but the rooms here are bigger, have great canal views and lovely furniture. Also discovered a great little Italian just down the road from the hotel (turn right and its 50 yards away) called Ponte Arcari with the best pasta I've ever eaten outside Italy (knocking spots off most of the Michelin star places).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, lovely, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Svetakoshka
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Amsterdam and thanks to the WONDERFUL people at the "Seven Bridges" and the hotel itself I fell in love with the city! Stayed there 11 nights, Garden room 3. The room is downstairs, with a little garden where some bush bloomed with wonderful red flowers and on a tree there was a nest with little birds. The room is perfect for 1-2 people, spacious and very comfortable. The staff is very helpful and very nice. Big and tasty breakfast served to my room and on china! Laptop for rent from the staff for free and wifi in the room was a plus! The location is perfect - I never ever had to take public transport to get to any tourist attractions. I walked all the city from the hotel and walked lots on the canals nearby. The hotel is right off the very-crowded places, so it's very close to the center and already in a nice quiet neighborhood. The bed and the pillows are EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE! After long day of walking (or traveling to the other places in Holland) I would come back to my room and after 6-7 hours of sleep I would be totally refreshed and ready for new walks! Overall, "Seven Bridges" - all I need from a hotel when I'm on vacation (or on business)! And when I'm in Amsterdam next time I'll definitely would like to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful part of our Amsterdam experience!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_ann_l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Seven Bridges in the Annex, room B for about 7 nights at the beginning of April. We really enjoyed our stay there. The room was clean, attractive, and comfortable. The furnishings were very nice, and the fresh tulips were a nice touch. Oh, and the mattress was memory foam and very comfortable. Breakfast isn't included with the Annex rooms, so we didn't interact with our hosts as much as we might have. But they were very helpful when we arrived, and any time we stopped in at the reception with a question or request for advice. Room B has a small refrigerator, a microwave oven, sink, dishes, etc, so it is possible to have a simple meal in the room. The website is very clear that this room has a large window on the street, so if you are sensitive to noise, this may not be the best choice for you. However, there are heavy drapes, and a sliding glass door that can be closed to put a second barrier between the street and the sleeping area. The location is very central, but the street is not a commercial one itself. There is foot traffic past the window in the evening, but we slept fine. My husband is a light sleeper, and he had no problems. There are a number of pleasant restaurants, cafes, and a bakery one block over on Utrechtstraat which were convenient and enjoyable. We highly recommend the Seven Bridges for a stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “They don't make them like they used to...”
Reviews.Author: Earthling70_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is practically faultless, if a boutique hotel without the usual communal amenities isn't a problem. The rooms wouldn't be out of place on a postcard and the attention to detail (so lacking in mainstream hotels nowadays) is a treat. The service is subtle but five-star all over. Where else nowadays could you indulge in such quality breakfast in bed - or in the balcony if you stay in room 5? The Seven Bridges is also located in one of the quaintest areas of central Amsterdam - away from the maddening crowd, yet just a few metres away from one of the most relaxed squares. It's also located very close to one of the best Indonesian restaurants I've ever been to. The only downside to our stay at this hotel was the somewhat uncomfortable bed... but this is a small price to pay for a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy119
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly special and made our trip to Amsterdam a wonderful experience. The beautiful 17thc building has been lovingly restored and our room (number 5) was gorgeous. Furnished with incredible antiques, it was both welcoming and spacious. We even had a collection of camellias on a small terrace outside our bathroom! While the staircase, as in all canal houses, is narrow and steep, our luggage was whisked away by the gracious staff. Breakfast was brought to our room each morning. The food was delicious and the service perfect. If you want old world charm in an incomparable setting, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!!”
Reviews.Author: barbwill
Reviews.Content: I just spent 10 days at this lovely hotel! Thank you Trip Advisor, you have never let me down. The room was fantastic! I loved the antiques, the view, the amenities and the comfort. There was a beautiful bouquet of about 3 dozen tulips in the room when I checked in and when it showed signs of decay, here came another. Unbelievable service in all respects. Wireless internet, important for me, was fast and flawless. The view from the windows of Room 7 are stunning and the bed comfortable...The staircase is steep, steep, steep....but I was warned and wanted the 17th Century Canal House experience and loved it. Breakfasts were huge.....More than enough for a lunch or bedtime snack also. The yogurt was the best I have ever had. Loved the different china every day...a special touch which included a tea tray with hot pot and teapot. Gunter, Pierre, Eric and Richard were gracious, friendly and extremely helpful and accommodating. The only city glitch I had was when I didn't follow their advice!
