I was there over Queen's Day....and it was a hoot! Great photos.....although I did the right thing with visits to the Artis Royal Zoo and the botanical gardens on that day. This is the best hotel I have stayed in for ambiance and service! The city of Amsterdam and the Netherlands in general are the most visitor/tourist friendly place I have visited and I highly recommend the hotel and the country it is located in......

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Seven Bridges is everything you want in a European hotel.”
Reviews.Author: benopposite
Reviews.Content: My room was incredible, the spacious Garden Room #5. â€œWith a gilded ceiling, a 17th century Dutch "Rankenkast" from Sotheby'sâ€�â€”really the most remarkable wooden inlay work I have ever seenâ€”â€œan 18th century Louis XVI Dutch mirror from Sotheby's, two 19th century gilt wood and gesso mirrors from France, an Italian 19th century mirror, exquisite Italian curtains,a precious French bedspread, a gorgeous oriental carpet,a French chair from Â± 1880, two leather chairs from the 1930's...and - last but not least - a 40 inch flat screen TV.â€� Also, free wireless internet, thank god! These gentlemen take their profession quite seriously. Please, have a look at their website where these breathtaking rooms and antiques are described in more detail. A small but delicious breakfast is delivered to your room each morning, perhaps you'll take it on the veranda amidst the rose bushes? Or stay in bed, nestled under the precious Lyonine french bedspread? Just don't spill the coffee. --ben, theantitourist.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MARWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Planned on staying 5 nights, and ended up there 7 nights due to the volcanic ash. Owners were very helpful, and graciously let us stay in our same room. We had actually made arrangements for 3 more nights, but unexpectedly got a flight back to the states. We stayed in room #9, 46 winding steps to reach it, but would do it again! Did experience some occasional street noise (drunks walking by), but the hotel provides ear plugs and it wasn't that bad. (Never heard any noise from the other rooms). Great location, good restaurants in the neighborhood, and yes the breakfast was very good and very generous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: HenrySWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights, and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is on a canal, and convenient to museums, etc and public transportation. Our room was in the back of the building facing the garden, so it was nice and quiet. The room was large with a nice bath, and gorgeous antique furniture. The owners couldn't have been nicer, and were able to get us into our room quickly after our overnight flight. Another nice touch is the huge breakfast that's delivered to your room every morning to start your day right. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay-Check the Pictures If You Doubt It”
Reviews.Author: JoeTChicopee
Reviews.Content: This is a classy little hotel. This review is a little overdue since my wife and I stayed there last September. Not only did we love Amsterdam but we loved this place. Just looking at some of the pictures today while reading some of the reviews made me homesick to be back there. It is a great location on the canal and as mentioned in many reviews, it is convenient to everything. My wife and I were there for 10 days and walked everywhere we went. We arrived early before check in and were given a place to store our luggage while we did some sight seeing before our room was ready. We stayed in room 9 and loved the view. We did not mind the steep stairs because when we left in the morning, we were gone all day. It was a little noisy on the weekend but earplugs were available in the room and during the rest of the week, noise was not a problem. It is no doubt in my mind that the furnishings were unique because I was certainly impressed. I can't imagine this kind of antiques in most hotels. The breakfasts were great and huge. Breakfast was brought to your room each morning at the time you specified and served on china. I certainly don't require china for breakfast but if one is going to do a review, they should tell it like it is. The Seven Bridges Hotel serves their breakfasts on china! If memory serves me correctly there was a pitcher of coffee (containing serveral cups), orange juice, yogurt, several slices of different types of bread, cheese, lunchmeat, usually two different types of fruit, crouisants and jellies and jams. After eating our fill each morning, we would make sandwiches from the leftovers and have them for lunch as we explored the city. Our hosts offered the options of not having breakfasts some mornings if we chose not to, but it seemed like a good deal to us so we continued them every morning. Rembrandt Square was very convenient with all sorts of bars and restaurants nearby. Yet only a couple of blocks away, we were off the main drag tucked in to our scenic street. One day we were pleasantly surprised to hear music coming from the canal and were treated to a concert by a musician in a little boat. He had a handcranked organ and played a variety of trumpets. After playing several numbers and interacting with those who gathered to listen, he motored off to another location to repeat his performance. What a nice touch, right outside our hotel! Another night, we saw a wedding party arriving by boat and being greeted by guests holding sparklers which reflected off the water. Just a beautiful setting. The staff was very accommodating and I did take advantage of their laptops and internet connections to check my e-mail and communicate with some folks back. When leaving to come home, we walked about two blocks to Rembrand Square and took a tram to Central Station, then, a train to the airport. A very convenient location. I have absolutely no complaints with this hotel and would gladly stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel again. I know they do have some bigger rooms there but we enjoyed number 9 so much, I would be tempted to stay in that one again. Amsterdam has a lot to offer. We found the people to be very friendly. We enjoyed seeing so many people using bicycles to get around especially families with small children in the carts and on various attached seats. The only problem we had with the city was remembering to stay out of the bike paths. Great city. Great hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience-bar none-and we travel a lot!”
Reviews.Author: Arlenie
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight days in the Number 5 Garden Room. What a spacious delight with beautiful antiques and finishes such as the hand carving on the ceiling. Loved the garden area attached to our room as well. Good thing too, because both my husband and I came down with terrible colds and had to spend a lot more time in the room than we anticipated. Gunter and his staff could not have been nicer. They even offered to bring us tea or aspirin as things deteriorated!! While we did miss a few days of sightseeing, if it had to happen, it couldn't have happened in a nicer place with nicer staff. We won't be staying anywhere else but the Seven Bridges on future trips to Amsterdam. Great room, great location, great service, great staff. Seven Bridges has it all!

Reviews.Title: “A Most Charming Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ShimonA
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed six nights in Room C at the Seven Bridges Hotel. In short, it was terrific. Room C is actually two rooms--a bedroom and a living room, so it is quite spacious. The bathroom is good size, the shower has great water pressure, and the bath towels, changed daily, are luxuriously thick. There is a refrigerator where we kept snacks and drinks. The living room has a beautiful view of two historic canals and the street is generally very quiet. The location is perfect. It is easy walking distance to the museums, great non-touristy local cafes and restaurants and other shops, Vondel Park, and the great outdoor Albert Cuyp Market. Trams to everywhere are just two blocks away. The owners, Gunter and Pierre, were always very friendly and available to answer questions or provide what little assistance we requested. The only regret is we could not stay longer. The Seven Bridges is not generic, it is authentic Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast in Bed... does it get any better?!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBZJ
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a true gem! It's in the perfect location... only a few blocks from Rembrant Square and a tram stop, yet far enough off away from traffic to make it super quiet and relaxing. Easily walkable to all sights! The staff couldn't have been friendlier and they bring breakfast (breads,croissants, fantastic yogurt, fruits, meats, cheeses, juice and tea/coffee) to your room every morning! What could be better than breakfast in bed!!! Plus, they have free laptops for you to use upon asking! A definite two thumbs up. If I'm ever in Amsterdam again, I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: dajc
Reviews.Content: Based my decision to stay on the "genuine reviews" on tripadvisor. And as expected was very pleased with Gunter and his unique establishment. Stayed in Room C "next door" to the other part of the hotel where you check-in. Everythink was just perfect as stated in more detail in the other postings. Room C has a perfect view of the Canal, an no issues with noise, the sleeping area is screened off but we never even noticed when leaving the door open. The photo's on the website show it perfectly. There is a good sized fridge tucked away to keep the beers cool too. Close to everything and we walked pretty much everywhere, and we even took the tram and train to and from Schipol with the luggage, which is not too big a deal, and cheap and cheerful compared to taxis. Local bakery, deli and off licence kept our appetites satisfied and good local restaurants. The Casa de David Italian was worth he short walk. A very pleasurable stay, will be back next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style and Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Saf-Pro
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven Bridges offers something many places don't - great style and the perfect location along one of Amsterdam's most beautiful canals. My Garden room was vast yet warm, colorful and cozy with great antiques. The bathroom was spacious as well. As travel is my business I am very aware of the details which were all very well taken care of down to the fresh tulips in the room. Service wise the hotel manager is a delight...his passion is evident from the moment of your arrival. Numerous small restauants may be found just out the hotel's front door...My opinion - well worth it! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, great value, very friendly management”
Reviews.Author: r14brooks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seven Bridges for two nights recently. It was our first trip to Amsterdam and we found this hotel to be in a very central location, easy walking distances from the museums and attractions we visited. We had the top room on the garden side (No. 10); it was remarkably quiet and we slept well both nights. The breakfasts are delicious and substantial, and the two gentlemen running the hotel are friendly and helpful. Last but not least, the rate was probably one third of what we would have paid at a nice, but not top of the line, hotel. Seven Bridges is a tremendous value! You should check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Welcome To Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DeGrog
Reviews.Content: After a night of traveling, we arrived to the Seven Bridges Hotel before our check-in time. Only wishing to store our bags until check-in, we entered the hotel. We were greeted with such kindness, and they had the room clean and ready for us. We were able to settle in for a nap, and then off to exploring the city. At night, the room was quite and warm, with great night views of city lights and the stars :) We were in #10 which you can view on their website. WHAT YOU SEE IS WHAT YOU GET!!! But we didn't notice the attention to detail until actually there. Gunter, the kind man who welcomed us and handled our stay, also brought us a delicious breakfast in bed. I am already recommending this place to my friends. Aloha :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet, attractive location”
Reviews.Author: ardingly87
Reviews.Content: Had a small single room overlooking the canal and street. Very nicely furnished and good breakfast in the morning. Only there one night so did not see too much of the management but that suits me fine. Easy walk to Centraal and also to museums. Good local restaurants and bars. Quite a high price but I have no complaints. would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, great location, restful, considerate/thoughtful service”
Reviews.Author: keepontruckingmama
Reviews.Content: Guidebooks pointed us to the hotel's charm, service, location: all were as expected. Surprises included fresh extravagant bouquets of tullips refreshed during our one week stay and generous in-room breakfasts. Rooms are well furnished and comfortable. Amsterdam had record cold yet our room was warm and comfortable. WiFi in-room service worked well. This hotel is small and well-suited to the traveler who wants a quiet, private, personal accomodation. Everything about the place suggests being at ease and undisturbed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: baberbo
Reviews.Content: Don't believe competitors trying to slander this hotel:It's simply a great place! The "Seven Bridges"i's an old building,the rooms are clean and all decorated in a cosy and loving way.The people running it are very friendly.They bring you a nice breakfast in the room, so the day starts in a very special way. The situation is perfect to reach everything by foot and in spite of the proximity to the Rembrandtplein, the street is quite. So, who still prefers something small, full of charm, to the big modern and impersonal hotels,will be making here a right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay at the Seven Bridges Every Time!”
Reviews.Author: section735
Reviews.Content: Came over to Amsterdam in July of 2009 for the Dave Matthews concert and stayed at the Seven Bridges based on the reviews that I read on Tripadvisor. We stayed in room 6 with the canal view and overall, I can't think of anything negative to say about the hotel, the staff, or our overall experience. Pierre and Gunther were very attentive and pleasant hosts and they took the time to answer all of our questions about Amsterdam. The hotel location is easy to get to by public transportation and offers you easy access to just about anything you'd want to experience in Amsterdam. From our room, street noise was never a problem and we were always served a delicious breakfast each morning from Gunther or Pierre. And thank goodness for the fridge in our room as we used it to store our leftovers from our huge breakfasts. We did get to peek in at room 5 which seemed to be larger than room 6 with a very nice gargen view, but no canal view. Seemed you couldn't go wrong with either one. Don't hesitate to stay at the Seven Bridges. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: charliebb1
Reviews.Content: We selected the Seven Bridges hotel because it received incredible reviews on Trip Advisor and was ranked no. 1 in Amsterdam when we booked. The hotel certainly did not disappoint - location was fantastic, in the centre but still quiet, and very easy to find; the welcome was warm; the room was lovely and full of character, with a fantastic view of the canal; despite the poor weather outside, the room was lovely and warm; hearty breakfast was served in the room, including warm croissants; and generally we had a lovely stay in a quaint historical hotel that deserves all the great reviews it has received. We will definately return.......it was also great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “How perfect is perfect”
Reviews.Author: citytraveller63
Reviews.Content: The D &K guide rates this as one of the 10 best in Amsterdam and SO IT IS. I couldn't recommend it more highly. My Room, No. 6 at the front of the hotel was splendid. Quiet, spacious with beautiful antiques - such joy! The owners were so helpful with recommendations for dinner etc and I couldn't do justice to the hearty breakfast on offer. The location is perfect and the Seven Bridges Hotel will be a hard act to follow in other cities in Europe. Their website pictures are completely accurate and I would always want to return here and so will you.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Bridges Hotel is perfect- the room-ambience-location and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: CaroleBrookline
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Seven Bridges Hotel was a marvel... the room , #9, faces the canal and we had a delicious breakfast every morning at a window ,watching the comings and goings of the Amsterdamois. We could easily walk to all the museums, especially with the map that Gunter provided. Two blocks away is Rembrandt Square, a restaurant mecca... we especially liked the Italian restaurant on the corner, two blocks away towards the Square . We felt well taken care of and very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in Amsterdam to stay”
Reviews.Author: lamontHawaii
Reviews.Content: When looking up te telephonenumber for the Seven Bridges Hotel in order to make a new reservation I noticed some complaints about cold rooms. This will be my 4th trip to Amsterdam and stay In the Seven Bridges Hotel, but never did I need to complain about the roomtemperatures or service. The owners make me feel at home away from home and the breakfast is the best I ever had in Holland. The location is perfect with everything you can think of in walking distance. I look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was cold with no heat in Amsterdam winter”
Reviews.Author: maggielovestime
Reviews.Content: So cold I wore two sweaters to bed in the night and caught a cold. Missed my meeting. Not happy. Trying to dave money for heat at guest's expense. Oh well. Hotel was empty. Down season and recession i would have liked a discount. I boticed I was charged twice on my credit card and had to file a complaint. Bed and Breakfast style with a few rooms and rooms smelled like cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any happier with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crasavitsa
Reviews.Content: This trip was a gift from my Fiancee for Valentine's Day so I had no idea about what to expect from the Seven Bridges Hotel. We took the train there from the airport which was super easy and very convenient. We were pleasantly greeted by Richard who checked us in and carried our luggage next door to Room C with the canal view. That was good because the stair case is very very very steep but they warn you about that before you book. You just have to be careful. We had an entire apartment to ourselves with a mini fridge, electric tea kettle, and all kinds of dishes and utensils. There were even wine glasses which came in very useful. Everything was very clean and the room was cleaned daily bringing fresh towels. There is great free Wi-Fi, the street was quiet for all 3 days we stayed there over a weekend, and the location was perfect. It felt like we were living in our own home in Amsterdam. Several trams are within a couple of blocks, and its around the corner from Rembrandt Square which has nightlife, restaurants, and shops. It was a very romantic spot and we would definitely recommend this to others and stay here again. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Perfect...a dream!”
Reviews.Author: JimJamie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel could not have been any lovelier. Each room is a unique assemblage of gorgeous furniture and tasteful, classic design. Having lived in Amsterdam for several years some time ago, we truly felt at home staying in these 2 historic canal houses on the picturesque Reguliersgracht, where the hotel is idyllically located. Every detail was beautifully attended to, right down to making sure that the yellow tulips in our room had fresh water every day. On our trip, we had two separate stays, and on the last morning that we were there, Gunter very thoughtfully made a special effort to bring us breakfast (on lovely china) well before the normal breakfast hour so that we'd be well fed and full of coffee for our early flight home. We will always, always come back to this hotel, as it feels like a perfect and dreamy home to us. We send everyone there much gratitude and thanks.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay: 5 Stars all the way!”
Reviews.Author: tomUkiah_California
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arriving, I felt like I was at home with much more conveniences. Pleasant reception and the staff could not do enough to please. Accomodations were perfect and I enjoyed the antique and modern combination of the surroundings. Location left nothing to be desired as I could easily walk almost everywhere, and just far enough away from the busy nightlife of the Rembrant Square so as not to be disturbed while sleeping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a unique experience in a real antique building with all the modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bed, Good Breakfast, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RuNanS
Reviews.Content: We've waited four months to write this review, but the delay is no indication of our dissatisfaction. Quite the contrary, we're very enthusiastic about this B&B located in an old canal house in the perfect location to walk just about anywhere you'd want. The hosts are generous with their breakfast, carrying a heavy-laden tray right up to the room -- lots of nice breads, hot chocolate (if that's your preference), orange juice and fruit. They're knowledgeable about their city and have good suggestions about where to eat dinner in the neighborhood. The room was spacious and quiet, with a nice view over the back garden. (You can also have a canal view, if you want.) The sole difficulty, which others have mentioned before us, is the narrow, winding stair to the bedrooms. However, if you're going to stay in a canal house, that's just part of experiencing what life must have been like. So if you're looking for a good B&B in a good location with helpful hosts, you'll find it in Seven Bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel 7 Seven Bridges, wonderful Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiDonald
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everything. Room was very clean, beautifully furnished, sweet canal view. Wonderful breakfast, the best advice from the owner Pierre on where to go and what to do. Great recommendations for dining in the hotel's charming neighborhood. Free Internet service provided. We stayed there for a week and we felt like we should have stayed 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Amserdam over New Years”
Reviews.Author: sir_snorksalot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week in Amsterdam around New Years, and stayed at the Seven Bridges. We were in garden room 8, which was spacious, clean, and quaint. The breakfast each morning was fantastic and a great start to the day. They did an excellent job of cleaning each day, the hotel has free wireless, and the owners are very accommodating (gave us electronic adapters, allowed us to check in early at 9am etc). The location was great, right on a canal (like everything), and we were able to walk everywhere without a problem, even in the December cold. Amsterdam feels like a small city, so it's very walkable. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy and cheap, (taking the train and then a tram). We went to some great restaurants (especially liked the Canal Belt and Jordaan areas; FYI, avoid the small Italian restaurant near the hotel, forget the name, but the food wasn't that great). Some things I would definitely recommend include trying jenever at De Drie Flesches, good dutch beer at In de Wildeman, Dutch treats at various stalls throughout the city, and obviously the big hits (museums, Anne Frank House, canal boat tour etc). If you're there in Winter, go ice skating outside the Rijksmuseum. If you have time, take a day trip (by train) somewhere, we loved Delft. In summary, loved the Seven Bridges, which gave us a welcoming and excellent launching point to get to know Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Seven bridges could be better”
Reviews.Author: changmay
Reviews.Content: This hotel could stand a renovation and a good clean up. Not at all what expected. The manager was OK and does his best to help. Feels more like a B&B than a hotel really so if you are looking for amenities this might not be a good place to look. Considering the numerous hotels offering discounts during this downturn in the economy it was surprising to pay so much for so little. I might stay there again if the price was 50% less but otherwise I would look for something more realistic in the price. Breakfast was delicious and served in the room but at that price it should have come with entertainment too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsraelWhale
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an art-deco furnished room overlooking the canal. It was very romantic, convenient and well appointed, and at a great price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazingGraceWow
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days with my significant other in Amsterdam for a conference while on leave from my job. Amsterdam is a lovely city and the weather was quite nice. This hotel was a veritable tourist trap of a hotel so after staying here for one evening my partner and I decided to check out early to stay in a nicer hotel. This was quite a problem as the manager made it very difficult for us even when we explained how unhappy we were with the room. It was very noisy and drafty, (my partner caught a cold) and for 100 Euros we would have expected a bit better. The room looked nothing like the photo on the Internet and I thought we were in the wrong hotel! The location is lovely however and there are many excellent places to eat and stroll in the area. I would avoid this hotel if you are looking for a quiet stay, we could here the manager bickering with another gentleman throughout the evening and that was quite uncomfortable to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “My #1 Favorite Hotel in Beautiful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SoJurn
Reviews.Content: Christmas in Amsterdam...it was certainly a revelous time to be sure. But The Hotel Seven Bridges was a place I enjoyed rather because of it's historical aura. The neighborhood is architecturally significant and pleasant. The accomodations are very well appointed and charming, which is obvious from the hotel's website. Yet most importantly, they are meticulously clean, inviting, and well thought out in terms of the traveler's needs. The sfaff...Pierre, Gunter, and Eric are the best, and really first class. No better hotel in Amsterdam in my opinion. Canal Room 7 was lovely and the view spectacular. For the second half of my trip I stayed in Canal Room C, which is really neat because it's right on the canal but the double window really seals out the sound. In addition, you get a nice foyer area to serve as extra personal space and a private adjunct to the bathroom. For a great meal, be sure to visit the Latin Quarter around the block on Utrechtsestraat. Good food, nice people, and escargot!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: ulipix
Reviews.Content: Well kept and maintained it is a romantic little cosy place in the very heart of Amsterdam.Friendly owner and helpful colleagues are a must.Very conveniently located it has been a very nice experience,thanks for all the kindness,hoping to be back!CM,Md.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly service real charm”
Reviews.Author: Gizela51
Reviews.Content: My husband, self and 15 year-old son stayed in this charming hotel/b+b and were delighted with its location, friendly service and Dutch charm. Our triple room was clean with period furnishings on second floor (NB no lift but this is relatively unimportant when one takes into account the age and character of the building). The breakfast served in the bedroom was plentiful and for those wanting to be set -up for lunch and beyond ample to take through to tea time. I can find little but praise to heap on this establishment and would recommend it to friends (though lack of lift might not suit everyone).

Reviews.Title: “Sorry for stay here”
Reviews.Author: dane4life
Reviews.Content: Cold hearted people to run this hotel when I stay here the feeling is not good for me. I expect so much when read reviews so I feel surprise with some bad attitudes with manager. Room is OK maybe much to much money and I wonder why so when I pay:-(. Be sure to take receipt when to pay. Breakfast was no good at all. :-( To be sure read web info page before reservation and read small print. Better to see hotel first before make the reservation so no confusion can be had about what you will get. Believe me I know. No refund allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Seven Brdiges”
Reviews.Author: jgb41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seven Bridges with our 14-year-old dear and a 10-year-old friend . Gunther was kind enough to give us the top two rooms (9 and 10), which effectively created our own private "suite" and we got used to the climb up and down very quickly.. The rooms were charming and the breakfasts truly are substantial. The staff were also kind enough to help us out with Dutch medicines when Spencer had a very bad reaction to some mosquito bites.

Reviews.Title: “Great canal location, very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cherry_bobby
Reviews.Content: We selected the Seven Bridges Hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, and for us it certainly lived up to expectations. While booking the hotel by email the staff were very helpful with room selection and suggested the Garden room, which we loved - no awkward stairs, light and airy, but being over the garden there were a few mozzies. Sure there was no canal view, but we were surrounded by canals all day, and it was nice to come back to a peaceful, leafy outlook. Anyway, once the curtains are closed and we are asleep, it doesn't really matter what is outside the window so long as it is quiet! We stayed for 3 nights and found it to be a great location for experiencing Amsterdam and general sightseeing. The breakfasts were amazing - enough for lunch as well - and each day they brought more food than the day before!! The staff were unobtrusive, but quite helpful when asked for directions, or recommendations for dinner, etc. - try the little place on the corner - it is always packed. There are also plenty of other places to eat along Utrechtsestraat (within easy walking distance), but avoid Rembrandt Place where everything is a tourist trap! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it for somewhere quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DRBinToronto
Reviews.Content: I had read many positive reviews of the Seven Bridges Hotel (Frommerâ€™s, Eyewitness, New York Times) so I decided that I would choose to stay there on my recent trip to Amsterdam. What a great decision! This hotel is a gem located on one of Amsterdamâ€™s beautiful canals. Everything (flower market, Centraal Station, Van Gogh Museum, etc.) is within easy walking distance and there are lots of shops and markets handy. The room itself was very reasonably priced and beautifully furnished. A large mirror in my garden room celebrates its 200th birthday next year! Spotlessly clean, spacious and very quiet, this is one of the best rooms Iâ€™ve ever had in all of my many travels. The staff of the Seven Bridges is always wonderfully helpful. Do you need directions? Lost your map? Looking for the best Belgian chocolates? The staff at the Seven Bridges always had a ready answer for me. I really canâ€™t recommend the Seven Bridges Hotel highly enough. A beautiful room in a great location in central Amsterdam with the friendliest staff youâ€™ll find anywhere. Amsterdam is one of Europeâ€™s real jewels and a stay at the Seven Bridges is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, little inn”
Reviews.Author: NinkyCranston
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us as we tacked a few extra days in Amsterdam onto what was basically a business trip for my husband. It was just what we were looking for: small, clean, comfortable, unique, oozing historic charm, convenient, and not outrageously expensive. The prices did not seem high by Amsterdam standards especially since it included a very generous and delicious breakfast of fruit, yogurt, good dark coffee, cheese, ham, jams and breads including warm croissants delivered to our room (other hotels included breakfast for as much as 22 Euros extra per person). And wireless internet was also included at no extra charge, something we missed when we moved on to Leiden where my husband had business. We found the owners and staff friendly but not obtrusive. The decorating was one of a kind eclectic with lovely antiques and modern amenities (we especially liked the towel warmers). That said, this hotel is not for everybody. If you need all the perks of a modern, 4 or 5 star hotel (business center, gym, pool, elevator, etc.), don't stay here. Read their website and room descriptions carefully. The stairs are steep and narrow but I gather there are some rooms that would be suitable for people with more limited mobility. We stayed in room 9, an attic, canal side room and one of the smaller rooms of the hotel. We found the price very reasonable, as stated above, and the room was perfectly comfortable and met our needs perfectly. We enjoyed both the view out our little window and seeing some construction details of these old, Amsterdam houses in the beams crossing the ceiling. The only drawback, but not under the proprietors control, was that it got a little noisy on Saturday night I imagine because it is so close to Rembrantsplein. The owners however did what they could and ear plugs were supplied on the table by the bed for just such occasions. Next time we're in Amsterdam, this hotel will be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: CardiffBonviveur
Reviews.Content: This 300 year old Dutch town house, teetering on the edge of the canal system. is ideally situated for exploring the city of Amsterdam. You can sit in the window of one of their â€˜interestinglyâ€™ appointed bedrooms as the staff bring a sumptuous breakfast of croissants, jams, yogurts, breads, coffee and fresh fruit and watch the tourist boats drift leisurely by. This is by no means a cheap hotel and the decor is a little tired and the rooms limited in size, however , the care and attention of the staff is genuine and exceptional which makes it worth those extra Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeliebvable...couldn't of been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irelandshappyhippo
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay. The place was spottlessly cleaned every day and the staff were always there to give us tips and guidelines as to what to do. Their hospitality was genuine and not artificially given just for the sake of it... they are really nice people. We had a great stay and when I left my necklace over there they sent it back to me without hesitation. Couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: KateFloridaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We found the Seven Bridges to be everything we hoped for and more. Gunther and Pierre were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The breakfast served in our room was delicious. We stayed in Room 6 and Room 7 - both with canal views. We enjoyed sitting by the window in our room every morning enjoying our breakfast and the view of the canal. The Seven Bridges is in a great location with easy access to the city attractions as well as great local restaurants. We would absoulutely book again at the Seven Bridges and look forward to the return trip to this beautiful city. Paul Moyle and Kate

Reviews.Title: “"BIG Thanks " to the Seven Bridges Staff”
Reviews.Author: SaifDubai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from Amsterdam, where we stayed at â€œSeven Bridges hotel Amsterdam â€œfor 8 nights. What made our stay at Seven Bridges so special is the Staff of this Cozy Hotel. We found them to be extremely warm and Courteous. Since my wife is Pregnant, We requested a Room on Ground Floor over looking the canal, they gave us the Room we asked for, and it is Great Value for the Money. Special Thanks to the Staff for the beautiful Roses to my Wife. Saif from Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Still Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cityhopper7_9
Reviews.Content: A return trip for us and still right up our street. Last time we had Canal View Room 7. This time we were in Canal View Room 6 on the floor below. We love the place, its furnishings, and its location. Pierre, Gunter, and Erich try so hard to make your stay perfect. This will suit discerning visitors, not looking for communal facilities, but appreciating being able to stay in exceptionally tasteful rooms in a traditional Amsterdam house besides the most beautiful canal.

Reviews.Title: “Easily one of my favorite hotels in Europe”
Reviews.Author: ardief
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel mainly on the strength of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, so I just wanted to add a few words saying what a great choice it was. Lovely building, very nice owners, beautiful rooms, generous breakfast served in the room so we could enjoy the well-chosen furniture further. The rest of the city easily accessible by tram or on foot, and many very nice places to eat within a few minutes' walk.

Reviews.Title: “7 stars for 7 bridges”
Reviews.Author: benjaminholiday
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven Bridges is a beautiful building filled with wonderful antiques. The area is scenic and accessible from the city center. Itâ€™s run by 2 friendly, accommodating men who take pride in their hotel, work and are great with guests! I'll be sure to book again next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel room and the location!”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaVoyaguer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Amsterdam and really enjoyed coming back and relaxing at our wonderful hotel room. Very cozy, romantic and a great view. The staff was great, very helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “heavenly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: canalsideA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Canal Side room A for 3 nights and could not have been happier - there is a review here that says the owner is less then charming and I could not disagree more. He was lovely and helpful and the hotel is well run - our room was beautiful and much better than even the pictures show. The location is great as well. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend tis place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: mountainmurphy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returnded from 3-night stay in Room C. I rely heavily on TripAdvisor for all our hotel travel, and once again we got exactly what we wanted. The room was very spacious and super-clean. The charm of the 300-year-old building is matched by the modern amenities such as flawless wireless and a flat-screen tv. The bed in our room had a TempurPedic mattress-topper, and we've never slept better in a hotel. We had fresh towels waiting on a heated rack daily, along with top-grade soaps and shampoos etc. While we didn't get to experience the much-touted breakfasts (we were in the annex building), there are wonderful bakeries within a few blocks in all directions. The hotel's website provides many details on each room, which was very helpful to us. We had never been to Amsterdam and were thrilled to be in such a centrally-located neighborhood. We only took one tram during the 3-day visit, preferring to walk the city from our convenient hotel. The management 'team' is remarkable. They are each kind, friendly and extremely well-informed. We relied heavily on their recommendations and enjoyed their contribution to our trip. While there are many big chain hotels in the city, we wanted a hotel experience that matched the old world charm of Amsterdam. I hope to return to Amsterdam soon and will definitely stay at Hotel Seven Bridges again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1974
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 11am, which saved us a lot of hassle with bags. Friendly service. Delightful room (room 5- as nice as the pictures on the website, which isn't always the case with some hotels!). Breakfast plentiful. Expensive, but then again isn't everwhere in Amsterdam?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 day break”
Reviews.Author: TopazTraveller
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam and at the Seven Bridges Hotel. We chose to stay in Room C. It is quiet, comfortable, attractively furnished and has a great view of the canal from the windows. After full days of sightseeing it was a welcoming haven to return to. Breakfast is not provided but the room has a fridge and facilities for making hot drinks. As a bakery is close by it is easy to purchase fresh croissants etc. Cutlery and crockery is provided. The hotel is well positioned for sight seeing. We walked to most of the main museums. If intending to visit the Ann Frank house I would recommend booking on line. Doing so not only saves time but avoids the long queues. As we were keen to see as much as possible we bought 72 hour 'I amsterdam' cards and used them to the full. Within short walking distance there are numerous restaurants so we had a good choice and ate well. Our only disappointment was our experience at the 'Tempo Doeloe' Indonesian restaurant. We booked a few days in advance but on arrival we were seated at a table for two which was immediately adjacent to the entrance door. The restaurant is popular and is always full. However as it is very narrow the tables are close together. Hence, throughout the meal the table was under constant "attack" from both waiter and customer traffic. Although the meal was good the dining experience was poor. This was our most expensive meal but for the reason given was the least enjoyable. If booking a table for two insist that you are not given the worst position in the house!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mickisf
Reviews.Content: This small hotel, with windows onto the canals and charming canal houses, makes for a wonderful Amsterdam experience. Every detail, from the period furniture to the excellent breakfast delivered to your room on exquisite china, is lovingly overseen by the excellent staff. We have been coming to Amsterdam for many years and we always look foreword to our stay at the Seven Bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with helpful friendly owners”
Reviews.Author: miken10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seven Bridges in September as I have done in previous years. Wonderful owners and such an interesting hotel we loved the decor and care with every detail in the hotel. This hotel has a charm thats stylish and cultured without pretension that represents the wonderful personality of Amsterdam. Breakfast catering is the best I've experienced having travelled around Europe for many years and the owners spoke english and are very helpful. THe room was wonderful and the location is perfect for visiting the Amsterdam. Quite an unusual hotel because it has a personal yet professional atmosphere. I would recommend totally :D

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, just what we were looking for in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLeggy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Seven Bridges was everything we'd hoped for and more. Canal Room C, a wonderful second floor 2-room suite overlooking the picture-postcard Reguliersgracht canal, was furnished with a variety of antique pieces and provided an intimate, comfortable, peaceful and memorable experience. Walking distance to everything, steps to restaurants, cafes, and Rembrandtplein. Excellent, friendly service from my first email inquiry to checkout. If you're high-maintenance or looking for big hotel amenities and services this isn't your place, but if you want to experience Amsterdam more like a local than a tourist Seven Bridges is highly recommended. We hope to be back to Amsterdam one day, and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly rude place in great location”
Reviews.Author: ynotUsa
Reviews.Content: This is an unfriendly rude place in great location. Slightly mental owner manager does not add to the charm. Better options in the area for the money. This place has seen better days I think. I was really miffed by the good ratings this hotel gets which makes me think something is a little fishy with the reviews. No matter, so many hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny. Seven Bridges is outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Nickles
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Canal View room 6. This was our first stop on our European jaunt, and it was absolutely marvelous. You cannot beat this location. Just 2 blocks up from Rembrandtplein, gives you plenty of night life and party options. Also located right next door is Barney's Lounge - an extremely nice and relaxed coffeeshop. You can walk to everywhere, yet it's oddly serene and peaceful for being such a short bit away from party central. We arrived at the hotel shortly after 9am. Pierre was kind enough to have us leave our luggage in their offices until we were ready to come back to check in after 1pm. The hotel is flat out gorgeous. Meticulous, spotless, tasteful and decadent. You are in for a treat just staying in a canal house to begin with, but this one is extra special. The contemporary dÃ©cor and antique furniture is just amazing. After you ring a bell on the outside to be let in through the front door (after checking in, you receive an actual key to the building so you can come and go as you please), there is a long narrow hallway that leads to the back of the building (and I think one or 2 other rooms). Directly to the left of the landing, is the â€˜Front Deskâ€™. This is behind a door, which opens up into a small area with a couch, desk and chair, and then further off I could see the private area of the innkeeperâ€™s office. This is where we stored our luggage. Almost directly past this area on the â€˜visitorsâ€™ side of this front desk, are the stairs. Now, let me tell you, believe what you read about the stairs. Also please believe what you read on their website where they recommend you stay elsewhere if you have issues with small, spiral, narrow staircases. We loved it! But man are they tight! The name of the young man who transported our luggage to our room while we were out and about during the day escapes me, but let me tell you, better him than me! (Although I was fully prepared. It was quite a chore hauling them back downstairs on checkout day). We winded up 2 flights of these stairs to our room. Opening the door, you are greeted to a very large room. This room serves as your bedroom, sitting room, and breakfast area. Nice high ceilings and crown moldings everywhere. The room was just breathtaking. The bed is sitting up against a floor to ceiling mirrored wall to your right, with end tables on either side. One table housed a flat screen TV and lamp, the other an alarm clock and lamp. On the far side of the bed, is an enormous closet built into the wall. This was spacious and plenty deep for all our stuff. (Although we did keep our suitcases out on the floor.) There is then a fireplace (which is not usable), and then 2 lovely chairs and a very nice large table. These sit against windows, opposite the bed, looking out at the spectacular canal, bridge and street. In the corner is a very nice antique â€˜tableâ€™ which actually houses a small mini-fridge! Ingenious design. There were fantastic fresh flowers on the table for us as well. On the same side as the door to our room, is a separate door leading to the bathroom. Nicely tiled in blue and white, this was a very spacious area. Shower (no tub), sink and toilet. Plenty of room for all our bathroom â€˜accessoriesâ€™. Exquisitely decorated, I canâ€™t begin to describe the types of furnishings, although they do leave little notes in the closet about the time period and origin of some of the pieces. Which I thought was so much fun. The bed was fantastically comfortable and we had no trouble sleeping. Although at night it can be a little loud with the spillover from Rembrandt Square partying come to an end around 3am. So bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Pierre delivered breakfast to our room each morning (at a pre-determined time which you and he will select). Beautiful china and flatware. Made it a joy to pour our coffee from the porcelain carafe each morning. The food was wonderful and plenty of it. Each and every morning, we had packed up the EXTRA rolls and cheese to snack on later that night before bed. Yogurt, different breads and croissants, meats, cheeses, OJ and coffee (or tea, you let them know beforehand which you want). You will not be hungry afterwards. Trust me. The other staff we encountered during our stay were all fabulous and friendly. Pierre helped us with shortcuts and directions, and was always smiling and happy to see us come down each morning on our way out for the day. They allowed us to peek into the Garden room one morning as they were cleaning it, and it was even more spectacular â€“ with a step up into a gorgeous little private garden area. Lots of rain ensures there is always plenty in bloom. It was terrific. Free wifi as well, so we stayed connected with family back home each night. Nowhere else will we stay, on our future trips to Amsterdam. Thank you Seven Bridges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MoreTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room A, which was one floor below street level on the canal-side and was essentially a private apartment. We knew up front that no breakfast was included, which was fine for us since we aren't big breakfast people. The room was spacious, spotless and included a kitchenette. Furnishings were attractive and the bed was comfortable. There was plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very nice, with a shower large enough for two people (no tub). The location was great - convenient to tram stops and within walking distance of many sights. The hotel is located in a scenic area with pretty canals, and is outside of the wild-ish central core. The only downside was street noise (late night revelers), although the hotel provided ear plugs. We got a great deal on the room price and the staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. Free wi-fi included. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay@Sevenbridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chacha12
Reviews.Content: Well you have read all of the other great reviews. Every thing they say is true the place is great . I would like to add that when you find a place like Seven Bridges it just make's the entire vacation go so well. We stayed in garden room 4 the last week of June and everything went very well. Thanks Guys

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: maniacmich
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better B&B's I've stayed in to date. We stayed in Room 9, a room on the top floor with a view of the garden. It was very clean and cozy. The staff even gave us a quick tour of Room 10 (a canal view room) as it was vacant at the time. Both rooms were very nice, however if I stayed here again I would stick with the garden view room as I found it to be quiet at night. Breakfast was included in our rate and brought to our room at the time of our choice. The breakfast was very good, it was the same for all 3 mornings of our stay - fruit, yogurt, bread, croissants, meat and cheese. Aside from that, the staff were attentive and pleasant, and were prompt when I emailed them to book a room. If you book less than 2 weeks before your stay, be sure to ask about a last minute rate. One thing to note: they are not kidding when they say that the stairs are steep! Potential bonus for some: there is a coffeeshop next door to this B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Guys- Immaculate Hotel-Cool Antiques”
Reviews.Author: beezlouise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the train from Paris to Amsterdam, and after walking with our bags from Central Station about a mile through the winding streets of Amsterdam- I was ready to check in to a hotel- any hotel. But the walk was more than worth the trek, as we arrived on a quiet canal street full of houses and only a couple of shops. Seven Bridges Hotel is not a commercial style hotel- it is more like a B&B, with about 10 rooms- all different with absolutely beautiful antiques, and comfy beds. The breakfast served is substantial-with really good coffee. The room was quiet, had those towels that are just rough enough to invigorate you after a shower, a laptop you can borrow, fast wireless connection, perfect clean bathroom, and all very light and airy. We were on the top floor in Room 10. Cozy and private with views out over the lovely garden below. Room 9 faces the canal, and is on the same floor- a bit of a hike to the top. Room 5 was an incredible room with terrace and large bathroom. Persian rugs, tasteful antiques, a stunning room that probably cost more than ours- and we will splurge on next time. The proprietors were very friendly and helpful, gave us attention when we needed it- called a cab to the airport, showed us where to rent bikes, etc... Give these guys your business. You will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Book your Amsterdam stay here! Itâ€™s WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: MissK-Wilson
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in early September at the Seven Bridges and absolutely ADORED it. Our room was just gorgeous, with a high ceiling and lovely custom furniture, including a fridge where we could keep our Dutch cheese! The bathroom was spacious (esp. by European hotel standards) and VERY clean, with beautiful tile work. The location is absolutely PERFECT, as far as we were concerned -- on a quiet street in the Canal District, but easy walking distance to ALL Amsterdamâ€™s best attractions (I should know -- I walked EVERYWHERE, from the Van Gogh Museum in the south to the Central Station and Red Light District in the north). Itâ€™s also just two blocks away from the bustle of bars and restaurants in the Rembrandtplein and one more block to the Metro, but again, far enough away that you can sleep at night. Just one night was noisy outside -- but with our windows closed and the VERY effective AC running, we couldnâ€™t hear a thing. The included breakfast is simple (many types of bread -- all delicious -- plus yogurt, fruit, cheese and cold cuts, and coffee or tea) but does the trick -- AND they bring it right to your room! Itâ€™s VERY elegant and civilized. Just watch out for those STEEEEP stairs, and no elevator... But that's true at ANY charming Amsterdam hotel, really. Seven Bridges is SUCH a great place! Such nice guys running it! Look no further!

Reviews.Title: “The second Home!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizaveta86
Reviews.Content: It was our second trip to Amsterdam, of course we choose Seven Bridges Hotel! We booked room no. 6. Itâ€™s wonderful room, with the great canal view. So when we had our delicious breakfast at the morning, we could enjoy the view for beautiful canal and fresh Amsterdamâ€™s air! All rooms in this hotel have their own personalities. When you enter the room no. 6, the first you will see it is the beautiful fireplace, then the big mirror covered the whole wall at the head of the bed and majestic marble table near the window. We have very nice bed-clothes all time with different paintings, I liked it very much! Especially we like the hotel staff, but I should use the other word, because it seems that they our old friends! They created for us unforgettable atmosphere. Thank you very-very much! We miss you all!

Reviews.Title: “Seven Bridges is truely divine, a must stay whilst in beautiful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: movermaker
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a romantic 4 nights in stunning Amsterdam staying in Seven Bridges. All I can say is the hotel lives up to the excellent reviews. Location is excellent, rooms are gorgeous and sumptuous, friendly service which was excellent and the breakfasts are quite simply divine and if that wasn't enough you even have them hand delivered - you can get better than that! My boyfriend and I just loved it - pure luxury! We had a wonderful stay at the hotel and the location is really fantastic, tucked away on a residential street but only 5-10 minute walk from the main squares - PERFECT. I can not recommend enough visiting the Seven Bridges, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific choice for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TwoEurophiles
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in two lovely rooms- Garden Room 4 and Canal View Room 6 -- both lovingly furnished with antiques, bright and airy, lots of room and spacious bathrooms! Pierre was always cheerful in serving elegent breakfasts in the room. You can't ask for a better, more central and walking-friendly location. Narrow stairs might be the only drawback for elderly or handicapped. Fantastic value!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyfour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed in Room 6 (Canal Room view). We loved it. The location could not have been better. It was in a quiet, scenic area yet within a couple of blocks of lots of restaurants/activity. The location itself could not have been more picturesque. The was so much old Amsterdam charm. The owners were very gracious and helpful; helped us very early in the morning clarifying our train ticket. You really feel like you're in Amsterdam when you stay here. Some cities it may not matter as much but in Amsterdam, it is wonderful to be able to have such a unique experience. I highly recommend this hotel. Wonderful breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have made a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: Budson
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 7 nights in July in Room 6 and I cannot speak highly enough of this establishment. It is located in a lovely and quiet neighborhood about 5 minutes walk from Rembrandtplein. As others have said the location is excellent and we were able to walk to all of the major sites with no problem. Furthest sites are maybe 25 mins away walking (Centraal station and Anne Frank House) On days we were feeling lazy we caught the tram (located 2 streets over) to our destined site. Tram cost is 2,60 Euro per person for a 1 time ride. The room was gorgeous with a canal view and was located up one flight of truly steep stairs from the main lobby area. We were totally intimidated by these stairs at first but you do get used to them and the proprietors did help us with our luggage. A comfortable queen sized bed with nice pillows and bedding was a true treat as well as the lovely antique marble table and leather chars we sat at each morning in front of the windows to enjoy our breakfast. Bathroom was equipped with a nice sized shower and was not cramped at all. Good water pressure, clean, and bright, and nice towels, too! We did not really hear any noise at all from the other guests or the street although it is a fairly well used street given its proximity to the Rembrandt square. I would not give this a second thought when considering this hotel because unless you are the world's lightest sleeper you will sleep like a baby. Closet shelving is a bit narrow but lots of shelves to use and also a rod to hang clothes was available. Closets were lockable with lovely old fashioned keys and though the room did not have a safe we felt comfortable leaving valuables locked in the closet or in the hotel safe located with the proprietors. The breakfast. Oh my. The best part of our experience, I'd say. Delivered to our room each morning at 8 AM (you can select the delivery time when you check in) on a tray loaded with 2 croissants, 2 different types of bread, scones or coffee cake, sliced meats and cheese,oranges, bananas, or sometimes apples, fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee or tea, yogurt and a variety of jams. Presentation was on china, a different pattern each day, and absolutely lovely. The breads were warm and fresh, fruit was ripe and the coffee strong and delicious. We felt like we were feasting each morning. Due to the size of this breakfast we did not need to eat again until dinner, which we usually had around 9 PM at one of the restaurants in the Rembrandtplein. Our room was 150 Euros per night including breakfast which I feel was a great deal and on the one day we did not take breakfast, which we advised them of in advance, they deducted the cost of breakfast from our nightly rate (20 euros). Free wifi was also available in our room. Please consider this hotel for your trip to Amsterdam as it is a true gem and will make your trip memorable and special.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fuhyong
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the most interesting boutique hotel we have stayed in recently. For our first time in Amsterdam, we have chosen the seven bridges based entirely on the strength of recommendations from tripadvisor.. Location wise, this hotel is located in the canal belt, about 2 km from the train station where we arrived. As such, it is about 20 minutes walk along the beautiful canals to places of interest such a s rijksmuseum as well as van gogh museum. Many other places of interest are also within walking distance such as the hash museum and the RLD. We walked practically everywhere and did not avail ourselves to the public transport but seeing the many trams lines that we crossed about a mere 3-5 minutes walk away, you shouldn't be too far from access. We requested for the canal view room 7 which was gorgeously decorated with period furniture. Little did we realise that the arm chairs we were sitting on were 17th century antiques! Room was a bit on the small side but adequate (considering that this is Europe afterall). toilets and bath are adequate and spotless in cleanliness. The bed in this room is a queen size which some may find a bit small. The room is air conditioned which works well for some of the warmer nights. View from the room is gorgeous and despite facing the road in front, the little human and vehicular traffic is fairly well insulated and we were not bothered by traffic noises or noises from late night revelers. This room is reached by a tiny and steep circular fire-escape like stairs. can be difficult to maneuver if you have large and heavy luggage which we did. But the owners were around to give a helping hand. Breakfast is served daily by the owners themselves. you can request for it at a pre-determined time which is useful if you need a lie in after a heavy night. Breakfast is served on nice china-ware from the likes of villeroy and boch. Includes croissont, scones and sliced bread, yoggurt, cold cuts and cheese and fruits. choice of tea of coffee is available. We asked for Earl Grey tea and although they said they don;t have it , they still serve it to us on the first morning! also included is a 20 inch flat screen TV which includes many channels including CNN and BBC world. Internet is Free of charge and fairly stable over wifi. In summary, we will strongly recommend this hotel to those seeking a unique place to stay in a wonderful city. Afterall, when was the last time you sleep in a room decorated with bona fide antiques with all the mod cons too?

Reviews.Title: “finding the needle in the haystack - one of a kind in amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: Villavillerkulla
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a favourite place of mine... and to stay at a hotel like Seven Bridges was like finding the needle in the haystack. What a lovely atmosphere, service & location. My boyfriend & me stayed over the weekend... and we could not have picked a better place to stay at. A beautiful room (nr 7) with a view over the canal & the bridges.. The first day as we arrived back to the room after a walk in town... a vase with 20 red roses greeted us in the room. Just like that... a sweet treat from the owners. Yes... at this little hotel the owners really put their heart & soal into what they do. We can truly recommend a stay at this little "pearl" of Amsterdam. Enjoy... HÃ¥kan & Edith

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparky092
Reviews.Content: Just got back home after a 3 night stay in Amsterdam, to celebrate our wedding anniversary, Seven Bridges Hotel was the perfect place to stay. Beautufully decorated, with antique furniture, art and mirrors. Lovely staff, very polite and helpful, use of hotel computers is a nice touch. The location is fantastic, just a few steps from Rembrant Square, where the local bars and restaurants are fantastic. If you want a taste of authentic Amsterdam, in a small, well run family hotel, then seven bridges is for you, we cannot recommend enough. wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST in Amsterdam - Room B is Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: RAINKIR
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel / B&B is one of our favorite places that we have ever stayed anywhere in the world. It is located in a quiet residential neighborhood on the southern canals of Amsterdam near the Rembrandtsplein. You can walk from here to most attractions and also has convenient access to the trams & buses. The hotel gets its name from its location - it has a view of 7 different canals. We stayed in room B, which is in a separate building from the hotel and is essentially your own apartment on the ground floor (no narrow stairs to climb!) with your own separate keyed entrance. There are wall-to-wall windows (with full curtains) in this room, with a lovely view of the canals and bridges in front of the building. We paid only â‚¬130 per night, which is quite a bargain for Amsterdam/Europe. Our room did not include the breakfast but we did have free Wifi which came in handy when we wanted to look up attractions, directions, weather forecast, etc. We absolutely loved staying here and will definitely stay here the next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “really nice (if you like independence)”
Reviews.Author: ANTI1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room B last October .We had a key for the outer door and a key for our room ,which was the only one on the ground floor.It was like having an appartment of your own in beautiful Amsterdam (in a bending building...hillarious!).Cleaning service was effective but not annoying.And the guys at the reception quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't become too popular, we love you.”
Reviews.Author: cliadeltabc
Reviews.Content: A lovely canal house in the best area of the city to walk anywhere and everywhere. Gunter and his staff really made us feel at home for the 19 nights we spent with them. We'd do it again in a heart-beat. Canal room C was beautiful decorated and made us feel so at home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sscheg
Reviews.Content: Niether my boyfriend or I had ever been to Amsterdam before so we didn't know anything about the area or where to stay. I looked to Tripadvisor and picked the Seven Bridges based on all the positive reviews. I am so glad that I did! Since we are students, we have a pretty tight budget and booked Garden Room 3 for 90 euros a night. It says on the website that the bathrrom is "miniscule" but we found it to be more then adequate. The service was excellent and the men who worked there were always friendly and helpful. What really set this place apart from everywhere else I've stayed was the breakfast. It was huge and and delicious. From the yogurt to the bread to the meat, it was absolutely amazing. Also, the location turned out to be just about perfect. We hadn't realized how small Amsterdam really is and were able to walk everywhere. The only time we didn't walk was when we had to go to the train station with all of our luggage but even that was easy since the tram was just a short walk away. All in all, this place was amazing and definitely made our trip that much better. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!!!! Definitely a Hidden Gem.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_R-NJ
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in garden room 3 for 18 nights. I travel regularly to Europe and the Seven Bridges Hotel quickly became my favorite hotel. I have nothing but praise. The hotel is meticulously run. From checking in to checking out, everything goes smoothly. If you need anything you just need to ask. This hotel must be seen to be believed. It is so charming and offers a unique experience. After the craziness experienced in the streets, esp. Queenâ€™s Day, it is so relaxing and comforting to come back here. One major plus for this hotel is that it is quiet. The maid is not outside your door banging into the walls at the crack of dawn. There isnâ€™t screaming in the hallways like you experience at larger hotels. Gunther and Pierre make you feel like family. The location canâ€™t be beat. It is at most a 20-minute walk to anywhere you need to go, including Central Station. I loved being in room 3. It was perfect for a solo traveler although I think 2 people could comfortably stay here. I loved the dÃ©cor. It was great being in the back so I could not hear the noises from the street. Besides the beauty of the rooms the outside is fabulous. It was amazing to stay on the canal â€“ absolutely picture perfect! Another plus is that you can borrow a laptop for a few hours to take to your room. The breakfast is unbelievable. It was so plentiful that I was able to eat some of it for lunch and keep some for a late night snack. This hotel is worth every penny. I will definitely stay here the next time that I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sallyppp
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at Seven Bridges Hotel and I feel so blessed that I found this little Gem in a city with so many options. I stayed in #9 and it was perfect for a solo traveler. I had a bad experience my first night in the city and when I shared it with the management he assured me it was not the normal Amsterdam experience. When I returned to my room later that day there was a hugh bouguet for red tulips there to cheer me up. The location was perfect...very quiet but alot of action just around the corners. If you stay here ask them to arrange a taxi from John to pick you up from the airport/train station. They get a special hotel rate. The cabs @ Central station will overcharge you...

Reviews.Title: “Bed, Breakfast, Stairs and Bridges”
Reviews.Author: walkerboydog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful with one caveat. The location is great-a few blocks from Rembrandt Plein and an easy walk to almost everywhere in Amsterdam. It sits on a canal within view of several others and numerous bridges in a quiet neighborhood. It is an easy walk from the tram. The rooms are great-we stayed in 2 rooms both on the top floor. The first was garden side and the second canal side. Both were quiet and comfortable and clean with antiques and adequate baths and modern amenities. The innkeepers were wonderful. Friendly and gracious with helpful info. Our breakfasts were brought to the room every morning with pots of tea and coffee, croissants, breads, cheeses, fruit, yogurt and fresh juice. Very ample. The only problem was the stairs to the room. Though well documented by the innkeeper who ahead of our visit, warned the stairs were steep and they provided no help with bags, they were still formidable. Steep is an understatement and narrow needs another adjective to fully explain how tough they were to navigate with luggage. All that said, I would go for a room on the lower floors in a heartbeat and if I were younger I would stay up top again. Think of it as a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romance in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EugeneTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from seven nights at the Seven Bridges. We were celebrating 30 years of marrage and wanted a quiet, romantic trip. We could not have picked a better spot. The location, on a canal between two larger canals in the charming "canal belt" of Amsterdam, was delightful. We were centrally located between the old city and the museum area and went to all the major tourist venues, either by walking, taking trams or by rented bike. Eric and Gunther, the propriators, were very helpful without being obtrusive. They brought a huge breakfast to our room every morning and provided all the support and information we wanted. We stayed in room 6, on the first floor overlooking the street and the canal. The view was great. Sitting in the comfortable leather chairs and watching the passing parade was fun. There was a great Italian restaurant on the corner and a nice bar/restaurant with jazz on the weekend a few doors away. And lots of wonderful walks in the neighborhood. A few things to bear in mind, if you are going to stay there. There is not really a lobby, just an entrance hall. So if you picture yourself sitting around the lobby visiting with the other residents, you would be disappointed. And this street can be a little noisy on weekend nights, but the rooms have double windows, heavy drapes and air conditioners, so that did not disturb us. We would have no hesitations about staying there in the future and give it the highest recommendations. I'm sure there are less expensive places to stay, but I doubt you would find a more charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most charming hotels we've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: fred092
Reviews.Content: The Seven Bridges is tiny but with unique charm--a quiet,canalside location and rooms that have to be seen to be believed . Furnished with genuine antiques ( with provenance attached) they give one a sense of what life in a canal house must have been like in Amsterdam's Golden Age. The owners/hosts are very friendly and helpful and the breakfasts,served in room,easliy held us until dinner time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Squeebster
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough, the rooms are lovely and the breakfast served in your room is throughly enjoyable. Fantastic location too.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and charming”
Reviews.Author: pinneycat
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Seven Bridges, especially the attention to detail in the rooms (we stayed in the beautiful, art deco style rm 6). Location couldn't be better, with great views out onto the canal and other 17th and 18th century buildings. A highlight for me was breakfast served in the room each morning, which included fresh juice, warm croissants and rye bread which I really love, amongst plenty of other things to fill you up for most of the day. We will definitely try to return to this hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Charming canal house experience in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Europhile62
Reviews.Content: Every care from the reservation process, to our very clean room, to the delicious breakfast each morning, to helpful hints about things to do in Amsterdam, we were thoroughly delighted with the Seven Bridges Hotel. The owners have ensured on their website that what you see is what you get and it is all very nice. Despite being near to the noisy Rembrantsplein our garden facing room #10 was full of birdsong every morning and the views of the neighbors gardens. I would definitely recommend this excellent value in a convenient neighborhood to anyone going to the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, romantic, cheerful, best location ever”
Reviews.Author: MMMPaloAlto_CA
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. The owner was friendly, helpful, even let us switch rooms when the ceiling was too low for my tall BF. Each room was different (we peeked) and charming as could be. The location couldn't be better, right on one of the main side canals, an easy walk to almost anywhere. The furniture and art were delightful and it all felt like a special discovery. The owner put fresh tulips in every room, which I appreciated. Actually, it kind of felt like an extension of a personal home...it had a friendliness, a coziness, that felt intimate. We loved this place and would definitely stay here again. And will, when we next are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel to experience Amsterdam!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Ozzies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges Hotel at the start of our holiday in Europe. It is a great little boutique hotel almost in the centre of the old city. Our hosts were excellent, spoke great English and made us feel most welcome. The hotel is a great experience rather than just a place to stay. The old world furnishings, excellent breakfasts and ease of foot access all made our stay great. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to the traveller who cherishes good accommodation without the all too familiar trappings of many modern hotels. Doug and Ellen from Queensland Australia

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Trig_and_Yuko
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in room #6. Each morning a delicious breakfast was brought to our room and we sat at an antique table next to a window with a beautiful view of one of the canals. What a way to start the day! The hotel is in a really good location also so that it is possible to walk from there to just about all the sights in the city (provided that you like to walk.) The staff also provided absolutely anything we needed. Our first day there it was windy and raining, and as soon as we stepped outside a gust promptly destroyed the umbrella we had brought. The hotel immediately loaned us one of theirs; a very strong one that lasted the rest of our stay. Once we came downstairs asking about how much it would cost to send a postcard to Japan. Not only did they mail the card for us, they provided us with the stamps as well... no charge. Wonderful, wonderful people at the Seven Bridges!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and charming”
Reviews.Author: VLP36
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Seven Bridges for six days last month, and it was the highlight of my time abroad. My rooms were Canal View Room 6, Canal View Room 7, and Garden View Room 8, all of which are impeccably appointed- room 6, with its deep red leather chairs and cool light fixtures, is especially lovely. The in-room breakfast service is a delicious way to begin one's morning. And the graciousness of the staff is simply unparalleled. For example, when I discovered that I had forgotten my voltage adapter, they brought up a few different ones for me to try, and upon figuring out that none of those worked, they immediately went out and found a suitable one for me- at 9:30 AM, no less! This meticulous attention to guests' comfort is why I will be returning to Seven Bridges on my next trip to Amsterdam. An extraordinary place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PabloRuizBerkeley
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room with a garden view. The breakfast was great and the hosts couldn't have been nicer or more gracious. The hotel is centrally located, easy walking distance to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum, as well as Rembrandthuis.

Reviews.Title: “An individual & homely haven in the perfect location with lovely hosts”
Reviews.Author: sweetpBham
