Reviews.Content: The 7 Bridges hotel is in the perfect location & a wonderful place to stay not only because the rooms are very comfortable and homely with a delicious breakfast served to your room. The hosts are so helpful and lovely and we had the best time and would return again :-))

Reviews.Title: “Our week at Seven Bridges Hotel was ideal for us.”
Reviews.Author: Shane9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautifully converted old house in an ideal location along one of Amsterdam's many canals. We had Room Seven at the back overlooking small gardens, a spacious, nicely appointed, and quiet room. We especially enjoyed the complete European style breakfast served in our room each morning. It was a lovely way to start our day. The location of the hotel is ideal because it is in a residential area and only a short walk to excellent restaurants and cafes and also to trams to the center of the city or to the art museums. There is no elevator and the stairs are narrow, but it was not a problem for us. The owners are very helpful and courteous. We would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and grace in Amsteredam”
Reviews.Author: Rex-Imperator
Reviews.Content: The Seven Bridges hotel is as charming and graceful a hotel as you will find in Amsterdam. The hotel is along the Reguliersgracht, where it intersects with the Keizersgracht, (giving you a view of at least seven bridges.) The rooms vary in size and furnishings from a cozy, beamed third floor room to elegant, antique filled rooms on the lower floors. The staff were very kind and helpful, with good suggestions for dining as well as travelling. Instead of the typical bland breakfast buffet, the Seven Bridges brings your breakfast to your room; croissants and different breads, cheeses, ham and jams, fresh fruit, yogurt as well as juice and coffee or tea. The hotel has a perect location, just a few minutes stroll south of the Rembrandtplein. My criteria for selecting a hotel location are safety, quiet and especially good proximity to restaurants. The Seven Bridges hotel is located between Utrechtsestraat and Reguliersdwarsstraat which are lined with some of the best restaurants in Amsterdam. The only downside is the hotel's web-site which does not allow for on-line booking. However, don't be dissuaded - a quick phone call and a helpful staff person gave us the perfect room. The rooms vary in size, furnishings and rfates, so a room for most every budget is possible. - a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel on Reguliersgracht”
Reviews.Author: aswb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days during the week of March 1. The location is great and so is the view. It's close to the large museums and there are numerous shops, cafes, and restaurants nearby. We had booked one of the smallest rooms on the top floor but a larger room (#7) was available for the first two days. It was a beautiful room with large windows looking out onto the canal. The antiques were gorgeous and each morning we were served an enormous breakfast that we could eat while gazing out our window. (The china service was different every day.) For the final two days of our stay, we were in the small room (#10) which had exposed beams and lots of small windows. It was not as opulent as the first room but it was clean, cozy, and had lots of character. In fact, it's character that I want to emphasize. Our rooms, and a few others we got to peek at, were very well designed and decorated. Each was different and all were far superior to a room at a very good chain hotel. The owner was very responsive and helpful. He even delivered a computer to our room after I mentioned that I was having a difficult time accessing the wireless network with my own. One caveat: mind the stairs! There are 46 stairs to the top floor and they are steep! I hope to return to Amsterdam soon and this hotel will be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel in THE Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickGavan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room at the top of the house -- #10 I believe -- and were rewarded with a beautiful view of the gardens behind several of the adjacent canal houses. The location could not be better, and the service/staff were excellent. The furnishings in our room showed terrific attention to detail and the breakfast was hearty and delicious. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: NosniborParis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Room 5 last weekend - what a uniquely good experience it was on every level. The two Partners were most efficient and gracious, the decor splendid and having breakfast delivered to your room each morning is an added bonus. Exceptional value for money. Do not hesitate. We shall be back there ourselves next time.

Reviews.Title: “For a superb weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: colleagues
Reviews.Content: The Seven Bridges was absolutely fabulous. It looked good at the internet site, but in real life it looks even better. The location of the hotel is probably the best in Amsterdam, at a picturesque crossing of two canals (check out their site, www.sevenbridgeshotel.nl), 200 meters from the busy district. So you have the advantage of staying in a beautiful, quiet residential neighborhood, whereas at any time it takes you 3 minutes to reach the lively, busy city center. It takes less than 30 minutes of walking to reach any other place of interest or 5 minutes in the tram (there is a station nearby). Interestingly, there were hardly any tourists although the weather was not too bad (a little bit of drizzle, temperatures in the range of 6-15 Celsius) so it seems like a good season to tour Amsterdam. We stayed in room C. The room is magnificent (again, just look at the site but the pictures underestimate). You enter a 17th century house and climb a surprisingly steep staircase into a rather spacious room, which includes a living room with a view of the canal and the bridge, a bedroom, and a bathroom. Everything is furnished in great taste with beautiful antique furniture and the organization is very comfortable. It is evident that someone really thought about every detail. The staff is extremely friendly, attentive and helpful. We are not very well organized so we booked the hotel at the last minute. The booking was very smooth and in 5 minutes we got a confirmation email with all the necessary details from GÃ¼nter, who welcomed us at 9 AM. As he had promised, the room was ready although it was much earlier than the standard check-in time. The level of service is very impressive, especially for a small hotel that cannot hire a large staff. Everyone in this hotel is courteous and effective. Among the amenities is a free laptop that you can borrow if you do not want to carry around your own (the internet connection is also free). GÃ¼nter also organized for us a taxi to the airport at a discounted price. To conclude, this is a real gem which we fully recommend to anyone and, of course, we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AntoineR
Reviews.Content: If you like atmosphere, nice furnitures, great canal view, perfect location, and attentive service, go straight to 7 bridges. I was there this week and this will be "my" place whenever i go back to Amsterdam A seasoned traveler

Reviews.Title: “cosy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: zeyp
Reviews.Content: our hotel is situated in one of the most important canal views in amsterdam as well as its architecture. the canal is so nice that, it is a very nice pleasure to enjoy the view from the window. we stayed at seven bridges for 4 nights, 1night at at garden view room, 3nights at attic canal view. every room has its own special design and furniture! the workers are very friendly. we as a group of 4 people, really enjoyed the hotel, its warmth atmosphere and closeness to the center. also the surroundings are very nice, it is in a residential district, so you don.t feel like a stranger. i really recommend the hotel. thanks for the discount for us, Turkish turists :)

Reviews.Title: “Charming comfortable gem in a perfect postion.”
Reviews.Author: arriva
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this delighful and very comfortable hotel. Snowed in airports in Britain meant we were obliged to stay and extra night and were very glad to do so! Our room was no 7 on the canal side where the view was fabulous. The very generous and delicious breakfast served in our room was great and so much nicer than having to get up for breakfast. The owners were very friendly and helpful. All so different from an impersonal chain hotel We look forward to our next stay and will recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireNick
Reviews.Content: spent four nights in the seven bridges. Far enough away from the centre to be nice and quiet but close enough to be in the action only a few minutes walk away. More of a b and b than a hotel. Breakfast large and nice and delivered to your room when you want it . Spotlessly clean and with extremely helpfull staff if you need help with anything. If you dont need anything they will let you come and go as you please with nothing more than a cheerfull good morning. Highly reccomended and we will definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jenann1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 8 of the Seven Bridges Hotel with 2 girlfriends for 2 nights in January. We were warmly welcomed by the owner, who, upon request, helpfully recommended two nearby restaurants - we ate in one on our first evening and were not disappointed. The outside of the hotel looks lovely; it is situated in the prettiest part of the city, and although the lobby is small and unimpressive, our room, and the others we glimpsed during our stay there, was exceptional - loads of style and charm. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean with plenty of hot water, beds were comfortable and any requests we made (for extra pillows, more hot water for coffee) were fulfilled promptly and with a smile. Breakfast was brought up on a tray (quite a feat with those narrow staircases) and was more than adequate. In summary, the Seven Bridges represents excellent value for money and would be my first choice of accommodation next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great rate, some grumbles”
Reviews.Author: PDH01
Reviews.Content: efficient but caring staff and brilliant location. room 9 was a gem, to me more charmingly haphazard than the museum some other reviewers saw. best part was watching the city wake up from the 5th floor window while eating breakfast. minor issues to me was the insufficient pressure in the shower (probably because of the height), and that the bed was way too hard (=standard South european) for a Scandinavian. i got a very good rate by phoning the hotel the day before.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful hotel, excellent quiet canalside location”
Reviews.Author: mekOslo
Reviews.Content: booked just a few days prior to arrival and was lucky to get a discounted room. every detail high quality, charming and personal. very helpful, proud and friendly properitor and staff. breakfast served in our room was included in the rent and a very pleasant part of our littel "romantic getaway" in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection! Like staying in A Museum!”
Reviews.Author: Bohilla
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel! Booking via telephone was easy and efficient. We got a great last minute rate which was a bonus. We arrived in Amsterdam around noon and the hotel very kindly allowed us to check in straight away instead of the usual 3 p.m. check-in. The hotel is a lovely canal house located on the corner of two beautiful canals. The location is excellent. The room itself was filled to the brim with antiques. It was like staying in a museum. Breakfast is included in the room rate and is delivered to your room in the morning. The breakfast was one of the best I have experienced in a hotel where it was included in the rate. Lovely fresh pastries and bread, cold meats, cheeses, coffee, tea, fruit, yoghurt...you couldn't ask for more. Every morning, the breakfast would be tailored to what you liked or didn't like from the morning before. There isn't a thing I can complain about. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: JennyLind
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Seven Bridges. Our hosts were most kind in helping us make reservations and negotiating our stay...even provided us with earplugs on New Years Eve so that we could sleep through the night long fireworks. I loved the beautiful breakfast served on different china each morning. Such a lovely touch. This was certainly one of the best hotels that we have stayed in any major city in Europe. And to top it off, the Seven Bridges is in a great location on a beautiful canal.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure.....”
Reviews.Author: BigChas007
Reviews.Content: A truly delightful hotel that delivered on all of its promises. Quirky and individual, definitely not a bog-standard chain hotel. And all the better for that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaAustralia
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. Our room was beautifully furnished with antique furniture and had a wonderful view of the canal. Lovely fresh flaky croissants, pastries and fruit were carried up to our room every morning so that we could eat breakfast at a table by the window and watch the life in the street below. A fantastic experience. The management were friendly and anxious to help and everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jimjeff
Reviews.Content: We have been very remiss in writing this review. Our stay in January was the 4th time we stayed at the Seven Bridges. We had a slight problem on arrival and Gunther & Pierre were most helpful in resolving it. We were enjoying our stay so much that we extended it by several days. I've stayed at other small hotels in Amsterdam and none of them came close to matching the charm and space. I wouldn't recommend the Seven Bridges to everyone, and neither would the owners. The stairs are steep and you have to carry your own bags. If you are someone who overpacks or isn't able to climb stairs, you might want to consider somewhere else. If you can get past this then this is the place to stay. I can't recommend it enough. Great location. Fabulous breakfast served in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to experience Amsterdam hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Tomochan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for three nights in room 8. The room faced the garden with two very comfortable beds, antique furniture for closet/storage space and a very clean bathroom. They had a towel heating rack in the bathroom and adjustable heater in the room so we were never cold or too hot. I can't remember the number of TV channels available but definitely more English channels than just CNN or BBC news. I really loved the breakfast served in room. The croissants were still hot when we received them and the bananas/oranges were great mid-morning snack to take with us for later. They served awesome coffee as well. All in all, it was way better than the normal continental breakfast you get at typical European hotels. I also loved the fact that the hotel was not right on a tram line or a tram stop, it's in a really quiet area. It was a great place to relax after walking around all day. Amsterdam is definitely made for walking or biking! We walked to most of the sights, and the only time we really took the tram was when we went to Centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Seven Bridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poorrichard6
Reviews.Content: We loved this perfect hotel in an old canal house on a centrally located quiet side street. We could walk to everything. The proprietors couldn't have been more considerate and welcoming. They gave us an extremely helpful map that got us oriented right away on this our first trip to Amsterdam. The room was quiet and beautiful and cozy at the very top of the house under the eaves, overlooking the pretty gardens, with comfortable colorful furnishings and a nice bathroom with towels that were especially wonderful since they were heated on their racks. The breakfasts served in the room (and whose arrival we were thoughtfully forewarned about 5 - 10 minutes in advance by phone) were spectacular and huge--multiple kinds of warm breads, fruits, yogurts, ham and cheese, and coffee or tea served in a china pot, all on china dishes. We borrowed a hotel laptop free of charge once or twice too when we needed to reconnect with the real world. The only people I wouldn't recommend the hotel to are people with disabilities because the steps are steep (but then again, we were at the very top), as they are in all real canal houses. Seven Bridges is a real gem and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: foleydog1
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a little mini vacation over Thanksgiving, and settled on Amsterdam. In September, after we booked the airline tickets, we started looking at hotels and this came highly rated. I placed a call to the hotel, and GÃ¼nter told me which rooms were available for our seven night stay. After looking at their very comprehensive website, we chose canal room 6. The pictures represent ABSOLUTELY what the rooms are like. Additionally, after we booked the room, we received a wonderful e-mail with some additional pictures of the hotel. When we arrived after our 10 hour flight from Los Angeles, we were made to feel right at home. The room and bath were spotless. The bath was large (for Europe), and in wonderful working order. The view from the room great as well. We received a call every morning before breakfast (startling that first day), but a good idea as the northern daylight difference had us in a deep sleep at 8:00. The breakfast was good (too big for us), but I was delighted to have hot tea every morning just like home. Also it was wonderful to be able to borrow a laptop on a couple of different occasions to get museum and restaurant info. Additionally when the red leather chairs bled over a white shirt my first afternoon (we could never figure it out), the hotel was nice enough to take my shirt out to be dry cleaned. The little touches were wonderful - they gave us stamps rather than sending us to the post office, and there was always a friendly face to greet us - plus we had our own key so there was no buzzing to wake someone at night to let you in. The best part of the stay is what we felt secure enough to leave our electronic gadgets in the room, and didn't feel at all disturbed by the cleaning staff. I highly recommend this for that home away from home feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: johnnap
Reviews.Content: Had a room 6 overlooking the canal. Aside from some scaffolding being set up outside our window on our last morning, the stay was perfect. Easy to get around town both walking and with the trams. Breakfast was served on a large tray each morning and we enjoyed the canal view while eating in or PJ's Will definitely go back on my next trip to Amsterdam. I travel there at least three times a year and this was one of the best experiences we have had with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: Malthus
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Amsterdam and I was not sure what to expect. Even though it was only two nights, I was very impressed with the City and especially the Seven Bridges Hotel. Gunter and his staff were very helpful and made my stay very pleasant. Breakfast in my room was amazing (see my picture). My room overlooked the canal (room #6) and was filled with beautiful antiques and wonderful details; very quiet and comfortable. The garden view will be my choice for my next visit; looks very nice and quiet. As has been posted, the location is perfect; close to attractions, but the feeling of being off the beaten path. I was recommended to eat at a small Italian place near the Hotel, (Ponte Arcari) which had wonderful authentic Italian cuisine. Great time, and I'll be back soon. Thanks Gunter for the wonderful stay. (Renee) *****

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this place - would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: darcy_kerrigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Seven Bridges Hotel for our stay in Amsterdam after reading all of the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor. Let me tell you - they were right! From the moment we approached the hotel on foot along the Reguliersgracht, I knew we'd found something special. The location is wonderful. It's on a quiet tree-lined canal, only a short walk from the hustle and bustle. Erik checked us in and showed us to our room. He was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Room #7, which was a canal-view room on the 3rd floor. The room exceeded my expectations, even though I had seen the pictures on their website. It had 3 huge windows along the front. Each morning I would open them to the fresh air and sit there and watch the street below. It was fabulous and very relaxing. Both the room and the bathroom were large by European standards. I've stayed in some hotels in Paris and London where you literally walk into the room and trip over the bed. This was nothing like that. There is also a TV in the room, but we never turned it on. Who needs TV when you've got that view out of your window?! If I ever return to Amsterdam, I will definitely be staying at the Seven Bridges again. It was a truly wonderful experience. Restaurant tip: If you like Italian, there is a fabulous restaurant down the street in Thorbeckplein called Isola Bella Cucina Italiana. I highly recommend it. It was so good, we ate there twice!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: annieb_wales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for the traveller who enjoys hotels that are a bit different. The Seven Bridges is ideally situated near enough to the centre of Amsterdam for easy access, but also far away enough from the crowds. We enjoyed our lovely breakfasts brought to our room, and managed to survive the climb up 3 flights of steep stairs without getting too much out of breath! The room was lovely and the bed very comfortable. There are good restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickyormonde
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a two night break in Amsterdam. It was a most enjoyable short break made all the better by staying at the Seven Bridges. A lovely small hotel right on the canal. We stayed in Room 8 - a large room on the second floor with two double beds. We had a small but perfectly adequate en suite shower room. Breakfast, as mentioned previously, is brought up into your bedroom. It is just like all the photos - too much to eat - but delicious!!! The hotel is in a great position near the Rembrantsplein. There are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops nearby. However, it only takes a few minutes by tram to get right into the centre. A fabulous hotel - would highly recommend. The owners are honestly some of the nicest people we have ever met! Couldn't do enough for you. Even lent us a laptop to check our emails. You will have a guaranteed great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find”
Reviews.Author: jb1958
Reviews.Content: I've had the most wonderful holiday in Amsterdam, thanks in great part to the wonderful proprietors at the Seven Bridges Hotel. Gunter,Pierre and Eric are exceptional "innkeepers". There hotel is truly a rare gem. From check in to check out they made every step of my stay truly a vacation! From securing opera tickets, to suggesting excellent restaurants and making dinner reservations to assisting with navigating the public transportation, they do it ALL and with a smile! In addition the accomodations are terrific, well located and lovely. The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance from just about everything that one would care to see. It is a charming traditional "house" laden with lovely antique furnishings replete with beautiful modern bathrooms. What more could one ask for? I can't wait to return and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds High Expectations on all Counts”
Reviews.Author: HumJB
Reviews.Content: Location - Service - Style - Value The Seven Bridges succeeds on all counts! Location - On a quiet canal just outside of the heart of the city. All of the great attractions are within walking distance. And when you need it, a choice of trams are only a block away. Fine dining and the cuisines of the world are plentiful within two blocks in any direction. Service - The three hosts go the extra mile to make sure your stay is special. Need a restaurant recommendation or reservation - need directions - need an extra umbrella - all done with class. It was a real treat each morning to have breakfast delivered to our room at a time of our chosing - fresh, warm, and plentiful - served on lovely china which changed each day. Style - You reserve for a specific room at the Seven Bridges. We had Garden Room 4 - at the quieter back on the same level as reception. Our collegues were in Rooms 8 and 10 - up two and three flights. Fair warning - there is no lift and the stairs are steep and winding. Our room exceeded our expectations - comfortable foam mattress and lovely furnishings. Value - 140 Euro including breakfast for terrific accomodations and service. As good as it gets in Amsterdam. We loved our six night stay at the Seven Bridges and will not hesitate to return if we get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Clicquot
Reviews.Content: If you don't want a good location on a pretty, quiet canal, generous breakfasts brought by friendly hosts to your spacious high-ceilinged room (#5) and large bathroom with a shower that meets husband's high standards of spray and temperature, then this isn't the place for you. Only people wanting perfect decor and communal breakfasts to meet fellow travelers will be disappointed. We actually ended up in the same room we enjoyed 10 years ago. Advice we could have used: if your taxi from the train station tries to charge 20 euros, report his number to your hosts. It shouldn't be more than about 12 euros.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: figarobuddy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at Seven Bridges. This has to be the best hotel in Amsterdam! Gunther and Pierre were most gracious of hosts in this wonderful canal house located in a picture perfect setting. Each morning they would bring a breakfast to our room that included cheese, meats, fruits, yogurt, orange juice, coffee and very fresh croissants and assorted breads. The rooom was spacious and decorated with great care. This was the best vacation ever and we hope that we will be able to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: jennifer456
Reviews.Content: The Seven Bridges Hotel offered everything that I was looking for and a LOT more! This was my first trip to Amsterdam and with the help of Gunther and Eric, it was like traveling with our own personal guides! The location was perfect - right in the center of the canal district and easy walking to all of the museums and public transportation. The hotel was spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. Gunther and Eric were more than willing to answer any questions and they even researched the opera performances, made great dinner recommendation (and even made reservations for us) and guided us through all of the points of interests with great directions on how to get there. I hope to return to Amsterdam and I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else. They made us feel completely at home and comfortable. What a wonderful adventure and a perfect travel experience! Jennifer Aries Phoenix, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “An Amsterdam Gem”
Reviews.Author: ClayBradUT
Reviews.Content: When some think of Amsterdam their first thought might be their favorite restaurant, coffee bar, museum or district. When I think of Amsterdam my first thought is the Seven Bridges Hotel. Without question this special place made my trip. It is located in a quite street just outside of the heart and soul of the city. Everything is within walking distance and for those longer treks the tram (which is so easy to use) is one block away. There are more than enough fine dinning restaurants and other famous Amsterdam establishments just a stones throw away. The hotel itself offers many wonderful characteristics. First, the hosts Pierre and Gunter, will make sure your stay is comfortable and to your satisfaction. Each morning breakfast is delivered to your room at your desired time. The breakfast was always fresh, warm, and plentiful. You have your choice of rooms at the Seven Bridges. We had room four and eight. Both rooms were above our expectations in comfort, dÃ©cor, and ambiance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an authentic and memorable place to stay. The stairs are steep but most people would find this aspect of the hotel to be unique. The stairs were not a problem for us and we had to haul two 50lb bags up the stairs for our business meeting. This was my second trip to Amsterdam and by far the best. I felt as though I could not ask for anything more out of a hotel and its hosts. The Seven Bridges is they only place I will ever stay in Amsterdam and I am already planning a return trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: OldP
Reviews.Content: Unusual private hotel. Off the main drag but a short walk to most places. As mentioned by others the stairs are steep and the breakfasts could see you through the day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffeeal
Reviews.Content: Have been to Amsterdam many times but really saw it for the fist time because of this hotel. How wonderful to see Gunter every morning bringing us our breakfast! Miss you Gunter! Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AntoineT
Reviews.Content: Room 6 at the Seven Bridges is not a hotel room. It is the room you would have created for your own personal use if you had the time, taste and attention to details of the 7 Bridges' owners. Of course, you would also need to have a lovely building facing a beautiful canal in the center of Amsterdam... We spent four wonderful nights before reluctantly having to admit that room 6 was not our appartment and that we had to check out. I can only repeat what the other reviewers have said: the location is great, the rooms are beautiful and calm (we slept like logs), and the breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this very small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sharandel
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to A'dam in many years, we were delighted with this conveniently located, quiet, very small but elegant hotel. Room #4 on the first level - overlooking the peaceful rear garden - is quite spacious with beautiful furnishings. The bed was quite comfortable; the bathroom also comfortable, with a very good shower. Breakfasts were sumptuous (if unvarying). Hosts were friendly and kind, but not obtrusive. All in all, the price was very reasonable. We're rather fussy but definitely recommend this and plan to stay there in future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: cat_rum
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Seven Bridges Hotel was absolutely perfect! The hotel is very nice, situated on lovely canals probably in the most beautiful part of Amsterdam which is calme but at the same time very close to the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms are very pretty equipped (we had the room nÂ°10 with nice view to the garden). All the staff is very pleasant and helpful with everything you need! Breakfast is very rich, delicious and served to your room. We recommend Seven Bridges Hotel to all travellers who want to visit Amsterdam and who want to have a lovely accomodation in this beautiful city. Once, we would like to return to Amsterdam and of course to Seven Bridges Hotel. Katherine from Prague

Reviews.Title: “Unpolite manager”
Reviews.Author: seliga18
Reviews.Content: I strongly do not recommend to stay in a place, where the manager don't believe in the quality of his own hotel. I try to book a room in the Seven Bridges Hotel and after some emails conversations, I ask Gunter to inform me about the details I was supposed to forward him to make the reservation, but he refused to inform, saying the the only room avaible should not attend my expectation. All this happened because it would be my first trip to Europe (i am from Brazil) and I mde some questions about the room, trying not to dissapoint my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mattldavies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best way to stay in Amsterdam. It's a house, traditional in style and right by some of the most attractive canals in the city. It's got everything - character, quiet area, close to attractions, close to places to eat (including Rembrandtsplein/square). So you can get to everything easily - but you can also escape the bustle of the city and feel like you're a resident there for your stay. The hospitality of the owners is excellent too. They are friendly and helpful - and even call you when breakfast is about to be brought to your room. The breakfast is a large mix of breads, cheese, meat, croissants and fruit. I really can't falt this hotel - it has to be one of the best in the city if you want character places with the feeling of being in a traditional setting right be the canalside.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Repsey
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. The hosts are very friendly and accommodating. We stayed in room 6 which overlooks the canal. The bed is a very low platform bed, which didn't bother us but might be a problem for some. What did bother us was the very firm mattress which we aren't used to. You should also be advised that the stairway is quite steep. The room had no wash cloths or facial tissues, but the hosts were generous with toiletries. The hosts made several restaurant recommendations in the area, but we weren't especially pleased by any until our third day when we ate at Le Pecheur located at Reguliersdwarsstraat 32. It was excellent and prices were reasonable. With regard to Amsterdam restaurants, we suggest you ignore the guidebooks and avoid The Pancake Factory. The pancakes are NOT like crepes. They are the size of pizzas, are thick and greasy, and are not done. You will love the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: JemBath
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel having stayed there back in 2006, and it's just as magnificant as before! We stayed in room 9, which is up lots of really steep stairs, but is well worth the climb. The view of the canal is beautiful and the room is filled with stunning antiques - absolutely superb. Everyone who works there was lovely, yet completely unobtrusive. The huge continental breakfast is served in the room, and they even give you a call to let you know when it's coming. The area is beautiful and very quiet compared to the rest of the city. There was occasionally a bit of shouting from revellers outside, but it wasn't too bad and the ear plugs - thoughtfully provided by the hotel - did the job nicely! I absolutely love this place and can't wait to return as soon as I possibly can!

Reviews.Title: “Seven Bridges is a Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: clynne
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of being in Amsterdam and staying at the very classy, yet understated, Seven Bridges Hotel. Our proprietors were very, very gracious and our rooms (my husband and I had room 8, our teenage boys had room 5) were absolutely perfect with fresh flowers, antique furniture, a patio and garden and a very modern bathroom. We were served a delicious breakfast every morning in our room (every day the China on which it was served was of a different pattern!) and found the location excellent. Both of our rooms faced the gardens and were quiet but honestly, the canal side was quiet too. We were just a quick walk to a tram stop and found restaurants and shopping very accessible too. I hesitate to write this review because I would like this hotel to be kept a secret, but our hosts are so deserving of this accolade that I must let others know about this gem of a place. Cathy

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: Bon_Bon_007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges Hotel for a long weekend getaway. Its location couldn't be any more perfect, situated in the heart of the Golden Bend. We purchased the "I Am Amsterdam" card and the tram stop is just a minute away from the hotel. But if you prefer to travel on foot, Seven Bridges is in close proximity to pretty much everything. Plus, who could resisit a romantic walk along these beautiful canals in Amsterdan. As for the room, we stayed in Room #6, directly facing the canal. The owner was worried that we may find it noisy, but we had absolutely no complaints. It was pleasantly quiet. The room decor is just as described & photographed at their website. I haven't seen other rooms in person, but our room is exactly (100%) as described in website. Very charming, clean & lovely. Speaking of website, the hotel does not do any online/internet booking. One must contact them directly. They are extremely good at getting back to inquiries/bookings. Very smooth process. Overall, our experience at the Seven Bridges was great. For those of you from North American, I would not call it a "Hotel" as it lacks the amenities one often associates with a hotel. It is more like a Bed & Breakfast. An EXCELLENT one. Way better than staying at a hotel, unless you want the gym, pool, concierage, room service, restaurant....the whole nine yards. But those of you looking for quaint private places that is quiet enough yet conveniently located, this is the place to you. And I almost forgot about the breakfast they served. Portion was very generous and certainly enough to prepare for all the walks in the city. Peaceful. Quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yes its perfect.”
Reviews.Author: 19Shaun77
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel we have ever stayed at that made us feel like leaving a review. My partner and I would just like to say how romantic this special little hotel makes you feel. So if its a romantic break you are looking for with an authentic dutch feel then you will not be disappointed. We can both honestly say that the hotels location is perfect for both shopping, sight seeing,or just people watching from the comfort of your room. So all you need to do now is pick the right room. We opted for Room C and it was brilliant in every way.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: ludling
Reviews.Content: One of the best features of Seven Bridges is its location. Within about two blocks, you can find anything you need, from restaurants, to tram stops, to coffeeshops. It's especially nice for first-time visitors who will be roaming all over the city and need a centrally-located home base that's easy to get to from any of the main sights. The owners are very sweet and attentive. The complimentary breakfast (brought up to your room!) is wonderful, with juice, coffee, tea, meat, cheese, fruit, yogurt, and a variety of breads. We could never finish the whole thing, so we usually saved the bananas for eating while out exploring later in the day. The cleaning service was always great. Even the bathmat was changed daily, with a different color every day! Little touches like this made it clear that the owners really cared about what they were doing, adding to the overall charm of the place. The free wireless internet was a blessing. It was great being able to spend downtime over breakfast and before bed keeping in touch with friends and family and searching the internet for information about the next day's adventures in Amsterdam. We stayed five nights in room 10, the Garden Room, which was incredibly quiet. We were amazed at just how peaceful the room was. Even during Holland's string of wins in Euro 2008, with excited football fans in local bars just a block or two away, we were never disturbed. Some of the canal-view rooms might be a bit noisier just because they overlook the street, but the street always seemed very quiet, so noise is certainly not a problem in the hotel, and especially not in the Garden Room. The room itself was small, but not uncomfortably so. It's perfectly-sized for a single or couple who don't plan on spending all day in the room (which you shouldn't be doing in Amsterdam anyway!). There is a little nook for doing work out of sight of the bed, which came in very handy when one of us wanted to sleep while the other needed to use the computer. The only negatives are incredibly minor. The breakfast table in the room was too small for the huge breakfast, but using the bed as extra table space worked fine. As others have noted, and as is true for many hotels in Amsterdam, the staircase is very small and tightly spiraled. You will have a lot of difficulty if you bring bulky or heavy bags. Pack light, and you'll be much happier, both in this hotel and in general. Overall, this is a great hotel, well worth the expense. You won't regret staying here, and you'll want to stay again on your next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Patrick M
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in room 8 at The Seven Bridges Hotel from June 6th - June 10th. We did not arrive until June 7th due to issues with Ryan Air (AVOID AT ALL COSTS!), but Gunter held our room and welcomed us into the hotel on Saturday morning. As indicated in previous reviews the staircase is almost vertical with very thin steps. Room 8 is exactly as the photo's detail - very large enough for two people and full of antiques. The bath/shower was nice and clean. A great breakfast was delivered each morning to our room - you just let Gunter know what time you would like breakfast and it will be delivered - they are even nice enough to give a courtesy call to the room asking if they could bring up the food in ten minutes. The hotel location is perfect! The hotel itself sits just to the south of Rembrandt Plein (Square) - which is full of restaurants, cafes and a few coffeeshops. Next to the hotel is Barney's Lounge (One of the several Barney's locations around the city). They are open from 10:00am - 01:00am daily. They serve a great cup of coffee and have a very nice cannabis menu - and it's a great place to start and end the day. Many thanks to Andy for all of his great advice. When traveling to Amsterdam I would HIGHLY suggest picking up a "I amsterdam card" from the tourist information building located outside of Amsterdam Central Station. The card is good for 24, 48 or 72 hours and get's you free travel on Amsterdam trams and buses, free parking for your car, and free entry to most Amsterdam museums (Anne Frank House not included) - plus two free canal cruises. I will be making annual pilgrimages from now on and will spend each holiday at Seven Bridges Hotel. Many thanks to you Gunter and your staff for a wonderful stay. See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Amster”
Reviews.Author: Gelot
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, which is staying in a silent place near to the center. The picture from a window - the river. The breakfast in continental style is very pleasant that bring it directly in number. The personnel holds hotel in cleanliness. Inside the room a lot of old-style furniture. I advise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent! A mistake to stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Texannn
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam many times, but for this trip I wanted something really special and happenstance led me to this site and the Seven Bridges! I have never been happier with a European hotel. Everything about it was great, including the location, the hotel and of course, the service. My girlfriend fell in love with the place as soon as she saw it . Together we have stayed in hostels, hotels and campsites throughout Europe, USA and Canada... but she was most impressed with this hotel. It is a warm, welcoming place and we both felt at home from the moment we entered the lobby. The flowers smelled wonderful, the breakfast was beyond expectations and worth every Euro. The room we stayed in (Number 10) was cozy, quiet, romantic and felt more like our own apartment than a hotel. I have stayed at the Peabody in Memphis, the Mariott in nyc and the Queen Elizabeth in Montreal, but the hotel I look most forward to staying at again is The Seven Bridges in Amsterdam. Don't miss it !

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a wonderful Canalside "House"”
Reviews.Author: Thebadgelady
Reviews.Content: If you want to live like a local in a canalside "house" in Amsterdam then this is the place to stay. Wonderful location on Reguliersgracht, close to Rembrandt Plein, walking distance to all Amsterdam attractions. Our room was very big, en-suite bathroom, outside patio, furnished with wonderful antiques. Ample breakfast delivered to the room in the mornings. Manager/Owner was very helpful and friendly. Will stay there again any day!

Reviews.Title: “best b&b ever!”
Reviews.Author: morgalex
Reviews.Content: my wife & i stayed in room #4, adult kids stayed in #8 for 5 nights each...room #4 is ground floor, for those who would rather not climb steep steps...the rooms were as advertised, in beautiful antiques...this was the cleanest, quietest b&b we have ever stayed in, & we've been to a lot...besides the owners being terrific, the location cannot be beat...central to everything in amsterdam, right on the quietest, prettiest canal...when (not if) we go back to amsterdam will definitely stay at the 7 bridges...

Reviews.Title: “LovelyHotel!”
Reviews.Author: QandR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of a review in the Daily Telegraph which gave it high praise, and we weren't disappointed: I phoned the hotel direct and spoke to the charming and helpful Gunter, and although it was at fairly short notice, he was able to offer us a room for a reasonable price. Although this room is the smallest in the hotel and does have a very small bathroom (which both Gunter and the website are very up-front about), it was both charming and comfortable. The bathroom IS small, but is perfectly adequate for a short stay, and has everything one could need and was spotlessly clean. When we arrived (by motorcycle), I was unsure about the parking situation, but Richard kindly (and without my asking) phoned the police to clarify the regulations and it was quickly sorted out. Excellent service indeed! Nicely appointed rooms, Excellent location, superb breakfast, friendly and helpful staff - all the ingredients needed for a top hotel. Highly recomended! Q & R Jaume

Reviews.Title: “My Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: khaos101
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many things going for it that made our stay there unique and special. First was location, the hotel is located on the canals just out of the main tourist area. In 5-10 minutes you can WALK to the tulip markets and many other of the main tourist attractions (even faster if you take the trams), but the hotel is just far enough out of the busy area to have quiet at night. Secondly, the service is amazing. Every morning the small staff, walk up several flights of stairs to deliver breakfast trays to your room. With only eight or so rooms, the service you get is really personalized. The hotel had no problem accommodating my husband's dietary restrictions or our late arrival. The greatest part about Seven Bridges is the unique experience of staying in a very tastefully decorated 300 year old canal house. I stayed in canal facing Room 9 at the top of three flights of very steep stairs. After I caught my breath the view was amazing. Just being able to wake up and sip my tea while watching boats pass on the canal and locals ride by on their bicycles gave me a taste of what it might be like to live in there. Unique experiences like that you just can't find at big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Every hotel should be like this one.”
Reviews.Author: Photo075
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, little hotel - just the kind of place we love to find when we travel. It is intimate, spotless, well-designed and in a great location. We stayed in Room 6 which is decorated in antiques with contemporary touches. It has a lovely view of the Canal and homes across the street. The breakfasts are fantastic. Breads, yogurt, fruit, ham, cheese, coffee. We had enough left over for lunch. We highly recommend this hotel and wish we could similar places in all our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - Fantastic price - Seven Bridges is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: pocketknife
Reviews.Content: Seven Bridges is a charming canal house. It is in an ideal location away from the touristy areas but within a reasonable walking distance of the tourist attractions such as museums, shopping, and parks. The rooms are well appointed and clean. We stayed in room 8 for 7 nights. It was very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was a delight - croissants, coffee or tea, yogurt, fresh fruit, cheese, sliced meat, and fresh oj. The price is very reasonable. It is one block away from an amazing row of restaurants on Utrechstraat - vegetarian, Indonesian, contemporary Dutch, pub food, and Indian are within a 5 minute walk. And of course its close proximity to Rembrandplein makes the tram system very accessible. The proprieters are accomodating, friendly and really want you to enjoy your stay. Be aware that this is a traditional canal house - the stair cases are narrow, the rooms are oddly shaped, and the bathrooms are of a typical European size. Enjoy the charm, the authenticity, the antiques and feel like a Dutch native for a few nights. Dank u wel Pierre and Gunther!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Seven Bridges really is that wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 3xB
Reviews.Content: I just got back last night from 4 nights at the Seven Bridges - and I simply have to add to the choir praising this absolutely charming place! I had found the hotel on Tripadvisor and was frankly a little bit sceptical - the rave reviews sounding almost too good to be true. But from the first moment all the fuss turned out to be fully justified. We arrived late at night and were warmly greeted in the reception. Our room was made cosy for our arrival with the door opened for us and the lights turned on. We couldn't have felt more welcome! We had been lucky to get the last available room, which they almost made excuses for - small, having no view etc. - when we booked. So we expected something rather basic. But it turned out to be a lovely, cosy and very tastefully decorated room with a soothing garden view of trees and blue sky - giving a calming feeling of being in a green oasis in the middle of the city. I have rarely felt this much at home in a hotel. And we had more pleasant surprises in store: The next morning a delicious breakfast was served in our room - warm croissants, freshly pressed orange juice, fruit etc. etc. Everything arranged on beautiful china, with a new style every day. We felt absolutely pampered! Leaving the hotel the next morning to explore the city we realised, that not only is the hotel in itself a small gem - but on top of that the location has to be hands-down the best in Amsterdam. After 4 days of walking all over the city we never found an area exactly this picturesque and romantic, authentic and charming as Reguliersgracht around Herensgract and Keizersgracht! I cannot recommend the Seven Bridges enough! Barbara Bertelsen Copenhagen, Denmark

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: shrinkrap4
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself and our two 20 year old daughters stayed here several nights. What a special place, in the perfect location-on the canal, within walking distance to great restaurants, museums and all the attractions. We stayed in room 5, which was huge and had a large bathroom. My girls stayed in room 7 which overlooked the canal. Breakfast was brought to our room each morning and the the staff was delightful. What a wonderful alternative to larger hotels. It really gave us a local dutch experience that still incorporated the elegance we love. Try it, you won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “5* Budget Hotel for Ambiance Chasers...”
Reviews.Author: Travlin'Prankster
Reviews.Content: Is the Seven Bridges Hotel really better than the Amstel Hotel? Well...considering that a week's stay at the Seven Bridges is about the cost of one (two at the most) night's stay at the Amstel, the answer is an unequivocal yes! The properties of course are not comparable...One is a budget hotel... priced nearly as low as any in the Canal Ring...the other a true 5 Star, but value is a truly important consideration when deciding on lodging. For your $1,200 or so per night at the Amstel, one gets great public spaces...people flocking around serving you...and the opportunity to have a $500,000 Chopard watch delivered to your room. For your $1,200 or so at the Seven Bridges, you get about a week in a cool little Canal House, well located and well decorated with antiques, complimentary modern pieces and oriental rugs. An abundant breakfast is brought to your room on lovely China...all adding to the charming ambiance of the hotel. The peaceful Garden Room 4 was our home for the week of March 27-April 4, 2008 and the only complaint I have is that the table is a bit low. I twice bumped the edge with my long legs, spilling some coffee during the abundant breakfast. Covered with glass, cleanup was easy. That's it...a bit of my clumsiness is the largest finding of fault... This little gem of a place is exactly as advertised...a sparkling clean, calm and beautiful retreat for the independent traveler. Hotel doesn't quite seem the correct word; but it's not a B&B either...It's a labor of love shared by the proprietors for those willing to go through the process to book a room here. The lack of amenities (no elevator, public rooms, bar, etc) are OK considering that Barney's Lounge (Mint tea, milkshakes...and.) is a stumble outside the front door...and the ample dining options (Tempo Doeloe, Mujah Taret, Alfonso's and more) on Utrechtstraat are also just a short stroll...as is Rembrandtplein and its tremendous selection of eateries and little food shops. Their website perfectly captures the essence of the hotel...and needs to be examined in detail before deciding to stay here. The interior stairs are steep, no doubt about it, but Garden 4 is on the entry level...removing that concern. Garden 5, up one flight, is easily one of the nicest rooms you'll find anywhere...and the room's private terrace is a great place to take breakfast during pleasant weather. The Seven Bridges Hotel is a quiet and tremendously refined slightly upscale budget hotel with limited services. It is not an acceptable lodging for those that need to be watched over or have their every question answered, although they will assist their guests however possible. We loved it...and recommend it highly to those that find it appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seven Bridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nalybe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel and loved it. We stayed in room in room 10 which is on the top floor and found it cozy and charming and loved all of the sunlight from the skylights. Breakfast was terrific and abundant-- we were very impressed with the effort of the owners in carrying it up all of the steps to our room. The location is fantastic-- situated on a beautiful canal and in easy walking distance to everything. Overall, an intimate beautiful hotel with owners who clearly care a lot about what they do.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: JLorettaB
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I spent 3 nights at this gorgeous hotel. We stayed in antique-filled room 5, which is quite beautiful and even has it's own little terrace. The hosts were really charming too. The position is great. In fact, so pretty that it was being used for a film location during our stay. We'll definitely be making a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Amsterdam with 21st Century Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Journeywoman_8
Reviews.Content: Centrally located on the most beautiful canal, The Seven Bridges Hotel is an extraordinary journey back in time with excellent accomodations - large room, good size bath, comfortable bed, elegant antiques, garden patio with historic views. Gunter, the manager, was cheerful, gracious and helpful. He brought fresh croissants and coffee each morning. We highly recommend The Seven Bridges but also want to keep it a secret for ourselves! The Riches- Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tngypsy
Reviews.Content: I read about this unique hotel on TripAdvisor and wanted to confirm the high reviews as well as strongly recommend this accomodation to Amsterdam travelers. My husband and I stayed 6 nights at the 7 Bridges and felt very at home. It is spotlessly clean, comfortable, and an authentic Dutch canal house. The food was delicious and the hosts were helpful and made us feel at home in Amsterdam. In addition to the wonderful hotel, the location is wonderful...close to everything, but quiet and picturesque. Every restaurant we tried in the are was excellent, expecially l'Express around the corner. My husband and I highly recommend this hotel and we look forward to returning. The only caution is one must be able to navigate the steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Secret Treat in busy city!”
Reviews.Author: surreysarahjk
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful peaceful stay in a glorious and unique hotel. The staff were charming and helped us find Jamies restaurant! Breakfast was such a treat. We were both in need of R and R and this perfect little hotel with the most sumptous antiques provided the most wonderul base for a romantic long weekend. Great recomendations for restuarants in the area too. Thank you very much

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: missy8
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 days in this beautiful hotel . Great location ... in the centre, but alongside a quiet canal . It is a very relaxing place - no pressure - like being at home ...... but with nothing else to do but have fun !! The owner is very friendly and welcoming . No critisisms at all ..... simply wonderful !! Claire and Deb

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel...would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scaredtojeff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the 7 Bridges for our honeymoon. The hotel was kind of expensive, but I blame the Bush administration for making the dollar worthless and not the 7 Bridges Hotel. It was well worth the money. We stayed in room 8. We had an awesome view of the private garden and were able to leave the window wide open and still have privacy. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The morning breaksfast that was provided was plentiful and a daily treat. The hotel is located right next to Barney's, a great coffeshop. I would recommend the Hotel 7 Bridges and can't wait to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: vermeer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 7 for two nights but wished we were staying longer! The room was beautiful and spotlessly clean, a sumptuous breakfast was brought to us both mornings which we ate overlooking the canal. We will definitely make a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zwetsie
Reviews.Content: Brilliant place to stay. When arriving you feel like at home. Very much focussed on quality and personal touch. Professional balance between quality and price. Stayed in room 6 which is by night and morning fantastic. Quality of bed and breakfast more than good. For business reasons I need to travel a lot. Many of the places I do stay can learn something here which is attention. This stay was a personal one. Again I already had a great evening with relatives but the experience of staying overnight by both gentlemen responsable for Â¨runningÂ¨ this hotel was perfect. I soon return with my partner. Frans Zwetsloot, France, born in NL.

Reviews.Title: “A Step Back in Time... A Romantic Adventure....”
Reviews.Author: fushia288
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back to Canada and I wanted to get this review written... Seven Bridges is for those who want to experience Amsterdam in an authentic artistic way. There is a lily above the sign outside and there was a scent of lillies as we walked into the hallway. Oscar Wilde and the art deco movement immediately came to my mind... Seven Bridges is a canal house similar to the type Rembrant lived in - a definite visit if you have the time. This is a great opportunity to experience something very unique. The furnishings have been selected with love and care. It is very clean and comfortable. The beautiful breakfast is supplied on exquisite china with plenty extra if you want to pack a little for later (these are heavy trays, but nothing is compromised for the sake of beauty) The hotel is tasteful, conveniently located to the Rembrant Square, where there are buses and cafes, clean and very elegant. We would definitely recommend it. We took the Garden Room number 4 as we had fairly heavy cases and it wasn't far to go up the stairs. A small passage is part of the room and makes it very convenient to put the luggage there with a glass door that closes into the suite. Our hosts were very kind and caring... we were very grateful to see some other rooms. Each contains a uniqueness and elegance of its own. I would suggest if you are chosing a room going up the stairs to bring light compact luggage as the stairs are winding and narrow. This is a characteristic of all canal houses, but good to keep in mind. We would love to come back, and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Seven Bridges... I would definitely spend more time getting to know local people. Everyone we met were so friendly and kind. I felt a bit strange as we didn't speak any Dutch, but English is used everywhere and nobody makes you feel bad for not speaking their language. It was a truly unique and authentic experience. Fiona and Rami David

Reviews.Title: “So peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Mowser
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 7 in September and had a wonderful stay. We especially enjoyed watching the goings-on outside by the canal while having the amazing breakfast and delicious coffee in the morning; or relaxing in the chairs, with the sun pouring in the open windows in the late afternoon, after a day spent walking all over Amsterdam. It was peaceful, lovely, and we will not stay anywhere else when we go back to Amsterdam. Gunter, Erik, and Pierre were great; they had very helpful suggestions about everything we asked about, including what platform to catch our train to Bruges on when we finished our stay with them. We canâ€™t say enough good things about our experience. It was the best place we stayed during our 24 day, 4 country trip to Europe. Pack lightly would be my advice if youâ€™re worried about the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: IroningandSewing
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Gunter, whose hotel provided an appreciative couple with the perfect venue in which to relax for a long (but still too short) weekend. We stayed in Room C, on the first floor of the town house next door but one to the hotel. It felt like our own private hideaway, with a handsome lounge area separated from the comfortable bedroom by a wood and glass panelled partition. The beautiful furniture and lighting really made a difference to the atmosphere, and you get a sense that real thought and passion has gone in to this hotel; it's a world away from the bland anonymity of most hotel accommodation. The room was excellent, and really made our weekend; we looked forward to heading back there after a long day walking the streets of the city, knowing that we had a great place to relax in before heading out for a meal in one of the good restaurants along Utrechtsestraat. Highly recommended, especially if you want privacy and the space to unwind with a glass of wine after a day exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overated”
Reviews.Author: martinCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room B a spacious room with a Kitchen cupboard Separate grubby entrance. The sheets were not ironed, the paint was peeling and the walls cracked. The crockery had not been washed and the milk had been left in a jug leaving a conjealed rim. The photos are highly flattering don't be fooled. Very friendly staff Highly overated hotel

Reviews.Title: “The perfect respite in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: JenSaysThis
Reviews.Content: I LOVED staying at Seven Bridges Hotel. I don't even know where to start with this review, so I think I'll do bullet points: * The host, Gunther Glaner. Staying at Seven Bridges is like staying at a family friend's home. Except in this case, the family friend is an nurturing antiques collector with a penchant for Art Deco, and the home is a beautiful brownstone situated on a canal. Gunther must have the patience of spider, because prior to my trip, I kept changing my arrival plans. Gunther was accomodating through it all. * The location: Seven Bridges Hotel is named such because at the corner street, when the bridges are lit up at night, you can see straight across the canal and count seven bridges. This area is perfect for strolling around at night - peeking into parlors and walking in moonlight. In fact, we had come here from Paris, and we found this area to be far more romantic that Paris! Upon arrival, I HIGHLY recommend renting bicycles. Amsterdam is bike-friendly, and it is the best way to get around. Once you get a bike, most attractions are minutes away from the hotel. * Breakfast: after a friendly wake-up call, Gunther or Erik will come up to your room to deliver breakfast. Breakfast consists of yogurt, fruit, croissants, bread, cheese, charcuterie, and coffee - set on bone china dishware. A very civilized way to nurse a hangover. * The Antiques: you know, I have to admit that I was reticent to write such a glowing review of Seven Bridges, simply because they *are* reasonable priced, and Amsterdam *does* end attract a certain tourist set on partying heavily. I actually worry for Gunther that he will one day have a guest sully his rug! When we first arrived, Gunther thought it necessary to apologize for the "temporary" curtains ("they are usually blue, but they are at the cleaners..."), which is a testament to how important aesthetics are to him. Each room is has at least one historically significant piece. Ours had a fantastic marble Art Deco table, among other important pieces. Yes, there are plenty of places to stay in Amsterdam, but few will be this civilized and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: 11SERENDIPITY
Reviews.Content: 27th January 2008 We booked the Seven Bridges Hotel as we wanted something special for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We were certainly not disappointed. The welcome was warm and friendly and our room gorgeous. We stayed in Canal Room C, which surpassed all our expectations, the furnishings were lovely , the lighting warm and cosy and the canal view stunning. The hotel is ideally situated for all the sights, yet in a quiet beautiful street. Thanks also to Gunter for making our weekend so special and memorable. I would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: fudge7000
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel for the price, doubt you can find better in Amsterdam! We stayed in room B for 2 nights, very helpful staff, fab room, only problem would be if you had any mobility problems, i've never seen such narrow stairs! (didn't cause us any problems though!) Amazing city, hotel in good location and hotel is the best around!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ballinora4
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel having read the "rave" reviews on Tripadvisor. I think I must have been just very unluckly with the particular room I was assigned - a room at basement level. Maybe the other rooms are much nicer but my experience was quite disappointing. The basement room is reached via a narrow and fairly shabby staircase, with a smell of damp. the bedroom itself was warm and reasonably spacious but not very comfortable, and with an eclectic mix of old (as opposed to antique) furniture. The bathroom was really very small (although to be fair I had been told this in advance) with paint peeling. The shower area was so off-putting that I couldn't bring myself to even use it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Hinchore
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel, beautiful rooms, in a charming street, helpful and friendly staff, great breakfast and at a very reasonable price. It is cosy (although the rooms are not small) and homely, and so is not for you if you want somewhere flashy, and breakfast is served in the bedroom as there are no public rooms, but for me this made it an even more relaxing and comfortable experience. I would recommend to friends or family who are travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: beatrice75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect. My husband and I spent six nights in Room B of the Seven Bridges and had a wonderful time. Aesthetically, the hotel is amazing, with Turkish rugs in the entry way, colorful tiling in the bathroom, and leather chairs and adorned mirrors in the main bedroom. Our room was spacious, extremely well-maintained, and spotless, and had everything we needed, including a kitchenette. I was under the weather for a portion of the trip and this was a great home away from home. The hotel is also centrally located and the staff are incredibly kind and helpful. I highly recommend the Seven Bridges!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WoofWales
Reviews.Content: This really is a lovely hotel! It is very pretty and in an excellent location. Far enough away from the red light district etc, that you are not overwhelmed by it, but close enough to everything such as Leidsplein which is literally around the corner. The Van Gough museum and Rijksmuseum are both within a short walking distance (roughly 10 mins). Good regular tram connections into heart of Amsterdam costing 1.25 Euros. The staff where really nice and the breakfast excellent. We were given a choice of breakfast at 8am or 9am (a cheerfully phone call ten minutes before arrival of breakfast every morning, was always appreciated). Situated on a very nice street, when you walk out of the hotel the view is just stunning. (very easy to find) You will not be disappointed, worth every pound. (Tip: try paying cash as we were charged extra for using card, although this probably varies with different banks)

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: bemho69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there last week and really had a fine stay. Very cozy room with nice antique furniture. Excellent quiet location with ample restaurants within walking distance. About a fifteen minute stroll from the Central Station. Very nice breakfast daily and warm hosts. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MediumNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Small original hotel with style mix rooms and a touch of "art deco". Very private atmosphere, room services breakfast. We had an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: merban
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend getaway at the Seven Bridges room #6 with a canal view. It was fantastic! The hotel and the room itself were charming. Each day we'd wander through Amsterdam's streets and return to our cozy little place filled with lovely furnishings, an extremely comfortable bed, and an exquisite view of the canal. Breakfast was a treat, sipping coffee out of fine china looking out at the canal ... a sublime way to start the day. The location is great - everything was in walking distance, there was a spectacular coffee shop and bar right next door - who could ask for more! If and when I return to Amsterdam i will definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gab061178
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Seven Bridges hotel, in November 2007. We had the room 7. It is one of the room looking at the canal. The room has 3 windows, that enable to enjoy daylight and the wonderful and quiet view. The room has luxuous classical furniture giving a cosy and comfortable atmosphere. The owners of the hotel are very pleasant. Despite our late arrival, they were waiting for us. As the hotel has no dining room, the full continental breakfasts are served inside the room. This hotel was part of a great WE in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ParkyCheshire
Reviews.Content: Put quite simply, we will not visit Amsterdam unless we can stay at the Seven Bridges! Having visited the city 9 times, we know it very well and having been unfortunate not to discover the Seven Bridges until our 3rd visit, could not believe how beautifully furnished and situated the hotel is compared to previous experiences. We have always stayed in Room A, a basement apartment which we have totally fallen in love with! The apartment is small and cosy but plenty large enough to provide a home from home and a great place to relax after many hours walking the streets of Amsterdam! Situated on a beautiful and very quite canal (no trams to wake you up at the crack of dawn!) and yet a stones throw from great shopping, restaurants and attractions, the apartment is surprisingly light and airy. It is beautifully furnished with fantastic original Dutch furniture, a really comfortable bed (with lovely soft, clean bedding) and a small but modern and spotless bathroom, also beautifully decorated. The apartment provides all the mod cons you could need and is always spotlessly clean. The hand made wooden mirrors make it feel even more spacious and are a great feature. The welcome is always very warm and best of all, the independence offered by an apartment with its own entrance makes us feel as though we live in the city and blend in with the real Amsterdammers rather than feeling like tourists! We can't recommend it highly enough - we're going back for a week over Christmas and would not do so unless we could spend this special time somewhere equally special!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizandjohnSydney
Reviews.Content: we have justed stayed for 9 nights at the Seven Bridges and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. It is in a great location on a very pretty canal. The room was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts are a real highlight. The staff were very helpful and friendly. This hotel is also non smoking, a very rare thing in Amsterdam and a further attraction. Would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBarb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just finished our stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel, and we found it absolutely wonderful. We stayed in Room 5, which was very, very, very, nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was great to have breakfast brought to our room every day...and it was a lot of food. We were usually not hungry for lunch. It was such a charming, homey and wonderful place to stay. The room was beautifully furnished, and spacious. It was nice to stay in a more home like setting instead of a more 'traditional' hotel room. The location of the hotel is great. It was within walking distance to most everything you would want to see. Very close to restaurants and shops. On my next trip to Amsterdam, I will definitely be staying here. And I highly recommend it to anyone travelling there!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great hosts”
Reviews.Author: Beerje
Reviews.Content: For my first visit to Amsterdam, I read the overwhelmingly positive reviews and chose the Seven Bridges. I'm very happy I did. The hotel is in a postcard-perfect location in the Canal Belt, but it's not too sleepy: a short walk brings you to shopping on Utrechtsestraat (including two very good CD stores, Concerto and Get) and nightlife on Rembrandtplein. I stayed in room A for five nights. This room is in the basement, and the proprietors do not serve breakfast in it. However, the room has several advantages. For one, it is an excellent bargain. For another, it is cheerful and quite spacious, with ample sunlight, windows facing the canal, and its own entrance onto the street. The room features a kitchenette with a small refrigerator with utensils and coffee and tea. You can pick up your own breakfast at the standout bakery on Utrechtsestraat to eat in your room. If you have any doubts about whether this room is appropriate for you, you can see several photos of it on the hotel's Web site. The proprietors were friendly and graciously accommodated a special request. They also allowed me a peak into one of the more opulent upstairs rooms, and it was amazing. I'd definitely return, either to room A or (for a splurge) one of the upstairs ones!

Reviews.Title: “The best pick in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: w8mui
Reviews.Content: A perfect little canal house in a quiet neighborhood. Walking distance to the Rijks, Van Gogh, and Rembrandthuis museums. The breakfast was enough to feed an army and it was brought to our room every morning. The staff was warm and friendly, and very helpful with answers over email. They made reservation for us at a nearby Italian restaurant since we were arriving late from Cairo and needed familiar food for one night! We picked room 6 with a picture window view of the canal. (You can check out all their rooms on their website) We passed by alot of the hotels we checked out online and none can compare, especially location wise. All and all, it was a perfect stay! Getting a GVB pass at the airport is a must. Amsterdam is a small city and it's great to be able to hop on and off the tram, just a short ride to anywhere in the city. The I amsterdam Card is great if you plan on combing every little museum in town, otherwise, I would book online especially Anne Frank House. The advantage is while there's a line around the block, you get to enter through a side door, no wait. And if you want to see "The Girl with the Pearl Earring", there's fast train everyday to the Haag. Amsterdam is a fun city. Stay at this hotel and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A warm, friendly and charming experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldWashington
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Canal Room 7 for a full week. This is definitely an excellent Bed and Breakfast experience. The hotel is in a superb location allowing you to walk to most major attractions. It is also a block from a major tram stop. So getting around is really easy. The breakfast was excellent and included a very ample serving of cheese, ham, juice, buns of every variety and coffee or tea. Gunter is an excellent host and did everything to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. One word of caution. When you book, be sure you know where your room is located.
