As with most canal houses the stairway is really difficult. It is a spiral-like stair case and can be very tough with large or heavy luggage. Overall, if you like warmth and atmosphere, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: communicate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6- night stay at the Seven Bridges. It was our first visit to Amsterdam, and we decided on the Seven Bridges based on all the Trip Advisor reviews. All I can say is â€¦ the reviews could not have been more correct. We decided to stay in Room 6 based on the pictures posted on their web site. For two people, we had plenty of room, and a nice size bathroom with shower. We also wanted a canal view, and this room overlooked one of the prettiest (so we were told on our canal boat tour) in all of Amsterdam. I strongly suggest checking out the web site, as it gives very good detailed information, and I like that you can actually see pictures of the rooms. Keep in mind (as the web site states), the photos are taken with a wide-angle lens, but they are still a very good size. We actually got to see Room 5, and even though it did not have a canal view, it was a little larger and had a little patio where you could sit out (weather permitting) and have breakfast. It was lovely, and next time, we may have to try Room 5. If you are looking to stay in a beautiful, spotless clean, friendly-staffed canal house, then this is the place for you. Our room rate included breakfast, which was served in our room each morning. Fresh squeezed orange juice, coffee, yogurt, fruit, croissants and delicious breads and jam made for a great start to the day, and there was plenty to carry you over to lunch if need be. Each morning we would open up the curtains, sit by the windows and watch the morning unfold Amsterdam style. Gunter, Pierre and Erik were very discreet, and the perfect hosts. If you needed something or had a question, they were there. Otherwise, you were left alone to enjoy and come and go as you please. As for location, you could not ask for better. We used the tram only a few times, as walking is so easy and so much more fun. Pack a pair of good walking shoes, get lost on purpose, and just explore. Iâ€™d like to thank Gunter, Pierre and Erik for a memorable stay. And â€¦ I special thank you to our friends (you know who you are), for our wonderful dinners, day trips and 13-mile bike ride!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Timoka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seven Bridges on short trip to Amsterdam and absolutely loved the experience. The first night we were in Garden Room 5, which was large, convenient and absolutely spectacular. For the second night we moved to the much smaller but still adequate Garden Room 3. We would have preferred to have stayed both nights in #5 (even at the higher rate), but I made the reservation close to our arrival date and it was only available for the first night. While the rooms are nice, it's really the service and location that set this hotel apart from the rest. The breakfast brought to our room each morning was splendid. I still dream about the warm, freshly baked croissants. The management was very friendly, offering expert advice on what to see, where to eat, etc. We walked everywhere, enjoying the exercise, fresh air and sights. It was a great visit and I highly recommend the Seven Bridges to anyone looking for a comfortable, non-chain hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fepaes
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple from Brasil, stayed for 6 days in september, 2.007. We stayed at room B. The room has a very good size, good shower, little kitchen inside. People in the hotel are really kind and the hotel has a good location, near from Reblanplein, and within walking distance from everything nice to know in the city. We really enjoyed staying there!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: bsatw7130
Reviews.Content: This is FANTASTIC B&B in a beautiful neighborhood in Amsterdam, away from all the craziness of Dam square. Although all the city sites are easily accessible by foot or bike. The rooms are well cleaned and cared for by an excellent staff who is not over/under bearing. They will help if you need them and we'll give you privacy the rest of the time. The breakfast was very impressive, the croissants were some of the best in the city. We would highly recommend this hotel to anybody that wants feel at home in a real Amsterdam neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Unique”
Reviews.Author: balibatik
Reviews.Content: Highly reccomended!! The hotel is small but charming and clean. The rooms are decorated with beauiful antiques , each room designed with a very unique european style. We had booked 3 rooms and very happy with all of them. The service is freindly and prompt.. The location is great ! We will definetly return!! Collette S.L.C Utah Aug-2007

Reviews.Title: “Our Fairytale Home in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: lrg7504
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seven Bridges for a couple nights in Amsterdam a few weeks ago. I would recommend taking the tram. we decided to walk from the train station which was not a good idea. it looked a lot closer on the map. anyway, we were in room 1B. they do not serve breakfast in this room, but the first night we slept very late and the next morning we had to be up and out very early to go home, so no breakfast was really needed. the hotel is on the corner of an area where there are connecting canals and there are a number of bridges going over them. the area is really one of the nicest in Amsterdam that we saw and is completely charming. all of the houses have their own character--different heights, colors, windows. you really feel like you are in a fairytale book. we had our own door, entrance and key...so it was much like having your own apartment in Amsterdam and you could come and go as you please. the location is amazing being about halfway between the red light district and the museum district. it's also a stone's throw away from rembrantsplein where there are a lot of fun bars and restaurants to relax and watch the people go by. the room was comfortable. and for the price you really cannot beat it. the only problem we had was we had arranged for a shuttle van to come and pick us up in the morning for the airport and they didn't show. the hotel that we had to wait in front of in the square called and had one come and get us. it ended up being fine, but we were happy we left a lot of time so there wasn't any problem.

Reviews.Title: “perfect service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NyCol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, excellent location, staff is charming and always willing to help, very kind people. the rooms are beautiful, clean, breakfast was delicious. we had a wonderful stay. we'll recommand this place to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect elegant retreat”
Reviews.Author: sunred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges for the first time in March 2007, having read all the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor. All the good things you read are true! We had room 8 on the top floor, but also had the chance to see some of the other rooms and they all look beautiful. We were originally booked into room 4 with the garden view, but on arrival were asked if we would mind changing as the air conditioning was being installed. (note that this is complete now, for those who complained last summer!). We were happy to change as the new room was lovely, and although we were offered the opportunity to move back to our original booking during our stay, we felt so cosy in our upper room that we elected just to stay there! Our early arrival and check in due to our flight was accomodated without any problems. Similarly on departure, we requested an earlier breakfast, and again this was not a problem. As to the breakfast, well other reviewers have said all there is to say on the huge platters and the tasteful china. Suffice to say that you may not need lunch! As it was March, it was quite cold outside, and it was bliss to return to our cosy room which was always wonderfully warm. In fact, just coming back to the "hotel" and walking up the steep steps, it is easy to imagine that this is your home. The hosts are so charming and welcoming, it feels as though you are staying with good friends for a couple of nights, and certainly nothing like being in a hotel. The stairs inside the hotel are very steep, but this is all part of the charm, and we thought it was fun! The location has been well reviewed - we can only repeat that it is an ideal location, easy to get everywhere once you get your bearings, lots of good restaurants nearby and handy for the tram if you don't want to walk any more. The views of the canals are fabulous, and it is easy to sense the history behind the city. As we have been to Amsterdam before, we did not plan to visit any of the usual tourist venues, but the Seven Bridges is ideal for just wandering the banks of the canals and taking in the sights and lifestyle. We have nothing but praise for the hotel, the biggest problem will probably be making a repeat booking, as it is so rare to find such a charming place whose owners really care about their guests! Thank you to our gracious hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Midoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights this summer - and then returned for one night to be in Amsterdam for our return trip home. It was a wonderful experience. We had a room that directly overlooked the canal - and was a beautiful and varied "view." The room itself was a delight - warm, tastefully decorated, immaculately clean, good size, and upbeat feeling. Also, the owners and their staff were always helpful... and gave us free access to the internet via a laptap they let us use in our room. There's a very warm, welcoming feeling to this hotel... and I heartily recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the Amsterdam crown”
Reviews.Author: troublenstrife
Reviews.Content: You will find this lovely hotel a peaceful retreat only 2 minutes walk from the busy Rembrandtplein. As previous reviews state the rooms & hosts are welcoming & the breakfast (served at 8am as requested) superb with warm croissants, cheese,fruit, yoghurt, choices of breads with jam & butter (we requested no meats which was noted) and a choice of tea or coffee. We had coffee & again to repeat previous reviews it was the best we had ever tasted - all served on a clean matching china set. It does feel like you are a welcome guest in a very nice canalside private house. We stayed in attic room 9 (150 euros per night) right at the top of some very winding steep stairs- choose a lower room if you have a heavy case! The room was better than expected as had a T.V & a newly installed fridge cleverly disguised as a marquetry bedside cabinet - sweet touch. Everything was clean & in order as shown in the pictures on their website. Mosquitoes were mentioned in another review so did take repellant although we only saw one in the room. The hotel provided a very useful map with the hotel & a few sites ringed - we walked to most areas in our three 3 night stay. We caught a taxi from the train station (11 euros) but took the tram (no 4 from Utrechtsestraat) to return @ 3.20 euros for both for the return journey. Highly recommend & would stay again on returning to Amsterdam - may be to room 5 as passed the room on the way down stairs & looked in as the door was open - as well as the opulent furniture,mirrors & rugs they had a large flat screen t.v & small courtyard garden- great stuff! Hope you enjoy your stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigerpixie
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at this hotel, the owners were very friendly and helpful and we had a good laugh with them. We stayed in Room number 8 and we loved the decor; it was really cosy and quiet. Massive breakfast was served in our room and we' ll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A very beautiful gem”
Reviews.Author: ClassicBee
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Amsterdam literally at the last minute, but still wanted to stay somewhere special. After looking online I saw this hotel and from the minute I saw the photos I knew I had to stay here and nowhere else would do. The owners truly went out of their way to help me secure the last room they had available, but oh, I could not believe how lovely the garden room was and I cannot begin to describe my joy when I was told it was reserved for me. A really big thank you to the most sweetest of hoteliers I have ever come across. Staying at this accomodation in particular was important to me, as I wanted to see specific museums and this hotel was in the middle of each one I wanted (and got) to see during my 24 hours in Amsterdam. The location was very peaceful, pretty, clean, very safe, away from all the hustle and bustle, but close enough to get to some eateries when you have no energy left to wander far. Even on the canal circular, the guides said the location of the hotel - 7 Bridges - was one of the best in Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here again and am now going to recommend this hotel to everybody I know, it is a real beautiful gem, spotlessly clean, and everywhere I looked within the en suite room, one by one everything caught my eye, from the furnishings to the look and glorious smell of fresh lilies. Compared to other hotels prices during high season and at extremely short notice for a single room, this hotel beats the lot, in every way. If you are feeling low or stressed believe me this hotel will change all that in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Charmer”
Reviews.Author: Shya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a beautiful canal in a quiet neighborhood which has excellent restaurants and shops. We stayed in the Garden Room which is small but warmly decorated and comfortable. True to it's name the view is lush and green. It has a good bed -- we slept well. The breakfast includes especially good coffee and croissants. The proprietors could not have been kinder or more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Will never forget”
Reviews.Author: X0ma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I lived in 7Bridges in March, 2007. We stayed here for 4 nights. Itâ€™s very nice & romantic small hotel (thanks to tripadvisor.com for making a right choice and Gunter for nice days spent in the hotel). We were first Russians visited 7Bridges. Russian tour companies do not book such small hotels so we made all reservations by our own. It was not difficult and we did not have any problems with visas. Gunter was so kind to send us an e-mail confirmation of the reservation and Holland embassy in Moscow was fully satisfied with the printed copy of the e-mail. The only problem is to book the room in 7Bridges. We were very lucky to find an unreserved room only two weeks in advance. So we advise to Russians not to be afraid to make reservations by yourself and to stay where you want rather than where your tour company imposes you to stay. Weâ€™ve got room A with individual entrance from the canal. We found it very romantic to have our own key imagining that we are true Dutchmen. The minus is that this room is not served with breakfast but it has a small kitchen with tea/coffee facilities and a small refrigerator. You can visit small stores for natives near to the hotel or visit numerous AH stores. Also I would like to note that a smart coffeeshop is located 25m from the hotel. It was rather small and we didnâ€™t have any problems with noise or didnâ€™t see any junkies on the street. But it was very comfortable to return home after having some smoke. The hotel is situated very close to the center a few minutes walk to Rembrandt square. At the same time it is a quiet place. Thanks to 7Bridges we will never forget our first visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: cgclearman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I totally enjoyed our stay at the Seven Bridges during the second week in June. On our previous trip to Amsterdam, we stayed in a large hotel on Dam Square, and wanted a different experience this time. Gunter and Pierre were excellent hosts; very kind and helpful. Our room (number 4) was very comfortable and quiet with a perfect view of the leafy courtyard. The breakfasts were simple and delicious (and huge!). The location was perfect for exploring Amsterdam. We will definitely stay at this lovely canal house on our next visit to Holland.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel - a rare gem”
Reviews.Author: Frostillicus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges Hotel for 5 nights in May. We loved it. My husband and I were in Room 5 which has a patio with pots of beautiful flowering plants. It was one of the most enjoyable stays Iâ€™ve ever experienced in all of Europe. The hotel is on a quiet canal street where you can sit on a bench and watch the world go by. The room was very clean and beautifully decorated. Linens, including the bed covers were changed during our stay. Twice a large vase with 3 dozen tulips were placed on the mantel which made us feel really welcomed here. The bathroom was very clean and the bathmat was changed each day (I notice little things like this and appreciate them) Each morning we dined on the bountiful breakfast which consisted of hot croissants, a variety of breads, cheese, turkey slices, bananas, apples, yogurt, coffee, tea, orange juice. We had more than enough to make small sandwiches which we took with us while exploring the city. We sat and ate them in a square or park. One day we strolled into Vondel park, put down the blanket I had in my backpack and enjoyed an impromptu picnic. We rarely saw anyone around the hotel; it was very calming. Gunter, Alex and Eric really know how to treat guests. Other innkeepers could take lessons from them. We would stay here again in a minute and probably will within the year. We love the Seven Bridges Hotel. â™¥ â™¥ â™¥ â™¥ â™¥ â˜º â˜º â˜º â˜º We also got the IAmsterdam card which was well worth it since we visited many museums and the card included tram/bus transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Bridges worked out great for us!”
Reviews.Author: Sense2know
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges for a week. We had one of the modest, street-level studios rather than one of the highly decorated upstairs rooms because that was what was available. This meant we had no breakfast provided by the hotel. At first, I was disappointed by the room itself and the lack of a convenient breakfast, but I soon got used to the lack of carpeting and began to realize how nice it was to have the kitchenette. We quickly found a nearby grocery and stocked up, then made our own breakfast each morning. Since we were lodging â€œoutsideâ€� the main hotel, we never saw the management except when we arrived and when we left. Both of them seemed quite amiable and helpful, offering us a very useful town map as well as advice, etc., so I wish we had seen more of them. We never saw the maid service, either, but they came every day and did a good job of keeping things clean. The location was nearly perfect for our needs, since Seven Bridges is located midway between the train station and the museum district. We took a cab there when we arrived, which cost a lot, but by the time we left a week later, we knew which tram to use, and it was about a Euro to get back to the train station. If you wear good walking shoes, you can walk to almost every location in the City that is of tourist interest, which is what we did. I think our area was one of the most charming around. In fact, the canal boat tours all paused at the end of our street, to allow passengers to photograph "our" canal and its line of bridges. We felt lucky to be staying where we were. At night, when the bridge arches are lit up, it is just magical. On the same street as the Seven Bridges is a wonderful Italian restaurant. Just a minute's walk down the street takes you to the Rubensplein, a large social square lined with places to eat and drink. Multiple tram lines stop there every few minutes. Once you get familiar with the city's tram system, everything is within reach. Given that many hotels in Amsterdam are in the $250 to $350 range per night, we consider our studio at the Seven Bridges to have been acceptable. However, I would say that, if you are used to highly refined accommodations, you might want to pass on the lower-level room we had. It had a college-student air to it. The nicer rooms upstairs undoubtedly are more pleasant, although they cost significantly more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BramptonBri
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here may 9-13, 2007. When I originally tried to book a room, they were sold out, but put me on a waiting list which opened up after approx 5 days. we stayed in room #4 on ground floor which consisted of a double bed, small sitting area with table and 2 chairs, spotless bathroom and lovely view into the garden/courtyard. Gunter and Erik were extremeley helpful in booking restaurant reserverations, sightseeing etc. We ate at Jamie Oliver's 15 which was fantastic. It is located a little out of the way on the river in a new area of amsterdam. Great service, super atmosphere and exceptional food!!! The location of the hotel was fairly central. We thought about getting the Iamsterdam card or a 3 day tram pass, but decided against it after the first day. We ended up walking most of the time and purchased a stripenkart to get us home when we didn't feel like walking. Breakfast was included and was amazing! served to our room at a time previously arranged with Gunter. Plentiful, fresh and very tasty. I would highly recommend this property. It is a boutique hotel and each room has character and appeal. Would stay here again without hesitation. Many thanks to Gunter and Erik for an excellent vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Touch of Class”
Reviews.Author: Dial999
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with this hotel. The owners kindly let us check in very early as we had been flying all night and the room was vacant. The staff were friendly, breakfast was lovely, the rooms are delightful, the position is excellent, the price is very reasonable, what more could you want. Just be aware that the higher floors might be difficult for elderly and infirm.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: letudo
Reviews.Content: First, some context: my husband and I travel quite a bit both domestically and abroad, and stay in mid-range (Hilton and Marriott) to top of the line (Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons) hotels, as well as high-end country inns and B&Bâ€™s. Now for the review. We just loved the Seven Bridges! We loved the accommodation, the location, and the hosts. 1) Accommodation: We stayed in the Garden Suite. We have stayed in many interesting places but this was quite unique. The antiques used to decorate the room were of very high-quality and the room proportions were impressive as well. The high ceilings, fireplace, huge windows, fabulous fabrics, furnishings, and artwork were a real delight. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept like logs. The bathroom was spotless, spacious, bright, and modern. A glass door in the bathroom opened onto a lovely terrace with potted camellias and other plants. We are both appreciative of good design and employ an interior designer for our own home, so we are fairly picky when it comes to these types of things. 2) Location: The location is, in our opinion, perfect. The upscale neighborhood is beautiful and quiet. Yet, it is one block from the tram that provides a very quick trip to the city center station, one block to lovely neighborhood stores and restaurants, and it is, of course, in the heart of canal country. 3) Hosts: The owners of the hotel are two lovely men. We had the most contact with Gunter as he usually delivered our delicious breakfast. We just adored him. He was the kindest and most gracious host. He always seemed so cheerful and ready to offer advice. One thing that really impressed us was that, during our stay, someone from my office contacted the hotel, asking me to call. It turned out to be very sad news (someone I work with had passed away). It was evening and, sensing that something was wrong, Gunter rang our room and offered to bring up tea and cookies. When he arrived, he asked if everything was OK. It was obvious that he brought the refreshments to cheer us up which was just so sweet. In summary, for many reasons, we just loved everything about this hotel. It is the perfect place to stay while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DeanForesters
Reviews.Content: What a lovely to place to stay. It was so easy to book by phone having looked up the details on the internet and when we arrived we were made very welcome. Our room (the garden room, no.5) was beautifully furnished and had the bonus of a patio to sit ouside (although going through the bathroom to reach it seemed a little unusual to start with). Breakfast in the room was much nicer than going into a depersonalised dining room and was excellent, with croissants, a variety of bread (tasting deliciously homemade), cheese, meat, yoghurts and fruit. It was enough to keep us going with sandwiches for lunch too! The hotel is not like a traditional hotel chain, being more like someone's home. But the service,friendliness and quality of our room and breakfast couldn't have been better. The location is great too, as it is central to any of the museums and other attractions. We made the mistake of getting a taxi from the Central Station to the hotel - very expensive (20 euros) for a short distance. It's easily walkable, which we did going back, wheeling our suitcases. The hotel is also in one of the most attractive and peaceful areas of Amsterdam, If we ever come stay in the city again, we will DEFINITELY come and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo057
Reviews.Content: We stayed, my wife and me at the Seven Bridges Hotel in April this year, for 6 nights. What a beautiful room! Canal view room B is large,clean,beautiful and confortable . Gunter is a gentleman who is really interested about your guest needs.The hotel is very good, and we would definitely recommend it to anyone seeking a b&b that is located conveniently to everything. It was a pleasure to us stay at Seven Bridges. Thank you Gunter and Eric.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JustyBled
Reviews.Content: We were on a business trip to NL and stayed in your hotel for one night. Amsterdam was crowded but the hotel was like the oasis of peace and calm. It has its soul and character and I would recommend it to everybody who likes to be treated like a very special guest and who seeks for a nice, quiet place in Amsterdam. Congratulations to the owners! Justina and Mateja

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EvergreenDean
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at Seven Bridges. As before, it is a wonderful little property. Gunter and Pierre are so nice, and it feels like you are a guest in their beautiful home. Stayed in room number 8 for my second time, as it is one of only two rooms that have two beds. This room faces the garden and is incredibly peaceful. With an 8 hour time change from the US, an afternoon nap seems to be in order for the first few days, and this garden room is an ideal spot. Just open the windows and listen to the birds sing with the gentle breeze blowing in...heaven. This time I travelled with two friends, so the third wheel got room number 3...also very charming and facing the garden. Tiny bathroom, but who cares? For the price, you are lucky to be getting your own bathroom in this town. We left Amsterdam to travel to Belgium mid-week, and ended up staying at the much more posh and expensive Banks Mansion for our final evening, as a one night stay at Seven Bridges is almost impossible to book for a weekend. Even with all the glitz and luxury, I missed my Seven Bridges. Elevators are over-rated, and I don't feel like I'm really in Amsterdam without dragging my bags up a narrow winding staircase. It's all part of the charm. The location is perfect...central to the whole town. Only one block off Rembrandt Square on a quiet charming canal. Close enough to all the action, but far enough away to enjoy peace and quiet whenever you need it. Breakfast is fantastic...best croissants and coffee this side of Paris...maybe better. I wouldn't be completely honest if I didn't gripe about how much planning it takes to get a room here. They won't take reservations for short stays more than 60 days out, and if you wait to book within 60 days you probably won't get it in. Their cancellation policy is strict and seems to be somewhat at their discretion, but it is worth the effort and planning. I guess with so many repeat customers and only 9 rooms, they can afford to have strict rules. I will definitely return, and it is now one of my top reasons to keep going back to Amsterdam. Thanks again for a wonderful stay. See you guys next year!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Seven Bridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spdykat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Bridges Hotel in March this year, for 2 nights. We were greeted by Gunter who showed us to the Garden Room. What a beautiful room! It was very sumptiously furnished with lovely antique furniture and a beautiful spread on the bed that I was almost afraid to sit on, and gorgeous drapes that covered windows looking out over the back garden. The bathroom was very efficiently designed and cheery. We never heard any other guests except in the morning when Gunter was delivering the trays of food. He doesn't know it but he saved my life by providing us so much wonderful food. It was too much to eat in one sitting, for us, so i made a little sandwich with the bread and cheese and later on that day while we were out touring around the tulip farm, I got very hungry and was able to nibble on the sandwich and not faint from hunger. Thank you Gunter. The hotel is immaculate and clean, and we would definitely recommend it to anyone seeking a lovely b&b that is located conveniently to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A very special place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Grandadbrian
Reviews.Content: Although my wife and I have selected where we stay on our trips by using tripadvisor this is the first time we have been so impressed by our four night stay that we felt we must share our experience with other independent travellers. For us Seven Bridges was in an ideal location being very peaceful, safe and beautiful yet within walking distance of all the major attractions. On the outside Seven Bridges looks just like a reasonable small hotel but we received a very warm welcome and were taken to the canal side basement apartment where we had agreed to spend our first night as the hotel was fully booked when we had first contacted them. We found the apartment charming being a good size and well furnished so much so that we were reluctant to leave it the next day to move into the main hotel next door. We had booked the small room in the attic which we had been pre-warned entailed climbing a very steep staircase that was not easy which was no exaggeration. The room itself however was very cosy and as described by other travellers well furnished with period pieces. It was a real treat to start our day by having a first class continental breakfast in this room although how they managed to get it up those stairs with it on a tray without breaking the fine china is a mystery. Above anything else what made this place so special was the service. We found everyone prepared to go that extra mile to ensure we were happy so much so that we felt as if we were staying with good friends. The final act was to find that when we arrived home my wife discovered she had left her favourite earrings somewhere. Within days they had been returned to her with a complement slip from the Seven Bridges Hotel.For us a very special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Ever Best”
Reviews.Author: Anlaw
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven Bridges is a surprise I planned for my wife and it did win me thousands of points! Right after my wedding, I came to Europe for two years training. Now having completed the course, I searched around for excitement and unique places that may bring her exhilirating experience. Hotel Seven Bridges is my big finding. I was lucky to get a canal view room (room 7) in January. Since then I waited for two long months until this big excitement came to us. My wife is a fan of western arts. I knew she would cherish everything in Seven Bridges. And yes, she actually loved it more than I had expected. From the moment we arrived, we got overwhelmed at how cozy and unique the hotel is. There was a charming fragrance from the two bunches of lily flower in the reception room. When we climbed up the 3 hundred years stairs, we saw two other rooms (room 5 and room 6) had been set ready for their guests. Both rooms are extremely nice and have its special lay-out and art collections. The lights were all on and the atmosphere was really cozy. My wife couldn't resist rushing in to take some photos. You could see how delicately the owners of the hotel are caring their properties. We were completely beyond words. When we arrived at our room, we immediately responded with a 'wow"! Everything was spotlessly clean and the canal view was so romantic. We loved the furniture, especially the pair of classic chairs. The best thing about Seven Bridges is the breakfast. It was the ever best breakfast I tasted in Europe - a huge one, with various breads, juice, coffee, tea, fruits... god! The owner sent the breakfast into our room by himself. That was the most tasteful coffee I had in my trips. We blieved that the host spends lot of time in designing and organizing the breakfast. We actually couldn't finish all the foods. What a pitty! Anyhow, I found that we did not need to eat lunch for this fabulous breakfast. It was also a great experience to talk with the owner. He is a very kind and respectable man, investing all his energy and brains in providing unique experiences for the Seven Bridges guests. We were happy and honored to learn from him that we were the first Chinese guests. I have seen some other 'big name' hotels in Amsterdam. In my view, they are just common, and located in the 'noisy' and crowded city center. The best thing about Amsterdam is its canals and the houses along the waters. Those communities are not far from city center as Amsterdam is not big, but very quiet and enjoyable. It was so interesting that we just turned a corner from the main street and suddenly entered the quiet neighbourhood. Seven Bridges is just located in the center of that quiet neighbourhood, with walking distance to all the major sites and a long dinning street just behind it. This also addes a lot of points to its overall impression to us. Having said all these, I want to clarify that business travellers with a vision to see big big lobbies, large large rooms, bath tube, smiling receptionist girl, elevators... better step away from this lovely hotel. Seven Bridges and Hilton are not on the same track! If Hilton is a rich business man, Seven Bridges is a real artist! Seven Bridges only belongs to those with a vision to seek the unique experience of arts in Amsterdam! Finally, I want to say that Amsterdam is a very safe city - just be careful of your handbags. At least we did not experience anything unpleasant walking around 10 o'clock at night around the city. Red light district is probably the safest because there are so many people there!

Reviews.Title: “Charmed”
Reviews.Author: rarchiles
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights with my wife in december and everything was very well, the hotel is near of almost everything and you have tram and buses around the corner. Besides the hotel is in a quiet street and you have a good rest after a tourist day. I prefer this kind of hotels instead the tipical chain hotel with no personality. The thing less good is the time for breakfast, too early overall for spanish people.., but like the quality is very good never mind too much. thank you for all

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: mlinsv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here in Mar. 2007. Our room overlooking the canal was very nice and clean and quiet. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, they lent us a wireless laptop everyday! Breakfast was served in our room and offered the freshest breads you can get. Its in a great location, convienent to all. Our host, Guenter was a great guy. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 1st class”
Reviews.Author: UKHerb
Reviews.Content: Seven Bridges is an Hotel with considerable charm and a unique ambience. It is a credit to the owners who seem to have put together a style of hotel that offers an opportunity for a relaxed stay in comfort. They are extremely helpful and the breakfast delivered to your room is a nice touch. Colin Garbutt & Dianne Wilcox

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Trade It For A Suite At The Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LeeFav
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this most amazing hotel just a few short weeks ago (mid-February) for my first trip to Amsterdam. I have never received such personal and friendly service! Each morning the owner Gunter brought us breakfast to our room; the array of food on fine china was so impressive we took a picture to bring back. Fresh fruit, warm assortment of breads, spreads, coffee and tea, freshly baked Croissants..getting up each morning out of our incredibly comfortable queen size bed was an absolute dream. Both my boyfriend and I have said that our honeymoon is going to be hard to plan after our undeniably perfect stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling Gem”
Reviews.Author: KeithRhodes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the charming Seven Bridges Hotel. What a treat. Cosy beautifully furnished room, lovely breakfast featuring warm croissants etc and a terrific location. There was even a superb bar a few yards away . Our hosts at the Seven Bridges were also super. They could not do enough for us. Just one final point. We had been told on booking that our room was the only available room but not once during our three night stay did we hear or see another human being in the building except our two hosts. A dash of mystery to add to the magic of our stay. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Our Secret weapon”
Reviews.Author: IOB
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s Amsterdam, itâ€™s January 2007, itâ€™s cold, itâ€™s wet, and the wind is truly amazing. Do we despair? Do we travel on to another country? No. Why you may ask do we continue to stay? Because we have the secret weapon to thwart even the dreariest of days. Yes, we have the: Seven Bridges Hotel. The Hotels Superpowers include: The Amazing Hosts: These incredible people are gifted with the powers of grace, charm, conversation, humor, patience,and the ability to know that you need something, even before you thought of it. The All Empowering breakfast: Who needs lunch when youâ€™ve eaten breakfast here. Super comfortable Room #7: Equipped with the power to welcome, & warm us. Elegantly appointed with tastefully chosen Antiques, and a very comfortable bed. The view of the gracious canal and bridges from the windows that run the full length of the room. Have the power of Relaxation. And finally, Itâ€™s Super Location: In a very nice part of the city, right around the corner form great Restaurants, Cheese, Meat and Wine markets, Shopping, And close (within walking distance, even in the rain) to the major Museums. So fellow travelers, when visiting Amsterdam remember: If this Hotel is so amazing on dreary days, what must it be like on beautiful sunny ones? My Husband and I intend to go back and find out.

Reviews.Title: “The Gem of the Canals”
Reviews.Author: Jbone-hu
Reviews.Content: We are a couple (both 29 years old), and this was our first time in Ams.The hotel location is perfect: close to everything (sights, shopping, public transport), but still peaceful. The room furniture is magnificent - choose your room on the hotel website. Everything is very clean (bathroom, etc). The breakfast is very nice, and enough for lunch also. The hotel is very romantic, but popular so book ahead. A little extra: the coffeeshop next door is very nice (small and personal), and it does not disturb the hotel at all. People who cannot climb: go for a first/ground floor room, or avoid the hotel (no elevator, but this is standard for building around there).

Reviews.Title: “a perfect, yes perfect, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Bunnyman
Reviews.Content: A perfect, yes perfect hotel. O.k., can anything truly be perfect? But as close as one can get, this hotel, and itâ€™s staff, are. We spent a wonderful and all to typical rainy winter week (January â€˜07) in Amsterdam, and the room, room 7, was such a wonderful and welcoming place to look forward to, to sit in and watch the beautiful views, (yes, there really are seven bridges) and to relax and really feel Amsterdam. We were lucky enough to see some of the other rooms during our stay, as a matter of fact as we came and went, Gunter, who is justifiably proud of the establishment and its contents, would ask, â€˜Would you like to see such and such a room, it is open at the momentâ€™, so we would. I can say that the website is very accurate in its representation of the rooms, both in size and decoration. All different, all lovely. Be aware that all small Amsterdam hotels have stairs, and few if any have elevators. These are old buildings, protected by law from changes such as elevators. It is truly part of the charm, and memory, of amsterdam to navigate the infamous stairs! And i mean navigate! We were treated to the wonderful breakfasts, tea in the afternoon, wonderful conversations with Gunter and staff, ideas of things to do and see, help finding restaurants, all of our needs met and more. One day, caught in a devastating downpour close to home, we rushed back to the hotel, soaking, no, dripping wet. Before i could get the key from my pocket, the door was flung open and there was Gunter, towels in hand, â€œCome in come in, letâ€™s get you dryâ€�, says he! When i asked how he could have possibly been at the door with towels waiting, he said he had just happened to look out the window and saw us running in the rain, and grabbed a couple of towels. I can not guarantee this type of experience for you, but this is typical of the level of service we had from our arrival to our departure. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Maria_K_GF
Reviews.Content: (Thank you very much for a great stay... Maria from Greece) "Seven bridges" is a perfect choice for someone who wants to visit Amsterdam, not for only one reason, but for all of the following: 1-it is located in the most beautiful canal of Amsterdam. 2- it is very close to all the important areas for someone to visit in Amsterdam. Yet it is very quite, so even if you take a canal room (that I strongly recomend) you will not have difficulties with the noise. 3- You can select exactly which room you want to book, since the photographs in the hotel's web site are showing exactly what you get. 4- If you take a room with breakfast, you will enjoy eating it in your room and, trust me, you will find it delicious... and the coffee was probably the best in Amsterdam... 5- Although the rooms have antique furniture, selected with much caring, I never thougth even for a minute, that they migth be dirty. From the first minute, I felt very comfortable. (I am a person that ussually dislikes the hotel rooms and bathrooms, and gets disgusted...Not in this hotel!!) 6-Last but not least, in the "seven bridges" hotel you feel that the owners gave all their good taste in creating this hotel and in running it. Everything is neat, put together with great love, so the result is perfect... I strongly suggest to stay in this hotel, if you want to get a very good taste of Amsterdam...

Reviews.Title: “Glad to have Discovered this Gem”
Reviews.Author: SusanScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had this Hotel recommended to us by our daughter who liked the look of it from outside and ventured in. She was staying at the Grand Hotel at the time which is a 5 star and she said that she would have preferred to be in the Seven Bridges. We were still impressed even after reading the good reviews on Trip Adviser. It was everything we wanted and more. The room we had was in the attic and you had to negotiate a lot of stairs but that was not problem to us. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean. I was disappointed that there was not a tea/coffee facility in the room. The breakfast was excellent and we couldn't manage to eat it all. The location of the hotel was fantastic with easy access to all the 'sites' and within walking distance of good shops and restaurants. We know where we will be staying on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious living”
Reviews.Author: Sydney-Sheila
Reviews.Content: In October 2006, I took my children on a European holiday and chose the Seven Bridges Hotel, Amsterdam, for our last two nights. I am partial to antiques and wonderful soft furnishings, which is why I chose this hotel.Another attraction was the age of the place...300 years old! It more than satisfied my expectations. We were given room 5, a large, magnificently furnished room to share, with its own balcony overlooking a private garden at the rear of the hotel, away from the noise and bustle of the canals. We had our own marble ensuite and a flat screen TV, which the children loved. Each morning, the owners brought a breakfast tray to our room, full of delicious fresh food, served on fine china....what a way to be pampered! The room was tastefully decorated with fine antiques and rich fabrics, Persian carpets and interesting artworks.We were right next to the canal, so made use of the canal cruises and enjoyed ambling along the cobbled streets and looking at galleries and shops. At night, we found a few restaurants nearby and were close to major shops and bus routes on the Rembrandtplein. Amsterdam is a joy to explore and we all loved the relaxed feel of the place and the tolerance of the Dutch to different customs. The owners were most accommodating in storing our luggage and calling taxis or advising us where to go and I would definitely like to return to this hotel.We paid 550 euros for two nights, which included the breakfast and all taxes.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ollypie
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our experience at Seven Bridges Hotel was A1. We arrived early in the morning and was expecting to be told that our room would not be ready until later that afternoon to our suprise we was informed by Pierre that although it was only 9:30 in the morning, that our room would be ready by 10:00 where upon we procceded to the local cafe for some refreshments. Once we returned Pierre took us to our room (Room C) which was more like a mini appartment, showed us around and gave us the keys. The room was equiped with cutlery, a fridge, tea and coffee facilities and a massive 32inch Tv. To be honest we spent most of the day in our room relaxing and enjoying the beautiful view of the cannel, and when we did venture out we came back to a lovely clean room, fresh towels and even our washing up had been done. We throughly enjoyed our time in Amsterdam and at the Seven Bridges Hotel, and cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit - Just as Good as Before!”
Reviews.Author: cuyk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Seven Bridges for a 3 night stay from 12/13/06 - 12/16/06. Our prior stay was 24 years ago!!, but the only reason we had not returned before was that the only other time we came to Amsterdam we could not get a booking. I love the fact you can select the room from the pictures - and since we were familiar with the hotel (last time staying on the top floor), we cleverly booked the room on the main floor (as we had several suitcases for a 1 month trip). The management was extrememly attentative and helpful and it made our "return trip" just as wonderful as the first! The guest that did not like the stay probably wouldn't have been happy anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: Abs67
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here between Christmas and New Year as a surprise birthday present for him and we loved it! The hotel is small and beautifully decorated in the unique style that the owners have put so much care and attention into. The breakfast is a real treat and is delivered to the room at whichever time you request. We stayed in room 6 which has excellent views of the canal, so our first evening was spent chilling out with the bottle of wine which was awaiting us in our room on arrival and watching the world go by along the canal. The location is perfect as you can walk to all parts of the city from the hotel. Didn't see much of the staff but they were friendly and helpful when we did! Would recommend this place to anyone, especially as a romantic treat!

Reviews.Title: “I am very cynical”
Reviews.Author: TommyM321
Reviews.Content: Yes, I was very skeptical after having read what seemed to be "too many" positive reviews of a little three star hotel in Amsterdam. I mean really, I thought, how great can this place REALLY be? Just so you know my experience and so this review can be placed in context, I have stayed in three star hotels all over europe, so I know exactly how three star quality and service can vary greatly. I will say that my experience at this hotel was excellent. A friend and I stayed in Room 8 December 13th through the 17th. The day I arrived there was some trouble connecting my computer to the wireless internet, so Erik ran up the stairs to correct the problem. After he left, it occurred again, so once again he cheerfully ran up the stairs and corrected the problem again. He then went downstairs, and 5 minutes later called up and asked if I would like some tea. He again cheerfully brought up an entire tea tray for me as I awaited the arrival of my colleague. (yes, the wireless internet ended up working for me quite satisfactorily) This is the way that guests are treated here. I found Gunter and Pierre to be similarly helpful with questions, and very kind and friendly in general. All in all these gentlemen are extremely professional in the way they run this hotel, and they clearly take a lot of personal pride in how they run the hotel. This is without a doubt one of the more pleasant experiences I have had in a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: N.YORKSHIRETRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived on Sunday 17th December 2006 for a 3 night stay in the Seven Bridges Hotel. We loved it even before the door opened. Pierre took our details gave us the key and he told us we were in room 8. Up some steep stairs, but the nice thing was the doors to the rooms that were not occupied were left open so you couldn't help but see how lovely the rooms were. When we arrived into our room it was just as lovely. The bathroom was very tastefully tiled. We unpacked and went out to look at the shops. The breakfast in the morning was brought to the room and was very fresh and filling. We would certainly use the Seven Bridges Hotel again and have no compunction recommending it to anyone. My only slight criticism would be that the mattresses were too soft and the beds too low but hey we are young and coped with it. Thanks to all at the Seven Bridges Hotel and Merry Christmas

Reviews.Title: “Justifiably sought-after accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MarkBishop
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay as a result of reading the positive reviews on this site, and don't regret it. The key points have been mentioned elsewhere but in summary they are: 1) it's a beautiful old townhouse overlooking one of the most attractive, but quietest, hotels, just a short walk to the Rembrantplein and two tram stops; 2) the decor is tasteful and the rooms contain attractive antiques; 3) the owners take an obvious pride in what they do. In answer to the couple of negative reviews I think people should be realistic in their expectations - given the age of the property it's unsurprising there are steep steps, there's no dining room and they don't welcome big groups or unruly kids. If you want to stay somewhere faceless and efficient go to the Ibis or similar.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTee
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at Seven Bridges (Nov 28 - Dec 4). We were in Room A, the smallest and least expensive room in the hotel. It is in the basement of the second canal house, and, at 110 E. per night (breakfast not included), is very economical by Amsterdam standards. We have been to Amsterdam 5 or 6 times and have stayed at a different hotel each time, All of them came well recommended on this website (each with a bad review or two amidst a ton of good reviews) and all have been nice -- imperfect in some way, but all very good in some way. Seven Bridges is one of the better places we have stayed, and we can recommend it without hesitation. If you want a traditional hotel room at a major inner city hotel with a fancy lobby, this is not the place for you. What Seven Bridges was for us was a quaint, local guesthouse, a very nicely appointed room in a very convenient and central location, very convenient to public transportation, yet on a relatively quiet street in a great neighborhood. It would have been nice to have a larger and more expensive room that was eligible for breakfast (particularly after reading the reviews of the breakfast) -- we would have gladly taken it had it been available -- but Room A was the only room available, and it was charming and perfectly acceptable, and made up for the lack of breakfast with a kitchenette. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was small but perfectly adequate, it was very clean and well appointed. The kitchenette had a fridge and a stove that came in very handy (we were able to eat a meal or two in, and reheat some great Indonesian food from Indrapura and Tempo Doloe, two excellent restaurants nearby). The pictures of Room A on the hotel's website are completely accurate. Apart from the room, the owners and the staff were helpful and courteous to a fault, and the only other room in the hotel which we were able to see (the owner showed it to us briefly on the morning we checked out) was much more substantial and charming as well. Perfect?? No, not perfect. Did we love it?? Yes. Is this a place we would consider returning to in the future? Yes, without a doubt. Our compliments to the owners for creating and maintaining such a wonderful B & B.

Reviews.Title: “A realistic review”
Reviews.Author: danevang
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in room b in the summer of 2006, 2 adults. Choosing this hotel after reading alot of good reviews on this site. First of all all the good things... the location is good. Except the location, theres really nothing good to say about our stay in room b. Theres NO AIRCONTION, the room is VERY SMALL, and the view was straight out to the street, walking people can look directly in the room, if curtains arent closed. That leaves you with NO VIEW. Theres NO BREAKFAST served in this room, thats due to an tiny tiny "kitchen" in this room i guess. Allthough there no proper diningtable avalible. And not atleast the BEDSHEETS WAS NOT CHANGED AT ALL, thats in a period of 6 nights, in the summer. The bedcarpet is a heavy thing, and wonder if this is ever washed. For a price of 135euros/night ($180/night) this hotelroom is to be reviewed as below average. This is a no go. And it has to be sayed, this is a honest review, no personal critisism of the owners of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rooster333
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my partner from a brief 2 night stay (13th-15th November 2006) at the Seven Bridges Hotel. What a gem to find in the heart of Amsterdam within easy walking distance of shops, restaurants and museums. We stayed in Room A which is the basement of the annex property 2 doors down. A front door opens into a small lobby and a second door enters into the room. I say room but it's more like a self contained studio flat with bedroom, adjoining kitchenette (sink, 2 ring gas hob, pots & pans, kettle, cutlery & crockery for 2), en-suite bathroom (sink, toilet and a huge walk-in shower - exellent for sharing!!!). Tea, coffee, sugar and powered milk are provided as this room does not come with served breakfast. The double bed was extremely comfortable and modern along with the other furnishings. There's a circular marble table with wicker chairs and cushions in the kitchenette and a glass coffee table with 2 cane chairs & cushions to the right of the bed. There's a TV to the right of the front door which has a number of channels including BBC. On the marble floor there are 2 colourful rugs. The photos of the room on the hotel website are just as you will find the place. Indeed, whilst we were checking out, Gunter was kind enough to show us Room 5 which is the "Jewel in the Crown" of this splendid place. The room is even bigger and more elegant than it looks on the website photos! The whole place was spotlessly clean and fresh towels were brought each day. At night, a doorlight comes on as you descend the few steps to the front door making it easy to see the keyhole. It felt just like it was "our" pied a terre. I thoroughly recommend staying at the Seven Bridges and we can't wait to go back.Our next trip hopefully will be for my birthday at the end of February 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Bridges of Happiness”
Reviews.Author: CristobalCrane
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived on a rainy night from Athens. Wet and tired we were greeted at the door by Gunter and Pierre. Right from the start we knew this was the best place to stay. They helped lug our suitcases up a winding stairwell to the third floor, into a marvelous room overlooking the canal below. What a relief after spending the day in taxis, a subway, a train, and an airplane. The room was charming and had a neat European atmosphere. Not overly decorated, yet visually pleasant. Our room was clean and tidy, with spotless windows. The furniture was stylish and the hotel provided a short history on some of the furnishings. The bathroom was larger than expected with a shower that had steamy hot water and room for two. We slept like logs on a very comfortable, large-sized bed. The radio on the nightstand was a delight. Breakfast was served in our room. A multitude of warm breads, cheeses, yogurt, fruit, and a pot of coffee made our stay the Seven Bridges Hotel complete. When we return to Amsterdam, we will request "our" room at the Seven Bridges Hotel. A fun and fabulous place to stay. Warmest regards, Chris Krajniak & Anne Kuhry

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Mother-Hobo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdan many times ( at least 10!) and this hotel was one of the best we have stayed in. Our bedroom was furnished with some lovely antiques ; a huge inlaid wardrobe and heavily laquered table. They added an elegant, romantic dimension to our trip. Our room was described as the Garden Room, accurately as we had access to our very own roof garden. Gunter and colleague were good hosts and brought a delicious breakfast to our room every morning.. I would check out the photos on thier website. I think they give a good flavour of what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Amsterdam . . .”
Reviews.Author: MomCanTravel
Reviews.Content: I've been to this fabulous city several times, but have never been able to get a room at this hotel. Happily, my husband and I were fortunate enough to stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of this November. Our room, with a wonderful view of the canal, was charmingly furnished, very comfortable and spotlessly clean. We felt so at home, it was very difficult to leave. Breakfast brought to our room was the ultimate luxury; the fresh breads, croissants, cheeses, and coffee were the perfect start to every day. The location was great: off the beaten path, but within 5 - 10 minutes of multiple restaurants, shopping, museums, etc. Pierre and Gunter are perfect professionals. They were friendly and informative, but never intrusive. What more can I say about an establishment that loaned us an umbrella, an extension cord, and a flower vase? We would go back next week if we could, and certainly plan to stay there again sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Docsam_kw
Reviews.Content: Let me start of by saying what a wonderfuly charming place this hotel is, me and my wife stayed there in October for 5 days and we had an exceptional time. We stayed in room #5 which was quite big by European standards and tastefully decorated with antique furniture that gave you the impression you were a Lord living in the 1700s! Yet there was a large LCD T.V and wireless internet connection for your convenience. The hotel initself is quite small, with only a handful of rooms, there is no dining room but that wasnt a problem becasue we enjoyed breakfast delivered to our room every morning, and might i say what a delicious plentyful breakfast it was. Location, well, you couldnt ask for a better location, 5 minutes walk from Rembrandt square where you will find plenty of activity, pubs, clubs, dining areas and all the shops your desire. It is however just far enough were you can get a goodnight's sleep over the weekend when the square is packed with partiers. The tram station is also a three minute walk away which makes it very convient, but in all honesty, we did most of our sightseeing by foot, the hotel is quite centrally located to many of the touristic areas. There are only a handful of people working in the hotel which is quite pleasant as you get an immediant sense of warmth and hospitality especially from Gunter the hotel manager, who delivered breakfast to our room himself! The only negative point i will say is the staircase leading to the rooms, it really is quite steep, so i wont recomment any seniors with hip arthritis problems to stay there as they will have a difficult time climbing up and down the stairs, also, if your wife makes you pack very large suitcases, then that will be an issue as well!!! Otherwise, i highly recommend the hotel, particularly room #5 that had a lovely padio that overlooked a garden, we had our coffee everymorning on the padio enjoying the cool breeze. I highly recommend this hotel for honeymooners, couples, tourists and would definitely stay there again, only this time, i wont listen to my wife and i'll show up with only a carry on piece of luggage!! Dr. & Mrs. Aziz October 2006

Reviews.Title: “Stay away !”
Reviews.Author: hansthomasoddsen
Reviews.Content: Tried to book 4 double rooms, but he manager didnâ€™t want us at he the hotel. This is what he said: â€œThe problem with a group of people is that there is a chance that they might disturb the other guests, simply by talking with each other in the hallway, visiting each other in the rooms, etc.â€� We are all 33 years old, and not a bunch of teenagers. We really wanted to stay at this hotel, so it was very sad that they didnâ€™t want us there.

Reviews.Title: “The Quintessential Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lu1822
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room C in early September. We did our homework and knew this was someplace special. The owners and management obviously care deeply for their guests' comfort and the quality of their experience. Our room did not come with breakfast so we had to beat the street to find it, but we knew this going in. There was a coffee pot that heated water for instant coffee in the room. We passed on that....a drip coffee maker would have been preferred. I never saw any of the other rooms, so I don't know if I would have preferred one of the ones that came with breakfast or not. I loved our room because of the incredible ambience and amazing views of the canals. Great care was taken to accessorize and decorate it. It was wonderful in that respect! This is a very old, fine building typical of the lovely, historic canal homes of the area. As others said, there are some very, very steep stairs to climb unless you're on a ground floor. We didn't mind, since that meant we had a better vantage point to watch the boats go by. The mosquitos were indeed vicious. The management had citrinella repellent out and an efficient room fan. It was simply too hot to sleep with windows closed. I might suggest inexpensive mosquito netting hung from the ceiling or something. I don't think my hubby got one bite, so, no they really don't like everyone. The bed was comfy and the location was supreme. I'd visit again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like You Live in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LittleRhody1
Reviews.Content: Perfect retreat in a quiet but central area of the city, Seven Bridges makes you feel like you're at home. Breakfast is served in your room where there is table space in front of a beautiful picture window. Room 8 overlooked gardens, but all the rooms had beautiful views. Beds were very comfortable. Evenings were quiet for sleeping. Canal location is gorgeous. The best thing were the hosts as they were as accomodating as possibe - gave guidance on restaurants, provided laptop for use for free internet, provided a great fan when needed(perfect for noise masker and cooling as we like the room cold). You get your own key to the front door so you can come and go as you please. Drawbacks are the very steep stairs (almost ladder like) and the lack of air conditioning (though most places in Amsterdam do not have AC). But overall, the room quality, cleanliness, breakfast and hospitality make this a true bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful direct canal views!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu59
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room and wonderful direct view of the Seven Bridges canal. Nice location although quite a few blocks to the downtown shopping and major restaurants. Nevertheless, in nice weather it is a very nice and scenic walk through the canals and gorgeous buildings with unusual architecture. Word of caution: there are no elevators in the hotel and it is a very, very steep and narrow climb up and down the stairs if you have to carry your luggage! We were fortunate that the owner was very charming and assisted us with our luggage but if he had not been there it would not have been easy. Overall, a very nice experience primarily due to the owner going out of his way for us and the beautiful direct canal views from our room.

Reviews.Title: “fine small hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgsolo
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 children aged 10 and 15) stayed at the 7 Bridges for 4 days in July. The hotel is the quintessential Amsterdam canal house- charming, authentic, perfectly located- walking distance to every major attraction. The room was clean, comfortable, spacious- no air conditioning, lovely outdoor terrace. It was the only room that could accommodate 4 people. Excellent breakfast served in our room daily. Helpful staff- stored our luggage until room was ready. This is not a modern "American style" hotel. but for those seeking to experience the true Amsterdam, this was a wonderful place to stay. My children thoroughly enjoyed it, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: yankinuk
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam and we couldn't be happier with our experience at the Seven Bridges. The hotel is charming with a capital C. The owners' care and pride is evident everywhere, and we enjoyed staying in a centuries-old canal house, with its typical steep staircase. We were in room 10, which is a smaller attic room under picturesque steep eaves. The double bed was incredibly comfortable and we slept well. Coming from the noise and bustle of London, we found Amsterdam in general and the Seven Bridges in particular very quiet and restful. The hotel is in a very lovely part of the city, on one of the prettiest canals in central Amsterdam. We walked everywhere and found the hotel convenient for all the "must see" sights. When it was time to go to the airport, the owner called us a cab which came right away. Breakfast was brought to our room promptly both mornings, with a courtesy phone call five minutes before to let us know it was on the way. We couldn't finish all the plentiful, lovely food - several types of bread, yogurt, meat, cheese, orange juice and delicious coffee. What a terrific way to start the day! We would definitely return to the hotel - it's a unique, special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: JohninSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: I just enjoyed a three night stay at Seven Bridges. I must agree with all of the positive comments made by other recent guests. A lovely little hotel, elegant yet unpretentious, within walking distance of all major attractions and shopping therapy. Amsterdam has to be one of the greatest walking cities in Europe, and this is an ideal base for the active traveler. I would recommend adding some kind of informational folder in the rooms, with the history building, hotel services and descriptions of local services and amenties, standard fare for an accomodation of this class. I like Room 9 at the very top and Room 5 if you are into antiques and mirrors.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Adsa
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break at Seven Bridges. Perfect location, very picturesque, quiet, yet in easy strolling distance to main attractions and plentiful cafes and restaurants. A real find, beautifully furnished room - stayed in room 5 with its french windows overlooking the garden, with the added bonus of an outside seating area. Peaceful surroundings, a perfect place to unwind after a day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: marta&terry
Reviews.Content: Seven Bridges is truly a special hotel. We were anticipating the beautiful period decor and picturesque canal location, but the charm of our room and the warm hospitality of GÃ¼nter and Pierre surpassed expectations. My husband and I were there for four days in September following a couple of weeks on safari in Kenya. Our immaculate, comfortable room was a great place to reacclimatize and a luxurious way to begin and end our days of sightseeing walks and boat excursions through lovely Amsterdam. It is located on a quiet street and canal yet is convenient to good restaurants, cafes and the museums. I would never stay anyplace else. Thank you Pierre and GÃ¼nter for making our first visit to your beautiful city a wonderful memory.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lauraanddavid
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a three night stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel. It was simply wonderful. I had consulted this website before booking the trip as suprise birthday present for my boyfriend. I almost expected to be let down on arrival because it seemed impossible that it could live up to the rave reviews. But it did. And it did it in such a charming, effortless way that this was the most relaxing holiday I think I have ever had. In fact, contrary to the review previous to this one, I don't think I've ever had a better night's sleep. Our room (number 8) was charming, clean and very well decorated. We were served the finest breakfast in our rooms and the hotel staff were incrediably accomodating. The even managed to satisfy my hunger with delicious jams and breads so that I was not at all envious of my boyriend's coffee and croissants which I cannot eat because of an allergy. The location of the hotel was also top notch and I wish that I had been able to stay for longer. It is not possible to give this hotel anything but 5 out of 5. If you do decide to stay there, please do not be put off by the two beds in room 8 rather than one double, they are a very generous size and are simply a slightly smaller version of a double.

Reviews.Title: “What a very special hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JanFr
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel for people who appreciate staying in a genuine canal-side house rather than a plastic hotel that you could find in any city in the world. The staff were very kind and helpful, the rooms delightful, breakfast delicious and the whole experience one I will remember for ever. We went there for a very special birthday - we loved Amsterdam - and a stay at the Seven Bridges Hotel just made the whole trip perfect. We spent a lot of time just savouring the view and watching the comings and goings on the street and on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Seven Bridges”
Reviews.Author: pgktraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Seven Bridges for 3 nights in August. The location is outstanding. The friendliness, service and helpfulness of the owners/staff are unparalelled. We especially enjoyed Gunther's restaurant recommendations! Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. Cleaning service was excellent and discreet. Breakfast was simple but hearty, allowing us to focus on our sightseeing and excellent dinners, rather than looking for b-fast elsewhere. Overall a great experience, which we will highly recommend to our friends and family! Seven Bridges recently appeared in an article about Amsterdam in National Geographic Traveler (in an issue we picked up in the airport on the way there) so book early!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: helen102
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this gem of a hotel for two nights and I wish it could have been longer. We booked it on the strength ot all the good rewiews on Trip Advisor and I can honestly say it surpassed our (already high) expectations. The owners are really so nice and make you feel welcome as soon as you arrive. The room was gorgeous and so comfortable. The location is great, on a lovely quiet canal but just two minutes walk to a great selection of restaurants and bars. The breakfast, which is served in your room on lovely china was really good and kept us going until after lunchtime each day. All in all, we can find no fault with this lovely hotel and will definately stay there again when we return to Amsterdam. It definately was a major part of our brilliant weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: carrotsarered
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying here with a friend. The hotel is lovely, well decorated and very very clean. We both really liked our room- with two double beds it was big enough to give us both some privacy and we had a beautiful view over the garden. We couldn't belive how quiet it was especially as we were so near to the bars, coffee shops and places to eat. We slept very well after all the walking and sight seeing. We were, like other people, in awe of the breakfasts being delivered up all those stairs. Thank you to Gunter and Pierre for looking after us so well. We will definitely be returning again for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Gay Pride visitors”
Reviews.Author: marty.rio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seven Bridges during this year Gay Pride Weekend. This small, charming, friendly hotel met all of our expectations. The room, view, location and communication with staff were all amazing. We stayed in the room no. 6 with canal view, equipped with nice pieces of furniture and huge behind the bed mirror. Hotel has a absolutely perfert location for Gay Pride visitors, just one hop to canal parade, to street party, also to all other city attractions, everything is within 10 minutes walking distance. I was really surprised, how quite was the street and the room even during this very busy days and nights, when thousands of visitors are dancing on the nearby streets. Equipped with our own key from the building, we were our own masters, not slaves of receptionist or consierge, as in some big chain hotels. Breakfast served each morning in the room is a really athletic achievement for Gunter (I admire you:-)) Sufficient amount of coffee, tea, ham, cheese, juice, jogurt, bread, rolls. We only missed some fruit or vegetables, but understand because of limited space on the breakfast tray. We were satisfied in all aspects and hope to come again, Martina and Kristina

Reviews.Title: “Two Germans at Seven Bridges plus unusual sightseeing tips”
Reviews.Author: Gabriette
Reviews.Content: This has been a wonderful stay, for one night only - unfortunately. We truly enjoyed the unique atmosphere, the two owners' kindness, and for sure the beautiful room which is full of antiques. Located in the centre of the town these two neat and knowledgable guys will fill you in with any information you might need for making your trip to Amsterdam as much fun as can be. One of them being German helped a lot in this respect. As an unexpected add-on a Tibetan Buddhist center is right next door where you can join meditation sessions and find a well-assorted bookshop. What was the biggest surprise was the fact that in two minutes walking distance you will find Amsterdam's most beautiful garden as part of Geelvinck Hinlopen Huis museum (-). This is still an insder info as this musuem only opened in Feb 06. Have a coffee in the mystic garden and enjoy chatting with one of Amsterdam's "Grand Dames" who is running the museum and actually is inhabiting it. Coming from Hamburg we are familiar with high priced parking lots. But man Amsterdam is cheeky. They will ask EUR 3,40 per hour ! So if you are lucky (as we were) to find a parking lot right in front of Seven Bridges, have a lot of small change ready to feed this parking machine. It will not accept bank notes, but only coins. So, if you want to stay over night ... ask at Seven Bridges for not as high piced alternatives. Having said that it's been a great trip and we will come back definitely to enjoy Seven Bridges and this beautiful city. Best wishes to the two of you and to all who are lucky to stay for a night or longer at Seven Bridges. Gabriele & Eric

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews said it was”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire user
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in July and it was truly excellent. We had room 4 which overlooks the garden and seems to be really quiet It was very hot in Amsterdam and it was a godsend to be at the back of the building away from the direct sun. The room was clean, the breakfast excellent, and the staff all very helpful. I would not hesitate to go back again or recommend others to go there. The hotel is well located in a nice quite canal area, within walking distance of all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JubileePhil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Amsterdam after five nights at the Seven Bridges Hotel. I booked the room in April after reading rave reviews on Tripadvisor and was surprised to read a negative review just before we set off in July. I have to say I cannot understand how this hotel and particularly our room (no 7) could get anything other than a fab review.
