The room is large and extremely tastefully furnished and the view from the windows which form one whole side of the room is stunning as it looks over the canal and you can see some of the seven bridges. The location is fantastic only a short walk from Rembrandtplein and a choice of trams to any part of the city. The breakfast, served in your room on Villeroy and Boch china, is more than you need with superb coffee and enough to keep you going all day until evening with perhaps a very light snack through the day. I cannot recomment this hotel more highly. Check the web site sevenbridgeshotel.nl the chairs in room 7 are now wonderful Louis XV fauteuils purchased recently at Christies.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: navinNanaimo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a week in Amsterdam. We found this hotel through a travel book on Amsterdam and then verified the reviews through Trip Advisor prior to booking. There was no room available in the hotel so they put us up at an apartment belonging to the hotel next door. It was a studio suite with bathroom (shower), kitchen sink, stove and fridge, double bed and T.V. It was very comfortable and private. We never saw anyone from the hotel unless we wanted to. If we had any questions, we popped over to the main hotel. There was daily maid service too but unlike the hotel, no breakfast. Initially I was disappointed that they wouldn't be offering breakfast but in the end it was okay because it gave us the freedom to eat when and what we wanted and we had the fridge to store any groceries we bought. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam. The proprietor, Mr. Glaner is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this extraordinary hotel. I have stayed there twice, May 99 and June 06. The rooms are the most beautiful examples of the long tradition of Dutch excellence in decoration using a charming ecclectic style. Each room is unique with beautiful oriental rugs, leather chairs, elaborate tilework, and mirrors which are cleverly placed to reflect architectural details. The excellent service is discreet, the rooms VERY clean. A true Amsterdam experience located two blocks from Rembrandtplein on the most beautiful canal in the city. I just would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: searly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, its in a gorgeous location, overlooking the canal and easy walking distance to anywhere you will likely want to go to, with many bars and resturants nearby. We stayed in room 9, which even though was at the top of a severe staircase (i did feel sorry for them who ever brought our breakfast up each morning, thank you Gunter) was absolutly charming, clean and everything you needed. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and we really loved staying at this hotel, which made our stay even more enjoyable. Thank you Seven Bridges Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: chatham1
Reviews.Content: Besides a terrific location (near lots of good restaurants, museums, yet quiet and peaceful)and a very friendly and helpful staff, staying at the Seven Bridges was like having our own small apartment. We had accommodations with two beds and two rooms (plus frig to keep food/drink available). Can't imagine a more inviting place to stay in Amsterdam!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic period hotel in the heart of Amsterdam, very nice rooms and freindly staff, we especially enjoyed our casul breakfast in our room, over looking the canal, which was ample enough to set us up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Charm & sophistication-Hotel Seven Bridges-Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ofthespirit
Reviews.Content: June 4th,2006 Reviewer: From New York City Just returned from a 5 day stay at Hotel Seven Bridges-a beautiful historic canal house very centrally located (an easy walk to Anne Frank ,House, Van Gogh Museum & other major Amsterdam attractions). We stayed in room #7 which had large windows overlooking a canal. The room was quite spacious and contained lovely antique furniture as well as a roomy bathroom which had beautiful white tiles accented with a floral design and the floor was done in a rustic ceramic(probably Italian) tile-this gave it all a very clean look & cleanliness is the operative word for the entire room. We loved being served our breakfast in our room while we sat in plush leather chairs at the exquisite marble table. The innkeepers, Gunter & Pierre, couldn't be more accommodating and they take great pride in the decor they have created. We had an opportunity to see room #5-which is like a palace! It's quite large & is appointed with some gorgeous antiques. It also has it's own garden space where one can sit & have breakfast & plan the day. There are also some great restaurants in the area within a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel”
Reviews.Author: mildew808
Reviews.Content: Despite being aprehensive after a bad review three days before going, we really enjoyed our stay in room 6. The views of the canal from the room were gorgeous, the unusual Art Deco room was beautiful and very clean. We loved having breakfast served in our room where we could watch the world go by at our leisure through the huge picture window. Very handy for bars, coffee shops and restaurants yet a lovely peaceful location. No smoking (understandable given the standard of the furnishings) so we enjoyed our morning nicotine outside taking in the views. Staff were very friendly and accomodating,staying late at reception due to our 10pm landing and also arranged a taxi for our return flight. We look forward to staying again. Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Seven Bridges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself, a travel agent, and 2 friends stayed at Seven Bridges Hotel for a week recently. We were not disappointed. We stayed in #5, the biggest & most special room with a private terrace & to-die-for antigues. Breakfast ( brewed coffee, croissants, assorted fresh breads, cheese, meat & yogurt) brought to us each morning & served on real china. Antiques are amazing. Big bathroom with good-sized shower and PLENTY of hot water. Our hosts, Gunter & Pierre, showed us all 8 of the rooms and we thought they were all just charming. Location 1 block from Rembrandtplein is another plus. You can walk just about anywhere from here. Too bad the weather was rainy, windy & cold but we still had a very memorable and enjoyable experience and recommend Seven Bridges for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Oasis in Vibrant Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: exmarsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seven Bridges for six nights in early May of 2006. Our room, Apartment C, was not in the hotel itself, but rather in the annex two doors away. The only drawback of staying in the annex is that you do not get breakfast. But the apartment has a small refrigerator and you can purchase breakfast fixings in the neighborhood, thus having exactly what you want for breakfast whenever you want it. Cups, glasses and silverware are provided as well as a water heater and instant coffee. The primary advantage of staying in the annex is total independence. Upon arrival you are given a key to enter the building and one for the apartment, allowing you to come and go as you please. Someone miraculously appears while you are out to leave the place spotless every day. There is no contact with staff next door unless you need them. They kindly provided us with an adapter plug when we realized that we had left ours at home and forwarded our telephone messages efficiently. Check in and out was handled quickly and easily. The apartment itself is lovely â€“ located on the first floor up a typically narrow Amsterdam staircase. The sitting room is nicely furnished and has three large windows with a beautiful view of the charming canal below. The bedroom is separated from the sitting room by a glass partition and has a good firm queen size bed. The bathroom has all the needed conveniences. Several large mirrors make the place feel even larger than it is. The neighborhood is ideal with friendly locals (both human and feline) and plenty of excellent restaurants. The hotel is within easy walking distance of several museums, the Opera and tram lines that will take you anywhere you might want to go. At night, it is very quiet and we had no trouble sleeping even with the windows open. We had ideal weather, but a possible drawback in the summer might be mosquitoes. There were a few in early May and if the quantity were larger, one would want to keep the windows closed â€“ a possible drawback on a hot day. So why didnâ€™t I give the place â€œfive starsâ€�? Small quibbles. Although there are two dressers with drawers sufficient to store your clothes, there is no real closet and little space to hang things up â€“ a small inconvenience during an extended stay. Also, it would have been nice if the bars of soap were somewhat larger. The tiny bars (that seem to vanish after one shower) are okay for a one or two night stay, but larger bars would have been appreciated for six days. Might I also suggest that shampoo be provided â€“ a not unreasonable amenity to expect for the price? All in all, highly recommended. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning! May, 2006”
Reviews.Author: scuba-diver-ca
Reviews.Content: This could be a charming hotel. It is conveniently located by some of the most popular art museums. Our room overlooking the canal had a great view. And the staff were helpful. Also, the breakfast brought to your room added a romantic touch (although the food was nothing special). But it needs a good cleaning (especially the carpets) and it is looking worn and a bit shabby. If this place wants to keep its reputation as one of the top guest house/small hotels, it needs to start working!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, charming place”
Reviews.Author: Artistsue
Reviews.Content: All of the nice things we read about Seven Bridges were totally true. The location is lovely on one of the prettiest canals and there are a number of good restaurants a very pleasant walk away. I chose a room not facing the canal which was a good choice during the noisy Queen's Day festivities but I'm sure that canal views would be truly delightful at any other time. We were on what we Americans call the third floor and the room (#8) was very quiet and comfortable. The rooms we saw all have charm and are well-furnished; we only wish ours had had a mini-fridge. Gunter and Pierre were very gracious hosts, helpful and fun to talk to. We really enjoyed our stay at this gem of a small hotel and would return very happily. I wish I could get that raisin bread with the marzipan here!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This charming small hotel is run by friendly hosts with excellent taste. The locationn is excellent , the decor eclectic and charming, the service personal. I wish I could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and lovely!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JacarandaSpirit
Reviews.Content: Luckily I grabbed a Lonely Planet guide while in Paris for our last minute trip to Amsterdam and this hotel was recommended. Even last minute we only paid $140.00 per night (two full size beds) and it was well worth it. Such a charming place to stay - quiet, clean and hospitable. The morning breakfast delivered to your room on pretty china is such a wonderful addition; it included coffee or tea, juice, various breads and crossant plus cheese, yogurt and smoked turkey!!! In the cold of winter the heated towel bar in the bath was a huge plus. Some of the rooms have canal views and antiques. Its a short walk from Rembrandt Square and if you are so inclined, Barneys coffeehouse has expanded and there is a new location right next door which is very classy and fun. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, atmosphere, romantic”
Reviews.Author: arbeedc
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in a canal-facing room on the top floor of Seven Bridges in January. The room was charming, the view enchanting, the location perfect, the hosts unobtrusive. We absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and private”
Reviews.Author: travel_to_live
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate enough to stay at the Seven Bridges five times in the past six years, and I would not want to stay anywhere else in Amsterdam. A canalhouse-turned-boutique hotel, the Seven Bridges is situated in a landmark district and lovingly decorated with early-twentieth-century antiques. While it has the feel of a particularly comfortable private home, the location just off Rembrandtplein is wonderfully central and convenient. The Seven Bridges offers an illusion of seclusion in the midst of the city's metropolitan center.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel - quiet, elegant, and friendly. Our room was full of wonderful antiques, and was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was brought to us on bone china every morning. The area is chic and central, but at night the streets are silent. We stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “reserve in advance and stay for 5 days!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Imagine that you want to make reservations for 3 nights in a hotel and you check availablity 4 months ahead. The hotel tells you that bookings can only be made 2 months in advance, so you go back 2 months before your scheduled arrival date. Quess what? Fully booked!! Oh yeah they forgot to tell that bookings in excess of 4 days can be made anytime of the year... How would you feel? The hotel where this happened? Right: The seven bridge hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our new home in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are usually in Amsterdam (on holiday) two to four times a year. The owners of our usual hotel, Els and Yvo of the Hotel Agora, sold their hotel in October of 2005. So we decided, at their recommendation, to try the Seven Bridges Hotel. We were just there a few days ago for five nights. We have found our "new hotel!!!" Pierre Keulers and Gunter Glaner, the owners, have a beautiful, small, intimate hotel. They provide excellent service and are very helpful. The rooms are incredible--oriental rugs, comfortable chairs and beds, and all are imaginatively decorated. The canal side rooms have wonderful views and the garden side rooms have green, soothing views. A huge breakfast is brought to your room at the time you request on fine china. On arrival, we paid cash for all five nights. On our departure, Pierre and Gunter both saw us off and gave us our receipt with wishes for a safe journey. On our future journeys, the Seven Bridges will be our home in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Started the year out the right way.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother-in-law and I started out the new year at Hotel Seven Bridges. From the moment we arrived, we were treated courteously, yet always given our space. The entire staff was always ready and willing to accomodate us with various requests, i.e. making restaurant reservations, checking into concert performances and ticket availability, serving all breakfasts in our larger room and exactly when we requested it, etc. It was a joy to begin the year in one of our favorite cities and be able to retreat to the cosy warmth and welcome of the Seven Bridges. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It shows that Pierre Keulers & Guenter Glaner, Owners of this charming small hotel care about their guests comfort while staying at their creation! I highly recommend this Hotel after I stayed there for 4 nights. The helpfulness, friendliness and commitment I received from Pierre and Guenter are truely a sign of hospitallity and love for their profession. When choosing a place to stay, I look for the following: Honesty Safety Helpfulness A place of comfort and ambiance yet in a private manner. I am not a nigth owl rather an early bird exploring to the fullest what each city has to offer at day time and early evening. Than I like to relax and feel at home while lounging in a comfortable room. Hotel Seven Bridges definitly is the place to feel at home. The breakfast provided and brougth to the room keeps you filled for the day to explore the magic of this city. I hightly recommend Hotel Seven Bridges. And Yes, I will be back! Thank You Guenter and Pierre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, lovely people, charming room, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We travel to Amsterdam frequently to visit our son, daughter-in-law and new grandson. The location is perfect. The room is lovely, clean, spacious and quiet, we enjoyed the view of the garden. Pierre, Gunther and Eric are lovely, always, pleasant, always there to help and yet they are private people as we are. The breakfast is delicious and served in your room which is very nice. We had absolutely no problems with our reservations, with our payments or anything else. The whole experience was a happy one. We were so complimentary about our stay, our family wanted to come and see our room. Thank you Pierre, Gunther and Eric. It is truly one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in and for that reason, it is unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Seven Bridges Hotel is a beautiful little place, an excellent location, with exceptional staff. The rooms are both quaint and eclectic, and many have canal views. The rooms are very clean, and were well attended to each day of our stay. The owners were incredibly helpful, and made our trip to Amsterdam a complete pleasure. The price of the rooms was a value compared to some of the other rooms available in other hotels. As some have noted, it is sort of a mix between a hotel and B&B, and is very quiet, with broadband internet connections in every room, some with mini-refrigerators. I have to admit that when I ran across this website, I read through some of the reviews below out of curiosity, 95% of which are quite accurate. As far as the ones stating that the owners had tried to double-charge them... Well, I have a very, very difficult time believing this now that I've stayed at the Seven Bridges. The staff of the Seven Bridges was incredibly helpful, especially given our unique circumstances, and I'm certain that they would never, ever intentionally try to cheat someone. I highly recommend the Seven Bridges, and if I am ever in Amsterdam again, I will go out of my way to assure that I can again stay at this exceptional place.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Holland”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when I stay in Amsterdam (I regularly go to Europe for business). The nicely furnished rooms and special breakfasts only add to its charm and provide a real break from the run-of-the-mill megahotels I usually stay at. If you want peace and quiet, try to take one of the rooms in the back. If you like watching tourists passing by beneath your window, take a room on the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection On the Canal”
Reviews.Author: DocNY
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Seven Bridges. Since we visit Amsterdam--one of the truly wonderful cities in Europe--at least twice a year, it won't be the last. If we're lucky. I write this rave review with some concern--concern that the next time we try to book the hotel, TripAdvisor readers will already have snared MY room! This hotel has two owners/managers (Pierre & Gunther) and several assistants, including the superb Eric. They somehow manage to care for the guests (and I talked with seven other guests over our week's stay) as if they were house guests. When I requested a firmer pillow it was followed up. And when a change of linens meant a change to a duvet, Pierre asked if we were comfortable with the new bed treatment. At the same time, they are not obtrusive in the least--one could stay there and have a conversation only at check-in and check-out if that would be preferred. The room service breakfasts were just about perfect--we wouldn't change a thing. And the cleanliness of the individually-designed and furnished rooms was at the ultimate world standard--namely, the Dutch standard! Now, remember fellow TripAdvisor members--PLEASE DON'T BOOK WHEN I WANT TO BOOK AT THIS EXCELLENT HOTEL IN AMSTERDAM!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again and Again”
Reviews.Author: wampolch
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam a half-dozen times in the last few years, and Seven Bridges is where I will stay the next time and the time after that. The location is nearly unbeatable. The view from canal-side rooms is unbeatable. The rooms are charming, spotless and spacious. The price was right. I have paid a lot more for standard Amsterdam charmless fare, but I won't again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of raves about this hotel and thought it was going to be something really special. I think the problem is that some rooms are quite a lot better than others and so you're taking a chance that you will get one of the good ones. Ours was right on the top flooor and it was quite nice, on the small side but quite cosy. The bathroom wasn't much to write home about, there was no bath (I think there are showers only at this hotel), and no toiletries. The assorted bread rolls at breakfast (there is no restuarant so its breakfast in bed every day!) were very good. As a previous reviewer has mentioned it would have been nice to have juice. My partner doesn't drink tea or coffee in the morning and although we requested juice instead for him it never came. There was no explanation and this happened twice. I think maybe they meant to buy juice but forgot. So although the attention to detail in this hotel is good in some areas such as eclectic furnishings, in other areas they just don't seem bothered. As I paid Â£100 per night for the room it wasn't good value for money for me- small room & poor service. I think this hotel is coasting on its past reputation as an undiscovered treasure, but as it has become more popular they have become complacent.

Reviews.Title: “dishonest management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Seven Bridges for a few nights in October 2004. The evening before we departed I went to the owner and said I wanted to settle our bill as we were leaving early the next morning. He said he did not have time to do it then. The next morning , October 8, 2004, as we were leaving for the airport to return home to Portland, I went to the owner and paid him the 240Euros due. I paid him in cash and asked for a receipt. He acted indignant and said he was out of receipts and did not have time to go get more since he had to run the place alone. As we had a plane to catch, I was unable to do anything other than write down the amount I paid him in my spiral notebook. I signed a blank VISA paper when we checked in and I was told it would be destroyed if I paid cash,WHICH I DID. Imagine my surprise when VISA said I owed for three nights lodging and they had a signed receipt for 10/21/04......ten days after we were home and back at work! I think the Seven Bridges acted fraudulently and advise youto be ware.

Reviews.Title: “Charming with Character”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravellerHK
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam at the beginning of October 2004 and stayed here for 4 nights. Our room on the 1st floor has a nice view looking out into the street and canal. The other bedroom in the 1st floor (which we managed to peek through as it was being cleaned) was much larger and has nice views over a garden. As it is a quiet area (and yet only one block from Rembrandtplein), there was not too much noise from the streets to be a bother. The room itself was decent and spacious although there could be more amenities in the bathroom (just small pieces of soap). The breakfast in the room is a nice treat (but could be better with juice). Those steep stairs were a bit tough with the luggage but I think you find these in almost all such places in Amsterdam. It is a nice charming place with character. We didn't encounter any other guests during our stay (which for us is a good thing) and the owners were friendly without being overly so. Recommended for someone who likes something other than a large chain hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “lovely secret in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the seven bridges is a wonderful experience. the staff is friendly and helpful. the breakfast is amazing and the rooms are clean, spacious and private.we stayed there a few times and enjoyed every one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay and while away the time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Amsterdam for some 12 years now for a yearly convention in September. I was lucky to read a write-up about the Hotel for my first trip to this lovely City, and can heartily recommend it. (Of course, perhaps too effusive praise will make rooms even more difficult to rent....!) Pierre & Gunther are the calm, welcoming hosts. They do just enough to make you feel at home, but don't pry or try for any forced cheeriness. I recommend the 2nd floor of the second building. You can sit in the perfect little drawing room with sun streaming through the window, with the peaceful Reguliersgracht in front, viewable through the trees. If you enjoy peace and romance, this Hotel is for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Seven Bridges Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Reguliersgracht 31, Amsterdam 1017LK, The Netherlands
